Your spy stayed up all night and managed to eavesdrop on some conversations from the inn: the travelers are on the run. They are said to have committed certain crimes in their country on the other side of the desert. The army has been sent after them and they are already preparing their route to continue their escape from justice.\n\nWhat is the best solution?
Lock up travelers.

We just received a message from the King. Dangerous criminals have escaped from the prison of the neighboring country. There are about ten of them and they stole a precious object. Do you think it was the travelers who were here a few days ago?
Send a message to the King.
Keep it to ourselves.
I will send a message to the king to let them know that they have passed through our village. Maybe they'll be able to find them.
Sire! The Royal Army has managed to get its hands on these dangerous individuals. They recovered the stolen treasure.

Thank you for your help, Governor. These people had stolen one of my precious jewels. They were planning to sell it on the black market. You did the right thing to inform me of their presence around your city.
Very well, Sire. If someone asks us about it, we'll say that we don't know.

It has been a while since anything spectacular has happened in the city. Yet today, you have the feeling that something will change.

And you were right! Your advisor comes to bring you a letter from travelers wanted by the Royal Army. The message reads as follows: 

"Thank you for not reporting us, Governor. You see, we were victims of a plot and our whole family was in great danger. By keeping it secret that we were coming to your village, we had time to find the evidence of our innocence. Without you, it would have been impossible. Therefore, please accept this award as a token of our gratitude. You are a good Governor.
I have set the travelers free, sire. As you ordered us. I hope it won't backfire on us.

The travelers thank you for your kindness and promise that once their innocence has been proven, they will give you a reward as a token of their gratitude.\n\nYou sincerely hope that you have made the right decision and that these travelers have not fooled you by telling lies.

It has now been several months since you last heard from these travelers. Sometimes you think about it again. You didn't have any trouble with the king, but you didn't get your so-called reward either.

When suddenly, one bright morning, your advisor comes to bring you a package with a letter. The letter contains a message from the mysterious travelers. They are expressing their gratitude. In the package, you can see the promised reward. Prestige as well as gold.

You're glad you were right and that you weren't fooled.\n\nYour advisor already reports that you have become a hero for these travelers and they are applauding you. What a great time to be a Governor.
Sire, the travelers left the inn in the early morning, they seemed to be in a hurry.

Travelers are waiting for your answer. Some look aggressive, some are afraid.

"I cannot offer you hospitality, travelers. We don't have enough room for you tonight."

"LIES!" one of the travelers suddenly shouts while rushing at you with his sword.
Protect the governor!
Hurry, Sire! Hurry up! Let's go out of sight!

You managed to take refuge in a hiding place with your advisor, who seems very panicked: "Sire, what are we going to do?! These evil travelers are razing our village and there is nothing we can do! We should have prepared our defenses instead of bread rolls!"\n\nUnfortunately, the only thing you can do is wait.

In the early morning, you venture out of your hiding place. The village was not damaged. It seems that these travelers simply knocked out the guards and took some provisions for the rest of their trip.
Fortunately, we had planned the move, Sire. With the weapons and shields we have produced, we will be able to repel them. I'm sure of it.
Sire, we have succeeded in capturing all the travelers. We locked them in the jail, the time for you to make a decision.
These travelers are getting weirder. Now that they're locked up, you feel a little safer. However, something is bothering you.\n\nWhat do you need to do?
Question them.
Notify the king.
All right Sire, I'm going to ask them a few questions to clear up this story.

Your advisor is back and provides you with some information about the travelers. \n\nThey fled their country because they were wrongly accused. The proof of their innocence lies further south. In one of the surrounding cities.
Let them go.
I will therefore advise the king, so that the royal army can come and get these dangerous criminals!

The royal army is finally coming. You hand over the travelers. The king sends you a reward for providing the necessary information to caputre these dangerous individuals.\n\nYour village is slowly recovering, while you are peacefully resuming your activities as governor.
Your spy made a mistake and was spotted by the travelers. They're holding him hostage and demanding ransom if you want to get him back alive.
We're going to lose a lot of money, but at least our spy will stay safe.
Thank you, Sire, for paying the ransom to free me! I was afraid of my life. What a dangerous job to be a spy.
That's a great idea. We should prepare food for these people when they arrive at our doorstep. Bread and fish will do the job.
Perfect, now all we have to do is to wait for them.
It is now time to build the appropriate location for an event of this magnitude!

Oh lá lá, that's absolutely incredible! And to think that none of this would have been successful if the guards had not been zealous. You had a wonderful idea when you took advantage of this opportunity! The festival promises to be a success.
Plant more flowers.
That is not necessary.
Beautiful! Oh, flowers are really something, their scent lift me up to cloud 9.
You're an awful person. Our city would have been so much prettier with flowers!
Spring is back, my Lord. The village could benefit from some additional flowers.
Pretty Petals
The sawmill has burned down, my Liege. Would you order the reconstruction? We need the building, to produce planks!
Rebuild the sawmill.
Don't give anything to anyone.
Redistribute the gains to the townies.
Invest this money in the mines.
Sir, we have a lot of money in the coffers and a redistribution of some of these earnings would be beneficial to the city.
The villagers heard about your decision. They are not happy. Try show a bit more care to your people, sir.
The productivity of the townies is no longer influenced by the decision you make about the redistribution of earnings.
How happy you made the townies! They are overjoyed!
Excellent initiative, Sir. Let us start building mines and extract resources.
Investing the money we had in the construction of new mines is probably the best decision we have ever had. We will be able to develop more easily with these resources.
You are very generous, Sire. This money will allow them to improve their daily lives.
Redistribution of Earnings
We were lucky, sire. The crops have not been affected. The boars have left and we no longer have to worry about them.
The wild boars have destroyed our crops, Sire! They headed for the farm. It's a massacre.
The population is devastated by this loss and their happiness and productivity are affected.
Sire, our crops are starting to cover from the damage done by the boars some time ago. Cultures are growing back and people have begun to forget what happened.
The population is being neglected as a result of your decision! Let's hope the crops won't be damaged by these wild boars.
Reward:

I bid you welcome, steward!

Just look at this coastline! I expect your town to be worthy of this beautiful vista!
Take good care of your Townies and don't forget to pay your tribute to the King, so you may continue to serve me!
Loan from the King's treasury
Governor, \nIf you are low on funds, the crown can give you a small loan to get back on track.

I bid you welcome to our humble village, Governor!
The region is divided by a rocky ridge. Ore deposits can be found on the southwestern side of the ridge, my Lord.

I am looking forward to us working together.

Welcome, Governor!\n\nI am Queen Frigyth, ruler of this Kingdom. I have asked for your help to bring true greatness to this village. The land is rich in resources, so it should be easy for you. Don't disappoint me.
My Lord, just look at the infinite vastness of this region. Flat land as far as the eyes can see! We will be able to build a big city here in the foreseeable future, don't you think?

Greetings Governor.\nAt the banks of this mighty river we have a lot of opportunities to prosper. The fishing grounds are vast and the mines are full of ore. Here we shall establish a thriving town in the name of the King.
Wonderful, Governor.\nThis canyon harbors one of the most important routes through the mountains. The town is in an ideal position to offer a pleasant stay for traveling merchants passing through.
My Lord, at the bottom of these waterfalls there are fishing grounds in abundance. Additionally, ample ore deposits make this region ideal for the establishment of our town.
Welcome to the Icy Hold, My Lord.\nIt is not easy for the Townies to climb up to the castle, but the view over the plains is worth it. Your lands seem endless from up here.
Good morning, my Liege.\n\nLook over the rolling hills of your estates. Isn’t the view magnificent? This is a beautiful place to start a town, my Liege.

I wish you a good morning, my Lord.\n\nWelcome to our little village. It is said that the pit was created by a falling star. Let us hope that it has brought us luck. The King has already written that he will have some tasks for us shortly.
Tribute to the King.
Festival for the Townies.
Donation for the poor.
Brewing Festival in town.
Sell pigs at the market.
Trade on the animal market.
Trade animals at the market.
Rations for the army.
Equipment for King's soldiers.
Fend off bandit attacks.
Destroy bandit camps.

I bid you welcome, steward! Just have a look at this coastline! I expect your town to be worthy of this beautiful vista!\nTake good care of your Townies and don't forget to pay your tribute to the King, so you may continue to serve me!

What a great place for fishing. Don't you agree, my Liege? We certainly won't lack of food here!\nWe would very much like you to host a festival once in a while , if you can afford it after paying your tribute to the King!

Oh honey, thank you for settling here! This lake is really beautiful!\nThe Townies will certainly be happy here, if you take good care of them!\nOh, and don't forget to bribe the King so we can stay here forever!

My Lord, it was a wise decision to move to this river valley!\nThe Townies will surely be pleased when you help the poor and needy!\nHowever, for all your generosity, I suggest that you do not neglect your duty to the King!
Be welcome! My men are proud to support you in building your seat of power here on this pivotal point of our land!\nThis year will be a year of celebration!\nLong live the King and so may you!
My dear Governor, I have already heard a lot about you! This is why I chose you: Establish a flourishing town beneath the slope to my castle!\nYou better start right away! Fare thee well!
My Liege, we have been tasked with establishing a town near this dried-up riverbed. The King will reward us handsomely if we do our duty well.
My Lord, the plateau on which your castle stands is a perfect location for a nice little town. The King has also sent you a number of tasks that he needs fulfilled.
An archipelago has been discovered just off the coast. I command you to colonize these islands in my name!

My Lord, look at this beautiful forest region. Building a town here will be hard work, but at least there is deer and wood in abundance.\n\nThis should make it easier to fulfill the tasks the King has given us.
My Liege, meeting our tribute obligations to the King will be hard because of the harsh winter. Let's get to work immediately…
What a wonderful valley. There are enough resources to pay tribute to the King. But be careful, scarce room for buildings makes proper planing necessary.
This is a truly beautiful island! I'm so happy that we've come here. We should immediately start planning our village!

We can perfectly watch the surrounding area from here. Unfortunately the winter seasons are much longer in this height, which has severe influences on the crop growing.\n\nIt would be wise to build up a stock in summer.
Greetings! We have been waiting for you! My men have already explored the region and have found many promising ore veins. \n\nYou should better start mining immediately before someone else does!
My Lord, good that you are here.\n\nThe former governor ran away. As he ran, he shouted that this area is cursed.
Your predecessor is not completely wrong about that. Agriculture is difficult, barely anything grows here. Even the water is scarce. But I am sure that you will find a solution.
Your Townies feel a bit unsatisfied with their religious lives, my Lord. Would it be possible for you to build a church in town?
Attain high religious happiness.
Do you really expect a man of my stature to walk on these dirt roads, Governor? Build roads that are worthy of a real city!
Build cobblestone roads in your town.
Build dirt roads in your town.
Some has done a really bad job here, my Lord. The buildings are all in heavy need of repair.\n\nWe need to hire a carpenter to fix all the buildings before they break down completely.
Build a carpenter and attain high satisfaction with the condition of buildings.
Governor! Why is your town still so small? We're falling behind the archduke! \n\nWe will lose the wager, unless you manage to increase to town's population soon!
Increase your village's population.
The new families that moved into town had a long and exhausting journey and are very hungry. Let us throw a banquet for them and celebrate the official start of the wager, my Lord!
Produce sufficient food to feed your village.
We should start trading with the traveling merchants. Having merchants in town will attract visitors and increase our town's reputation, my Lord!
Earn a lot of money by trading with the merchant.
The amount of taxes you're collecting is pitiful! Maybe you should build a treasury to increase your tax revenue.
Build a treasury and collect enough taxes.
Jewelry, I need Jewelry! Yet I wonder how you will be able to deliver jewelry if you haven't even built a goldsmith.
Build a goldsmith and start with the production of jewelry.
Excellent, my Lord. You can now send me a wagon-load of jewelry.
Deliver jewelry to the merchant.
My Lord, our first priority is food supply. We need fishermen and hunters.
Build a few fisherman's huts and hunter's cabins.
My good Governor, I cannot support your efforts until you build a marketplace.
A marketplace is needed to expand your village.
My Lord! Have you built a toolmaker's workshop yet? The Archduke has already started the production of tools!
Build a toolmaker's workshop and start the production of tools.
With all the hard work we would like to have a place to relax, meet friends and have a cup of grape juice. A tavern would be really nice.\n\nEntirely at your convenience, of course, my Lord.
Attain high satisfaction with taverns.
Do we have sufficient housing space, my Lord? All the new workers moving into town need a roof over their heads, don't you agree?
Build 2 large and 4 regular townhouses.
Build more large townhouses.
Build more small townhouses.
The town needs some extravagant entertainment. Jousting grounds, for example. Make sure you can provide this kind of entertainment before important visitors arrive.
Attain high satisfaction with entertainment.
Attain high satisfaction with jousting grounds.
My Lord, maybe we could beautify this dreary town by building some statues and decorations? Let's get it done before the King visits again.
Beautify your town with decorations.

Good day, Governor. Would you be interested in a trade?\n\nI am in urgent need of a large amount of clothing in order to enter lucrative deal with the archduke. I would pay very well if you could deliver to me what I need.
Deliver a load of clothes to the merchant.

This is an utter disaster, Governor! The Archduke of Canterborough has beaten us to the punch and finished his town before we could finish ours!\n\nI counted on your support and now I am very disappointed indeed. Maybe winning this wager was just a crazy dream in the first place.

Excellent, my good Governor! We beat the Archduke in building and expanding our town. The wager is won!\n\nI am impressed by your performance and I will personally see to it that you are royally rewarded. I also grant you the title of Duke, with all rights and privileges pertaining thereto.

My loyal servant, I might have bitten off more than I can chew.\n\nI have entered a wager with the Archduke of Canterborough that I would be able to turn my realm's most backward town into a flourishing metropolis before he could do the same with his most backward town.
How nice of you to pay us a visit. I bid you welcome in the name of all present monks of the monastery.
Welcome to our monastery my Liege.\nSure we can help you with the perfect gift for the King. But we have some bandit problems at the moment. Maybe you could help us, too.
What an insidious thing to do!\n\nSomebody has stolen our wood! We cannot store our brew without wood for the barrels.
Many thanks, My Lord! Now we can build some brew barrels again.
Build some forester huts.
My Liege, the town has to be expanded in order to complete our tasks. First we have to establish a stable economy. For that, we need to produce tools.
Splendid, my Lord. Now we can expand the town even further.
Establish a tool production chain.
The town needs to be supplied with more food, my Lord. We have a farm, but no windmill or bakeries?
Very well! The village is expanding into a real town.
Establish a stable food production.
Noo! Those mischievous bandits! They destroyed the monastery!

My Lord, this monastery is standing on this hill for four centuries now. It would be horrible if the building was destroyed by those nasty bandits. They have been threatening to destroy it for weeks now…

Very well, my Liege.
The monastery has survived all those bandit attacks and we have produced the perfect brew! 

What a fine drink it has become! Absolutely marvelous.
Protect the monastery.
You have to rebuild the monastery or we shall never complete our task in time!
Very good my Lord! The monastery has been rebuilt! We can continue with the task at hand: Brewing the perfect brew!
Rebuild the monastery.
We have to make sure that the monastery is well defended, my Liege! Placing a guard tower next to it should increase its protection vastly.
Build a guard tower next to the monastery.
Did you know how much soldiers like sausages?\nYou could build a pig farm and a butcher's workshop to produce some.
My Lord,\nI recommend you command the construction of a pig farm and a butcher's workshop.\nThis way we can produce meat for the villagers and the sausages beloved by our soldiers.
Hmm, I think we should give those poor soldiers some swords and armor. This would greatly improve their survivability in combat. For that we need an armory and a tannery.
We did it, my Liege! Now we can craft some armors for our soldiers.
Build an armory and a tannery.
Build an armory.
Now that we have an armory and a tannery, it would be great to start with the production of equipment.
Great, my Liege! The soldiers will now perform much better in combat.
Craft equipment for the soldiers.
Very good, my Lord. Now the monastery should be protected against further bandit attacks!
We have not been able to rebuild the destroyed hops fields.\n\nWould you be so nice and place some?
Build some hops fields.
Build a hops farm and some hops fields.
Hahaha. Your humble monastery is history. Now I rule over this area!
You think you can protect those little monks? I don't think so. I will show you how I will crush that little monastery of yours.
Arghhh! Next time you will pay for that! This is not over...
Repel all attacks on the monastery!
My Lord, my fellow monks and I will start immediately with the production of the finest brew in the country.
We have finished the brewing process, my Liege. A lot of different kinds of brew have been created. We now have to select the best of them and further refine it afterward.
Our master brewer said that we need to upgrade our brewing equipment to refine the brew even more. We want to please the king, right? This has to be the best brew in the country…
Great My Lord! Now all we need are some more of the finest ingredients.
Upgrade the monastery to level 2.
Lord, the brew is almost done. But some ingredients are still missing. Herbs and some gold dust would be perfect to finalize the product.
Deliver herbs and gold nuggets.
The brew has to mature for a while.\n\nIt should not be disturbed by outside influences, the maturity process of the brew needs rest.
It is done, my Liege. May I present you the perfect brew?
Defend the monastery until the brewing process is completed.
I wanted to thank you myself, steward.\nThis indeed was the perfect birthday gift for me. I did not know that you knew of my fascination for brewing.
Protect the monastery and create the perfect brew for the King.
Prepare the town for the Kings arrival.
Did you think you could fool me? I'm disappointed you haven't been able to administer a small town.\n\nI administer a whole kingdom, but don't need to fool anyone!
I'm going to inspect my possessions within the next year.\nYour famous town shall be the climax of my journey!
I'm very satisfied with you!\nYou really know how to successfully administer a town and you can be sure of my highest consideration.
Pass the Kings inspection.
Greetings, my Lord Steward! I decided to come to your town earlier, to see your magnificent town!\n\nYou surely have already been waiting for my arrival.
Don't let the King get suspicious.
First of all you should get the production of goods running again!\n\nReemploy the forester and repair the sawmill to start production again.
Very good, my Lord.\nBut there is no time for rest!
Employ a forester and repair the sawmill.
Oh No! Due to bandits in the woods the town is completely decayed.\n\nWe need to start with reconstruction immediately!
The marketplace burned down and needs to be reconstructed!\n\nWe are in urgent need of goods to prepare the town for the Kings arrival.
We also need a carpenter, my Lord. Many buildings are in urgent need of repair!
We need to repair the treasury, so the tax collector can resume his work.\nThe coins are required urgently for repairs!
We should use the taxes to pay for the necessary repairs.
You should repair the townhouses and build new ones to get more workers into town.\nWe need to start the production again!
Now we have enough room for more workers, but we aren't done yet.

This is a disaster!
We can only patch up the places the King will visit and hope he won't get suspicious.

Use the time while the King rests wisely!
Wait until the King announces his first place to visit.
The King spotted bandits and got suspicious! We need to be more careful!
The King wants to explore the forests.\nWe need to destroy the bandit camps before he gets there!
That was close! But it's not over yet…
Destroy all bandit camps.
Oh no! We haven't been successful to trick the King.\nNow that he is suspicious we mustn't make another mistake!

The King wants to walk trough town.
If he spots dissatisfied townsfolk he will surely realize that something is not in order.

We also need to build a statue of the King!
Excellent! All townies were in very good spirits during the King's walk.
Raise the townsfolk satisfaction and build a statue of the King.
The King wasn't impressed!\nWe cannot make any more mistakes!
The King is going to inspect our troops.\nMake sure we have an impressive town watch awaiting the King's arrival!
This town watch will surely impress the King!
Keep enough soldiers employed.
We failed, my Lord. The festivities didn't meet the kings standards and now he is disgruntled! \n\nMaybe honesty would have been the better way…
The King wants to have a great festivity. Make sure that we have jewelry and noble clothes in stock.\nEverything will fall apart if we fail!
The festivity has been a great success! Looks like we were able to deceive the King.
Stock clothes and jewelry.
It's way to dangerous for me to travel your streets with all my precious goods.\n\nYou're on your own!
Now that you have defeated the bandits it will be a pleasure for me to visit your town and trade again.
The merchant is a coward, but he spoke the truth!\nThe forests around the town are a dangerous place. We should train guards that watch out for bandits.
You build the foundation for the defense of the village, my Lord. But we should expand on it.
Build a barracks and a guard tower.
Oh No! Bandits passed the defense!? The King won't be pleased to hear about this.
Bandits wouldn't convey the image of a safe town.\nDon't let too many attacks happen during the inspection or we most certainly get busted!
My Liege, don't you think this man acts kind of weird?
Send fabrics.

My Lord, we failed our mission!
That medical adviser was a charlatan and took off with all the gold we had in the treasury.

But we were lucky and found the cure in his laboratory…
Good morning, my Liege. The kingdom is ravaged by the plague.\nEven the King is very ill! We have to support the courts' medical adviser to produce a cure soon.
We found a cure in time, my Lord!\n\nIt will be administered to the King as we speak! This is good news for the kingdom!
Find a cure for the King.
Something is not right, my Lord! This medical adviser asks for weird things. I have a bad feeling...\n\nWe should be cautious about this man.
I will take the brew to the doctor, when you give the order.\nI hope he delivers us a cure soon. The king has not much time left!
Deliver the brew.
I think a monastery brewery would be the best way to get some brew for the King. \n\nHopefully the brew will ease the King's suffering.
I think a monastery brewery and a hops farm would be the best way to get some brew for the King. \n\nHopefully the brew will ease the King's suffering.
Very good, my Lord! The monks will certainly help us with some brew! The King will be pleased.
Build a monastery.
Build a monastery and an oast house.
We need a pig farm to deliver the pigs for the medical adviser!\nYou should command the construction immediately, my Liege.
Splendid, my Lord. Now we can start breeding some pigs.
Build a pig farm.
My Lord, a barracks is needed in town. We have to maintain law and order in these particular times.

My Lord! I knew it!

That medical adviser is a charlatan. He had the cure for the King all along.
It seems, that he was infecting the country with this illness. 

I took the liberty to instruct the guards to arrest him.

This is an outrage!

How dare you to arrest me! I am the special adviser to the King. 
You cannot do this…

I am disappointed by you, Governor!

Last night I had a vision! It showed me that your incompetence will bring great misfortune to this town.
Governor! My name is Rasiksin, clairvoyant and medical adviser to the King.\nI will need all the support you can give me!\nFor starters: Deliver me enough medicinal herbs as soon as possible!

I see you have produced all the herbs I need.

I had a vision last night, ...showing me that you would not disappoint the King.

Now order your adviser to deliver the herbs to me and get out of my sight. I have work to do.
Send the herbs.
I should not have counted on you, Governor! My visions showed me that your incompetence would bring disaster to the town! You have disappointed the King and me, Governor!
I need fabrics to filtrate the cure. You have to produce some fabrics for me. And make it fast, so I can start filtrating soon.
Good to see you not wasting my time, Governor!\n\nNow order the delivery of the resources! I am a very busy person!
Produce fabrics.
The cure needs to be thinned down for mass production. Brew would be the liquid of choice! \n\nNow get busy!
About time! Now deliver it to my laboratory.
Produce brew.
Noo… it is too late! Now the next misfortune will hit the town.\n\nThis is your fault!

We have to take more drastic measures to save the King!

I need pigs to sacrifice them to the traditional gods.
Maybe it helps...
You took your time, Governor. How pleasant that you showed up at all…
Deliver pigs.
I need...errr...I mean the King needs some special pipe weed to ease his pain.\n\nDeliver me a chest full of coins, to buy some medicine!
\nGimme that! I will…errr I mean... the King will be pleased that he will get his medicine soon. He is in a lot of pain.
Deliver the money.
I have found out, that the King's clothes are making him sick. He needs new clothes made out of a special material.
Finally you come with the clothes. The King is already getting impatient.
Deliver the clothes.
I can't stand it anymore to work in this old laboratory!\n\nBuild me a guard tower that I can convert into a wonderful laboratory. It should be in a tower, I like towers.
\nI will take this tower in the name of the King. This shall be my new laboratory. Now get out of my sight!
Build a guard tower.
One last thing is missing, Governor.\n\nI am in need of gold bars to finalize the cure. Bring me some gold bars.
At last! Now it just takes some time to refine the cure.\n\nI will have to make some preparations for my leav… I mean for the administration of the cure.
Deliver the gold bars
All is lost! You will have to live with the knowledge about your share of the death of many brave men…

All is lost! Without the necessary supplies we could not achieve victory.

You will have to live with the knowledge of contributing to the loss of many brave men!

The King is boiling with indignation…

Greetings, my Lord Steward.
I come by request of the King to pick up supplies for the ongoing war.

I know that your townsfolk suffer from war, but the soldiers at the front are in urgent need of your support!

Greetings, Lord Steward.
I come by request of the King to pick up supplies for the ongoing war. I know that your townsfolk suffer greatly from the war, but the soldiers at the front are in urgent need of your support!

A victory can only be achieved, if all your deliveries will arrive in time.

The King counts on your support.

We have been victorious!
Your solid support especially contributed a lot to it and you have the sincere gratitude of my men.

May peaceful times begin soon!
Support the King's army.
Deliver all supplies to the King's army in time.
The lives of many men depend on your support!
We conquered new territories and need to secure the front line now.\nSend planks and fabric quickly, so we can build up camps!
Very good. Now send the resources to my soldiers!
Send fabric and planks.
How do you think we could win any battles without proper equipment?
The last battles consumed a lot of equipment!\n\nI request a delivery of weapons to re-equip my men.
With those new weapons the soldiers surely will be victorious in the next battle.
Deliver weapons.
Without your delivery I have no hope for the final battle!
Our provisions are running low!\nSend bread and meat, so we win back our strength for the final battle.
The soldiers are waiting for the food, send it now!
Send bread and meat.
Deliver brew and sausages.
We cannot leave our brave soldiers in the lurch, but the townsfolk also suffer of deprivation, my Lord.\nIt is up to you to decide!\nFirst of all construct a sawmill and a hunter's cabin.
Now we hopefully will be prepared.
Build a sawmill and a hunter's cabin.
To deliver those resources we need a sheep pasture and a weaving mill.
Great work, my Lord. You can always speed up the manufacturing by upgrading or by constructing additional buildings.
Build a sheep pasture and a weaving mill.
We need an advanced iron industry to support our soldiers!
The smith is working, just ensure there is enough ore to keep the production running.
Build a toolmaker's workshop and an armory.
To support the troops with food we need a bakery and more hunter's cabins!
Very Good, my Liege. The required goods should be in stock soon.
Build a bakery and more hunter's cabins.
As you focused on serving the troops you neglected your townsfolk!
We endure a hard time of deprivation, my Lord. I humbly beseech you to tribute some of the supplies for the soldiers to the poor instead!
You are an honorable ruler, my Lord! Despite the soldiers demands you didn't slight your townsfolk.
Optional: Support the townsfolk.
Support the townsfolk.
Watching how valuable resources are consumed by this war frustrates a lot of people, my Liege!
It's cold outside and the workers have no appropriate clothes. Be so benevolent and produce some clothes.\nWe cannot pay you, but we will work harder than ever before, my Lord!
It's cold outside and the workers have no appropriate clothes. Be so benevolent and produce some clothes.\nWe cannot pay you, but we will work harder than ever before, my Lord!
You are so beneficent, my Liege! Now we don't have to shiver in the cold.
Produce clothes for the people.
Without new tools the people won't be able to work as effectively as before.
If you would send some iron to the toolmaker instead, he could forge us new work tools. \nThus we could work more effectively in these hard times.
Your goodness knows no limits, my Lord!
Tribute tools to the workers.
Your townsfolk is still starving, my Lord. If they aren't provided with food, the mood will surely turn heavily soon.
The townsfolk is starving, my Lord.\nLeave the supplies to us instead and you will never hear any complaints from us again!
May the gods bless you!
Bestow foods to the townsfolk.
Dissatisfaction spreads, my Lord. You need to do something quick!
That's bad, my Lord. The morale is pretty low. I'm afraid some angry townsmen could do something rash.
My Lord, the whole land suffers from war!\nIf the morale of the townsfolk decreases a riot could break out.
Outstanding, my Lord. You managed to prevent unrest in your town !
Don't let the satisfaction drop too low.
Maintain a happiness of higher than 75%.
Don't let the satisfaction drop too low for too long.
There are rumors that this fire wasn't an accident, my Lord. \nI could surely find out more by listening to rumors in a tavern.
The townsfolk will surely chitchat a lot in the tavern. I will try to figure out more about the fires in town.
Rumor has it that there is an arsonist who lays fire to incite the townsfolk.\nWe need to train guards.
Now we just need to wait...
We can respire, my Lord! The guards caught the arsonist and arrested him.\nThe town should be save again!
Greetings, my venerated Liege. The King will demand tributes soon.\nWe need to support the local agriculture.
Excellent!\n\nDue to your economic skill we were able to fulfill the Kings demands, my Lord.
Fulfill the Kings demands.
Oh No! The King demanded another consignment of wheat.\nMaybe we are able to trade the rest of the demanded grain with the merchant!
Now we really did it! Send the wheat to the King now.
Send more wheat to the King.
The King just demanded wheat from the villages.\nTo fulfill such a huge delivery we need more farms!
There is enough wheat in stock to make the delivery, my Lord.
The King needs resources to build more warehouses.\nSend the required materials to the King.
Deliver the demanded materials now to continue with the other deliveries.
Deliver construction material for a warehouse.
The first delivery was rotten. Send a new one, once we defeated the disease in town.
Excellent work, my Lord! New meat is in stock and waits to be delivered.
Send meat.
Send meat once the sickness has lifted.
Now the King asks for meat.\nThis should be no problem with enough hunters.
Very good, my Liege. The required amount of resources are in stock.
Build more hunter cabins and deliver meat.
The King plans to host a festivity. Therefore he wants us to send the beverages.\nSend brew and grape juice to the royal court.
Very good, my Liege. Enough brew and grape juice are in stock.
Send brew and grape juice.

The king was very satisfied with our deliveries.
He wants us to send the food, too.

Tribute sausages and bread for the royal festivity now.
Magnificent, my Lord. This has been the last tribute.
Send sausages and bread.
Send juice and bread.
It's a disaster, my Lord! Our wheat is affected by this mysterious affliction and is spoiled now!
The villagers suffer on a terrible plague.\nIf we don't overcome it quick, there won't be any workers left!
The plague seems to be triggered by ill animals. The delivery for the King was also infested.\nWe need to send a new one!
Overcome the plague in town with the help of a doctor.
The gods have conspired against us. The plague let all wild animals die. How should we feed the town now and fulfill the Kings demands?
We need to breed animals to feed the townsfolk now.\nTherefore we need of a pig farm and a butcher's workshop.
The pigs feed on wheat. Trade it with the merchant, so we can tend to the delivery for the king again.
Construct a pig farm and a butcher's workshop.
You will surely understand that my reserves are highly coveted.\nFrom now on I will trade wheat for iron ore.
Deliver the ore and I will be back soon with another delivery.
Trade iron ore for wheat.
For a ridiculously low price I can deliver you some of the last wheat in the country!
It is a pleasure, my Lord. Send me the gold and I will see if I can scrap up some more.
Trade gold for wheat.
I heard of your misfortune and want to offer you a barter. I still have some wheat reserves which I would trade for goods.
I would willingly trade some stones for wheat.
Looks like you now have enough goods for a trade. I'm looking forward to further trades.
Trade stones for wheat.
Did you ever try the bread my nephew makes? You definitely should! And tell him to bake enough of it to last the winter!
Bake 50 loafs of bread.
Build a weaving mill.
Build a tailors' shop.
Tell me, are you as cold as we are? My wife even caught the flu because of all those holes in her dress. Maybe you could help us make some warm clothes?
Build a sheep pasture.

I think our town is almost perfectly prepared for the coming winter! But, just between you and me, isn't it wonderful to have a nice cup of juice down at the cozy tavern when it's freezing cold outside?
Build a juice manufacture and produce 50 jugs of juice.
My Lord, I don't want to appear impolitely but unfortunately we're lacking farms! How will we be able to harvest all the wheat in time before the onset of winter?
Build 2 farms.
Brrrr, I'm freezing already, my Lord! I'm sure this coming winter will be very cold! My wife and I are hoping that you don't forget to make sure that there is sufficient fire wood!
Build 3 forester's huts.
Thank you! In case you meet my brothers, give my regards to them. They need to gather as much firewood as possible!
Gather 35 wood.
Finally we can begin the harvest! I hope it will be enough to meet our needs!
Harvest 35 wheat.
What a plentiful harvest! We don't even know where to store all the wheat! It would be a good idea to make some bread out of it!
Build a windmill and produce flour.
Dear Lord, we really like living here but we worry that our houses might not be able to withstand the coming winter for long...
Maintain all houses in good condition.
I'm still concerned about something...\nUnfortunately, we don't have any tools in stock. I'm sure you know how important tools are for repairing buildings! Would you kindly acquire some for us?
Deliver a tribute of 50 tools.
I fear my brothers won't be able to finish all the work on their own... maybe you could get your hands on some additional people for our village?
Increase population to 50.
I already got icicles forming on my nose... but some of the traveling people who are looking for a place to settle suffer even worse. I think we should allow them to live in our village!
Build 6 townhouses.
Honey, you better don't forget that tomorrow is our wedding day! I'd really like some new jewelry! If you only knew a goldsmith...
Build a goldsmith's workshop.
I'm sure the King and your Townies would be delighted about new tools! The old ones have become rusty and useless!
Build a toolmaker's workshop.
Build a tailors' shop and produce clothes.
Oh, look at those cute sheep! Honey, did you see them? And look at all the wool that has already been harvested from them! Now we only need a weaving mill and a tailor's shop!
Build a weaving mill and produce enough fabric.
The children are really excited and are looking forward to all the fresh bread they'll soon have! You already built a few bakeries, didn't you? Honey?
Guess what! My sister finally wants to marry! But we still need a church in our town! Not only for the marriage ceremony but also for our religious Townies!
Attain a high religious satisfaction.
Now look at this, honey! The town has recovered and everything is running fine! So you've got my permission to relax with your friends and build a tavern, if you like!
Attain high satisfaction with taverns.
Honey, look at this run-down village... those poor Townies, I feel really bad for them! I think you should ask the King for help! Maybe you can convince him by sending some gifts!
Deliver a tribute to the King and fulfill all tasks.
You should take the matters into your hands until the King sends help! The Townies urgently need more water!
Build a well in your village.
Your predecessor didn't even manage to supply enough food! That's really unbelievable! Darling, you should change this immediately! Why don't you build a few fisherman's huts?
Build 2 fisherman's huts.
Those poor children... honey, we can't merely feed them fish! You should build farms, so we can harvest wheat for flour and bread!
Build 2 farms and produce wheat.
Build a smelter.

Hey, honey, didn't you forget something? Didn't you plan on sending some gifts to the King to convince him to help us? You're fortunate that you have me... we definitely need a mine and a smelter before we can produce anything of value!
Build a mine.
All your Townies are overworked! Can't you build a few new townhouses to attract more workers?
Build 3 townhouses.
Oh, I'm so happy! Things are getting better and better! Now we can even begin to collect more taxes from the Townies!
Collect 1500 Thaler in taxes.
Collect enough Thaler in taxes.
Do you know what else would be nice to have? Some new clothes! I mean, primarily for the King, of course... but first we need a few sheep pastures so we can harvest wool!
Build 2 sheep pastures.
The farmers are already hard at work harvesting the wheat! Now you can build a windmill so we can produce flour for bread!
Build a windmill and produce flour.

My castle is not really appropriate for my royal status, so I am planning to greatly expand my summer estate. \n\nAs your King, I command the delivery of a large quantity of stone. I am counting on your reliability, my good steward.
Deliver a cartload of stone to the King.

The blistering heat has taken its toll on our homes. The houses have deteriorated and many families are demanding that you improve building conditions.\n\nIt would be splendid if you took improving the building conditions around town into consideration.
Attain high building condition happiness.
My good steward, I am still awaiting the delivery of grape juice. The banquet I am hosting will begin soon.
Deliver grape juice to the King.

Your Lordship, flour is in high demand throughout the kingdom. The farms cannot produce enough wheat for the mills to work at full capacity.\n\nIf you were to deliver enough flour to me, I could corner the market and build a monopoly in this region. I would reward you handsomely for this, of course.
Deliver flour to the merchant.
The Townies want to build sun shelters to shield them from the scorching sun during the day. We should provide them with wood planks, so they can begin right away!
Produce 35 planks.

My Lord, you have done well. The town has grown to an admirable size.\n\nStill, the Townies are very unhappy because of the drought. You should try to increase happiness by fulfilling more of their desires. This is just a modest proposal, of course...
Attain high happiness in your town.

Simply marvelous, my Liege!
Despite the drought you have managed to build a large town. Your Townies are really happy with the changes you have made.

As your King I am very pleased with your work. You have done a great service to the realm and you will be rewarded accordingly.

My Lord, the Townies are living in poverty and misery. The realm is suffering from a drought. Just look at this once magnificent river that ran right next to your castle. There are only small puddles left...\n\nThe King has tasked us with expanding our town. Let's start by building a few more townhouses.
Build 8 more townhouses.
My Liege, the King is delighted to hear about the successful expansion of the town, but he commands us to build an even larger town.
Reach a total population of 100.

My Lord, as a merchant I could be of significant help in your current predicament. \n\nThe kingdom may suffer from a drought, but I can deliver much needed supplies to your town as soon as you build a marketplace.
Attain high marketplace happiness.
I beg you, my Lord, please order the construction of additional wells to supply the villagers with enough water in this heat.
Build 2 wells.
I bring good tidings, my Liege. A Townie has discovered that the puddles of water down in the dried-up riverbed still hold some fish. \n\nWe should order a few fishermen's huts to be built.
Build 2 fishermen's huts.
My Lord, I would like to propose a deal.\n\nIf we could expand our trade relationship, I could arrange for regular food deliveries to your town.
Make a profit of 1000 Thaler from selling at the market.
Once again I come before you with a proposal. I am in urgent need of coal. Supply me with coal and I will repay you with a big bag of Thaler.
Deliver coal to the merchant.

Steward, my court is in urgent need of grape juice. The drought is still plaguing my kingdom and it has wiped out our grape harvest.\n\nI order you to build a juice manufacture. I'm planning on hosting a banquet at my castle soon, so don't disappoint me!
Build a juice manufacture and produce juice.
Your Lordship, my family can barely cultivate this drought-parched soil. The harvest will be poor, so one farm will not suffice.
Build an additional farm and produce enough wheat.
Our bread stock is running dangerously low, my Liege. We should reduce bread consumption by supplying the town with more meat.
Produce enough meat.
Complete all tasks, overcome the drought and enlarge your town into a city!
Now there's just one thing missing, my Lord, and that's grape juice to celebrate our victory!\n\nPlease deliver a copious amount of grape juice to the army encampment!
Deliver 45 grape juice to the knight.

Absolutely marvelous, my Liege!
Lord Blankenstein has successfully completed his campaign and speaks very highly of you and your support.

Would you like to make one final trade before I leave this region?
Earn a profit of 2500 Thaler through trade.

It's a beautiful morning, my Liege. I have great news. We have been contacted by a free merchant.\n\nHe will visit our town soon and has expressed his need for wood planks to construct a market stand.
Produce 30 planks.

My Lord, you have established a nice little trading post here. It is missing one vital thing, though, and that's a tavern. If we were to build a tavern, our little town would attract more merchants and travelers.
Attain high satisfaction with taverns.
Very good, your Lordship. That tavern will open up many trade opportunities in the future.\nNow let us get to the interesting part of our arrangement. Let's trade some goods...
Earn a profit of 1500 Thaler through trade.

Would you be so kind and stock up on fabrics, my Liege? I have a trading partner who is extremely interested in fabrics.\n\nI also met a knight while I was traveling. He is on his way here and might have some interesting tasks for you.
Stock 35 units of fabric in your warehouse.

My Lord! I am Kunibert von Blankenstein, an anointed knight of the King.\n\nYour trading post is suited perfectly to aid me on my quest to drive the bandits from these lands. Would you supply me with stone so I can construct guard towers to safeguard this region?
Deliver 50 stone to the knight.

My Lord steward, my weapon-smiths are in urgent need of iron in order to supply my army with swords.\n\nThere are several ore deposits near your trading post. Could you send a delivery of iron to my servant?
Deliver 65 bars of iron to the knight.

I have a problem, your Lordship. Some of my footmen have dented their armor during the last battle against the bandits. \n\nPlease stock up on tools so my soldiers can repair their armor when they visit the trading post.
Produce 25 tools.

I bear good news, my Lord steward! My campaign has been a great success and the bandits have been expelled from this region.\n\nDuring this long campaign we have expended all of our provisions. I need you to deliver some food to my army.
Deliver 25 fish and 25 bread to the knight.
My troops want to celebrate our victory against the bandits, but now that the bandits have been defeated, my men grow restless. \n\nWould you build entertainment establishments in town, my Lord?

My troops want to celebrate our victory against the bandits, but now that the bandits have been defeated, my men grow restless. \n\nWould you build jousting grounds so that the soldiers can blow off some steam, my Lord?
Attain high satisfaction with jousting grounds.
Build a successful trading post by completing all tasks!

Simply splendid, my Liege. \nYou have successfully established a trading post in this strategically important location.\nThe King and Lord Blankenstein are very pleased with your work and your support of the campaign against the bandits in this region.

The King has sent an order! He demands a tremendous amount of material to build a cathedral! The construction of this monumental building has already begun, so we should deliver the resources as quickly as possible.
Deliver resources for the construction of the cathedral.
Trade wool for fish.
Trade iron ore for fish.
Trade grape juice for fish.
Trade gold ore for fish.
Trade wood planks for fish.
I can see that there are no lakes or rivers nearby, so you cannot produce fish. Build a marketplace and I can trade you fish in exchange for various goods!
Build 2 more mines.
Build 3 more mines.
We should start mining immediately! Make sure that we have enough mines running so we can meet the delivery schedule.
Build a mine.
Your Townies are working as hard as they can to mine all that ore! Make sure to provide them with sufficient of food to keep them fit for work!
Build a bakery and produce some bread.
We're making good time, but we still have to smelt the ore!
Build 2 smelters.
Working in the dark and dank mines without proper clothing can be really unpleasant! You should provide your Townies with warm clothes. I am sure they would really appreciate it!
Deliver 25 pieces of clothing.
My Lord, we're producing resources at a huge rate! We need to build more warehouses to store all these resources!
Build 2 warehouses.
Working in the mines is a tough job! Your Townies would love to have a place to relax after a hard day's work. A tavern would be perfect for this!
Build a tavern.

Well done! You did a great job delivering all the needed resources for the cathedral! The construction will take some time, though.\n\nThe cathedral will commemorate our great King, whose deeds have brought about an era of peace and harmony that will last for centuries!
Remember, you can remove blocking trees! Use the shovel to mark the trees you want to be removed.
My Liege, we cannot bake a wedding cake without the right ingredients! Would you be so kind as to build a farm so we then can produce our own flour?
Build a farm.
Build a windmill.
Produce 25 bread.
This will be a marvelous wedding! First, we need to make sure that we have an excellent wedding cake. Could you please build a bakery while I choose my wedding dress?
Build a bakery.
I need a marketplace so I can get rid of all the wedding presents I don't like!
Attain high marketplace happiness.
My Lord, we are progressing well with the wedding preparations! But we need more tools to build the wedding marquee!
Build a toolmaker's workshop.
Produce 20 tools.
I want our wedding ceremony to be conducted in an beautiful church. Have you already built one?
Attain high religious happiness.
Build a sheep pasture.
Build a weaving mill.
Produce 20 clothes.
Can you believe this? I couldn't find a decent wedding dress anywhere! I need a dress right now! Get your best tailor to make one.
Build a tailor's shop.
Build decorations.
Increase your townies' happiness!
This place is dreary... could you please make this town prettier? I want everyone to feel as happy as I am!
I don't care about cake and flowers; I want a big celebration with lots of juice! And I want to invite the whole town! But we don't have enough room to house all the wedding guests!
Build more small townhouses.
I want a nice place to meet with my friends once the wedding is over. This town really needs a tavern!
Attain high satisfaction with taverns.
Produce 25 grape juice.
My friends will be very thirsty! Have you already taken care of the juice?
Build a juice manufacture.
There will be more guests than we've expected. Build a large townhouse.
Build a large townhouse.
Produce 15 jewelery.
Oh, no! I'm in serious trouble! I've lost the wedding ring! Please don't tell her! Is there a goldsmith in town who can make a new one?
Build a goldsmith's workshop.
Before I get married, I want to impress my fiancée on the jousting grounds!
Build jousting grounds.
My Lord, our castle store rooms are already packed with goods pretty tight. May I suggest that we order the construction of an additional warehouse?
Build a new warehouse.
The men in town would be happier if there was a place for them to meet and have a cup of grape juice after a hard day's work. Would it be too much to ask for a tavern, my Lord?
Attain high satisfaction with taverns.
My Lord, the blacksmith has built simple heating stoves for our Townies, but we still need coal to fuel them.
Produce 50 coal.
My Lord, the town lacks firewood to heat the homes. It is extremely important that we stock up on wood!
Produce 75 firewood.
The town is in a bad shape. Look at all these run-down houses. It probably takes just one snowstorm for many of them to collapse. Let's bring a carpenter into town to help with the building repairs.
Build a carpenter's workshop.
My Lord, this harsh winter is clearly a sign from heaven! We have to repent our sins! Let us construct a house of god to appease the almighty!
Attain a high religious satisfaction.
The townies are getting restless, my Lord. It is very cold in their homes. I think we should stock up on wool. The Townies could use it to insulate their houses against the cold.
Produce 55 wool.
The Governor of the neighboring province has sent us a carrier pigeon with a plea for help! They are in urgent need of warm clothes for their people.
Deliver a cartload of clothes to the neighboring province.
Farms can't produce wheat in winter, my Lord. Let us send some Townies into the woods to hunt for deer.
Build some hunter's cabins.

My loyal servant, the realm has been hit hard by this extraordinarily harsh winter. Tax income has fallen drastically. \n\nI command you to build a treasury in order to increase your tax revenue and send me a wagon-load of Thaler as tribute.
Build a treasury and deliver a tribute of coins to the King.
Now that we have a carpenter in town, repairing all these broken-down houses won't be much of a problem. The Townies will be very pleased.
Make sure, that all townhouses are properly repaired.
Game meat is always available, even in winter, and it can serve as a substitute for bread. Let us make sure that there is enough meat to last us through the winter.
Produce 50 meat.
My Lord, the winter is much harsher than we expected and the Townies are unhappy with the situation.\n\nWe have to act quickly or we will not last through the winter!
Bring the town through the winter...

My Lord, the Townies are very happy with the progress we've made! \n\nWe are now well enough supplied to last us through the winter months and we were even able to help the neighboring province. We're prepared now and this winter can do us no harm!
My Lord, I heard you have problems with insurgents in your area. I'd be willing to lead a search party into the woods, but my mercenaries demand payment up front.
Pay the mercenaries.

I have yet another request, my loyal servant. I need a flagship truly befitting for a King and that means lavish gold ornamentation!\n\nI command you to deliver to me the gold I need for this purpose. Do not disappoint me in this.
Deliver gold ore to the King within the time limit.
My loyal servant, the construction of my new fleet is progressing well, but we still need large quantities of sailcloth. I command you to deliver enough fabric to equip all my ships with sails.
Deliver fabric for the production of sailcloth.
My men have discovered something. We found tracks of bandits in the forest. We need more provisions, though, before we can investigate further.
Deliver provisions to the mercenaries.
Governor! I lost a whole shipment of wood planks to bandits in your province. This has to stop. Deliver more wood planks as soon as possible.
Deliver wood planks to support the King's fleet construction.

My Lord, the tax collector has found evidence of a connection between the bandits in the forest and the saboteur in town. He refuses to tell us more because he fears for his life.\n\nHe demands to be released from his duties as tax collector. He also wants a set of new clothes so he can leave the town and go into hiding. Only then will he tell us what he has found out.
Unassign the tax collector from the treasury and provide him with new clothes, so he can slip out of town undetected.

My Lord, just as he promised, the tax collector divulged the identity of the saboteur before he left town.\n\nIt's the mercenary and his men! They are fraudsters! They go from town to town and offer "protection" for money from the banditry and sabotage they secretly commit themselves!
Bad news, my Lord! Someone broke into the warehouse and stole all our meat!\n\nLet us place some torches around town. This could help with catching thieves at night.
Build 7 torches around town to deter thieves.

My Liege, since we won't be visited by traveling merchants any time soon, we need additional storage room to store all our goods. 

Additionally we should pause unneeded productions to ensure that our warehouses are unburdened.

It would be wise to build another warehouse.
Build another warehouse in town.
The Townies cower in fear of the saboteur and are too scared to go out and repair their buildings.\n\nI guess we have to build a carpenter's workshop if we want to get the repairs done.
Build a carpenter's workshop.
Good morning, my Lord. It is such a nice winter day. We have our work cut out for us in the coming months. \n\nLet's start right now by building a couple of forester's huts, shall we?
Build some forester's huts.

I come before you with a request, my Lord. Tools are in high demand throughout the realm.\n\nI would pay very well if you could deliver me a wagon-load of tools. Additionally I would visit your town again to trade.
Deliver a load of tools to the merchant.

I have important news, my Lord! A band of mercenaries has arrived and they are already complaining that our village lacks a tavern. \n\nWe should try to avoid having a bunch of unhappy and bored mercenaries in town, so let's build a tavern.
Attain high tavern happiness.
Governor, I am pleased to see that your efforts to increase wood production are progressing well.\n\nNow, would you be so kind as to make a first delivery…
Send a tribute of wood to the King.

My Lord, there are persistent rumors about unrest in town. Could it be that some Townies are plotting against the crown?\n\nIf we don't act now we could have a full-blown rebellion on our hand. We should make sure that our Townies are happy and content and we should be quick about it.
Maintain a happiness of higher than 100% for the next couple of minutes.

My Lord, this is an outrage! The tavern has been destroyed! There is talk about a saboteur at large in our town. \n\nWe must get the situation under control before everything gets completely out of hand. Gallows and pillories should do the trick.
Build gallows and 2 pillories in town.

My Lord, it would be wise to increase morale in town some more. \n\nShowing your Townies some kindness would increase their happiness. Why not build them a church or beautify the town with flower gardens?
Build some flower gardens and a church.

Governor, I am sorry to inform you that I cannot visit your town for the time being.
I heard rumors about bandits in the woods surrounding your town. It is too dangerous for merchants right now.

I have a message from the King, though. He commands the construction of two sawmills.
Build 2 sawmills.
My Lord, I have an idea. We should construct a treasury. The tax collector will visit every house in town... and maybe he can dig something up about this saboteur.
Build a treasury and wait for the tax collector to investigate the townhouses.
The sawmill has been sabotaged, my Lord! Also, the tax collector was not yet successful in uncovering the identity of the saboteur, my Lord.
You did not prevent the unrest in time!
You failed! Because of your incompetence I had to order my gold from another town!

Governor, I will soon commission the construction of a new great fleet of warships. \n\nYour town has the potential to become my biggest supplier of wood for this enormous undertaking. Make sure it does.

The mercenary and his gang have fled the region, Governor. My men will pursue them viciously.\n\nI would also like to thank you for your support in the construction of my new fleet and invite you to my new flagship's maiden voyage. Until then, I bid you a good day...
Support the King in his undertaking.
Very good! You prevented unrest in town!
Very good! You delivered just in time!
Our knights shall find amusement in the local taverns once the tournament is over! I am worried, though, that we have neither enough taverns nor grape juice! Take care of this problem immediately!
Attain a high satisfaction with the tavern.
Excellent, steward! The town is almost ready, but my daughters and I aren't! I need the most magnificent clothes your tailors can make!
Pay a tribute of 35 clothes.
We're getting close to the tournament's opening now but I don't want to see any sad faces in town! You better make sure that the Townies are happy!
Attain a high happiness.
Welcome, my good steward! As you should know, I'm planning to host the region's greatest joust! I expect you to build at least 3 jousting grounds for this event! Do not disappoint me!
Build 3 jousting grounds.
The guests of our tournament will certainly be hungry! I want you to immediately start producing bread and deliver it as a tribute to your King!
Deliver a tribute of 25 loaves of bread.
Build a windmill and produce flour.
Build 2 bakeries and produce bread.
My Lord, we shouldn't keep the King waiting! We need wheat and flour to start the bread production!
Build a farm and produce wheat.
Very well, my good steward! But bread alone won't be enough to satisfy our guests! I demand fresh fish as a tribute to your King!
Deliver a tribute of 25 fish.
I want the tournament to be unforgettable! Our knights shall wield golden lances and our jousting grounds shall shine and glisten! Do me a favor and collect taxes for your King!
Pay a tribute of 1000 Thaler.
I'm sure our guests would enjoy the delightful taste of our freshly squeezed grape juices! Go and build juice manufactures! You can even serve the low quality waste at the local taverns!
I'm sure our guests would enjoy the delightful taste of our freshly squeezed grape juice!
Build a juice manufacture and produce juice.
Build a weaving mill and produce fabrics.
Build a tailors' shop and produce clothes.
Our knights' tabards are old and faded and it displeases my eyes, steward! Go get some new ones! Build sheep pastures, hire a weaver and build a tailor's shop, if you want to keep your job!
Build 2 sheep pastures.
We should sell more goods for money, my Lord. It's always a good idea to have Thaler disposable to cover possible future expenditures.
Profit from trade worth 500 Thaler.

I see things are progressing well, but your town is still an eyesore! I want fountains and white stone walls and evergreen trees and splendorous statues! You should beautify the town with more decorations!
Increase deco happiness.
At first you are advised to assign a worker to one of the forester huts in the area.
Assign a worker to the foresters’ hut.
One of the main tasks is to build a marketplace.\nTo complete this assignment, you have to establish several resource production chains and collect the necessary resources, my Lord.
Construct a marketplace.
My Lord, I recommend assigning a Townie to the sawmill so we can produce planks as soon as possible.
Assign a worker to the sawmill.
My Lord, I would recommend that you switch to mining stone instead of ore.
As soon as you have gathered some planks and wood you have to assign one of the workers to the mine and start mining stone.
Very well, my Lord. Now we just have to wait until the marketplace has been constructed.
Assign a worker to the mine.
Your second main task is to build a tavern.\n\nWe should start constructing the building immediately.
Build a tavern
Good news, My Lord. Some Townies have arrived to lend us their support in our task. You should build them a townhouse.
Build a townhouse.
We need a toolmaker’s workshop in order to construct the tavern. I recommend constructing a charcoal burner to start with.
Build a charcoal burners hut.
The next building we need is a smelter. This way we can start with the production of iron bars.
Build a smelter.
My Lord! In order to start with the production of tools we need the toolmaker’s workshop constructed in town.
Build a toolmaker’s workshop.
The food supplies are getting low, my Liege. You really should order a Townie to catch some fish or hunt some game. If the Townies don’t get some food fast, they will get less productive.
Produce some food.
My Lord, as a humble merchant I am at your service. I can see you are in a need of coin for your construction projects.\nI would buy some iron ore from you if you like.
Trade some goods with the merchant.
Ran out of money, my Liege? No problem. I am willing to buy some animal skins from you.
Governor, I am in need of some gold nuggets. Are you willing to sell some to me?
My Lord, I don‘t feel that well. A doctor should look at me.
Cure the sick townies.
Fire! A Townie should purge the fire immediately.
Purge the fire.
The bandits annoy us even here. My Lord, we should assign some Townies to the guard towers until the assault has been defended.
Defend the town against the bandits.
My Lord, can we rest a little and have a little snack?
Produce some bread.
My Lord, we have just a few Townies for this challenge. We should assign them on and off the buildings as we see fit.
Congratulations. You have mastered this challenge.
Use the Townies wisely to solve all tasks.
Good news, my Lord. Trees are already regrowing  on the peninsula next to the castle.\n\nI suggest we build forester‘s huts over there to get wood easier.

My Lord, the forester's huts are all decayed and abandoned!

The trees in this region have been completely cut down. The forester's huts are of no use anymore. 
I advise you to destroy all no longer needed buildings to get some wood.
Demolish the forester‘s huts.
My Lord, I guess you should ask the people in this village. They could have some left over wood.
The King is awaiting the first delivery of planks.\n\nWe could assign a Townie to the sawmill and start producing planks. I advise to keep an eye on the stock of wood.
Assign a Townie to the sawmill.
How are you getting along, Governor? I am expecting a total of three deliveries.\n\nYou should prepare the first delivery as soon as possible. Don‘t disappoint me!
Deliver the goods to the King.
My Lord, the King was pleased with the first delivery of planks.\nWe should get the next one ready as soon as we can.
The King is awaiting the last delivery. After he received the planks, the Royal Fleet can be expanded to a noticeable size.\n\nWe should get things done.

Are you wondering why your King doesn‘t have the delivery yet? Well, I think I have an answer for that.\n\nTo make things short: Pay me a little ransom and your delivery should reach the King without further interruptions.
Pay the ransom.

For the construction of the royal fleet I am in need of a lot of planks.
Unfortunately there haven’t been any deliveries in a long time.

Governor, I have a task for you! Find out why the deliveries stopped and solve the problem!
Good job Governor. I knew I could count on you.\n\nThanks to your deeds, the fleet will be ready in no time.
Bring the wood shortage to an end and deliver enough planks to the king.
My Lord, I suggest we use the wood wisely!\n\nWe could build a marketplace, so we can buy wood from the merchants.
Are you in need of wood? I think we can easily negotiate a deal we both agree on. A small pile of wood is available outright, if you want it.\n\nCome and buy as much as you need!
Buy wood from the merchant.
My Lord, you will need deliveries of wood regularly.\n\nIf you would build a Trade Guild, then you can set up some trade orders.
Build a trade guild.
At the trading guild you can set up trade orders for buying and selling.\n\nSet up a trade order for wood, my Lord.
Excellent! As long as you have coin to pay, I will fulfill all your orders.\n\nYour trade orders will be handled until you cancel them.
Set up a trade order for buying wood.
A fire has broken out in the city! We need to build enough fire lookout towers to extinguish the fire and reduce the risk of new fires.
Attain a high fire lookout tower coverage of 80 %.
Bandits! They try to destroy our buildings. We need more soldiers in the town to banish the bandits and we should build more guard towers.
Build enough guard towers and secure the city with enough soldiers.
Another disease! Such a huge city needs one more infirmary.
Another disease! Such a huge city needs one more infirmary.
Build an infirmary and cure the disease.
My Lord, not all the Townies can visit the church because its always full.\n\nWe need more churches to satisfy all townies.
My Lord, the Townies have to wait too long for their drinks. We need more taverns and have to increase the production of juice and brew.
There is no entertainment in this city. We should build a jousting ground.
The Townies are satisfied. But they now ask for luxury goods.\n\nWe can provide them clothes or jewelry.
Some of the Townies complain that the marketplace is too crowded.\n\nWe should build a new marketplace or upgrade the existing one. Otherwise the unhappy Townies will leave the city.
You disappoint me, Governor. Too bad that you couldn‘t fulfill all my tasks.
Excellent my Governor, you completed all my tasks without a single Townie leaving the city.\n\nI will double your reward.
Governor, some of the Townies left the city. I expected more from you.\n\nAt least you could complete all my tasks. You shall get your reward.
My Lord, we have to settle more Townies in our city or the King will be very angry.
Oh no, my Lord. Many Townies already left the city. We can not let any more move out.
Increase your population.
Lord, some Townies have already left the city. We have to take more care of our townies, so they do not move out.
My Governor, a lot of Townies have moved to this little town.\n\nSatisfy all their needs to discourage them from leaving the city again.
Increase your population before the time is running out.
Complete all tasks before the King‘s arrival and keep the population above 150.
The carriers in this city are all overworked my Lord. We should build a new warehouse and assign more carrier townies.
Build a new warehouse and assign more carriers to the castle.
We are running low on food. Let‘s build a new fisherman's hut. This should help.
My Lord, the little bakery is not producing enough bread. We can upgrade it and assign an additional baker.
Upgrade a bakery to level 2 and assign one more baker.
The need of water increased significantly. We can provide water to all Townies by building enough wells.
Construct several wells in the city.
My Lord, we should increase our food stocks. A new hunter‘s cabin or butcher‘s workshop is exactly what we need.
Build a hunter's cabin or butcher's workshop.
Excellent my Lord, we established a good supply. But we still should keep an eye on our Townie's desires.
My Lord, at first we should get some building materials and assign a Townie to the forester's hut across the river.\n\nBuild a cobblestone road over the river so the Townie can start his work.
Build a cobblestone road over the river and assign a Townie to the forester's hut.
Build a road over the river and assign a Townie to the forester's hut.
Moving here was my biggest mistake. I‘m gone!\n\nLord, you should really fulfill our desires or more and more Townies will move out.
No, thanks.
That's a great idea.
I thought you had a progressive mindset... Well, then stay in your mediocrity.
Ah, it's starting to take shape. We must continue our efforts and set up the rest of the production.
We rule the market for household textiles and haute couture! We're going to make a fortune!
Now that the raw material is available, respective buildings are required. A weaver and a tailor will do the job!
Following your decision, great changes will take place in your village. But nothing will be possible without… sheep and a farm in good condition.
Sire, I have just returned from the nearby town. They have beautiful pieces of fabric and gorgeous embroidery. We should take inspiration from it and also produce exceptional clothes.
Silk flowers
The pollen season is back, the inhabitants are sneezing all the time. What if we held a sneezing contest?
Each of them concentrates and performs their most powerful sneeze on their turn. You must choose which one is your favorite, so he or she can be chosen the winner!
ATCHI !
ATCHOUM !
BOURACHOUM !
And here comes our winner! The most successful sneeze! Congratulations! It was remarkable!
The townie prides themself with their reward. This contest didn't bring you much, but maybe your city will become famous for starting the first sneezing contest in history!
No way.
From the castle, you can already hear the crowd gathering in the village square. You also hear sneezing. The contest promises to be a lot of fun!
Numerous townies wait in queues and hold their sneezes to release all their power when they pass in front of the jury, which consists of you and your advisor.
You judge one townie after another. You have written down three names of townies. You pass the list to your advisor, who takes them to the middle of the village square for the sneeze contest finals!
You decide to spread the word in the city, that a competition is organized at the village square. The townie who is judged as the best will receive a reward!
Sire, while waiting for the townies to gather in the square, we should prepare the festivities! Let's start with a bit of decoration.
Decorate the city.
This makes our city a lot more attractive.
We should also check our stocks.
Perfect, we will have everything we need during the festivities.
The Sneezing Contest
Let's do it!
You're right, let's build some statues.
No... I don't want to have statues in my city.
Bravo sir! These sculptures give a particular charm to our city.
Ah Sir, one day perhaps you will worry about these kinds of details.
Sir, our city is sorely lacking in statues. How about adding a few more? In addition, it is believed that statues protect the inhabitants.
Rock-hard angels
Quest completed!
That's a great intention, let him do it.
What a strange person.
Sir, we cannot let the inhabitant do this. Let's build a juggler camp and put this lunatic in charge of entertainment.
Excellent! The population seems delighted with this outcome.

You observe the village in the distance.

The tear hunter is still chasing the townies. More and more people are now refusing to leave their homes.

You move slowly away from the window so that you do no longer witness the damage caused by your choice.
Maybe you should have done something... This strange townie terrorizes the inhabitants and morale only decreases. Let's hope it doesn't last!
Governor, I was told this morning that one of the villagers had set his mind to make everyone happy. He started chasing the inhabitants and forces them to laugh…
The Tear Hunter
We had a close call.
Let us now proclaim that bathing is mandatory. This will reduce disease!
Non-mandatory baths.
You will never learn from your mistakes!
Sire, another disease outbreak has been reported. This time much more severe than the previous one.
This time, Sire, whether you like it or not, I declare mandatory baths!

Your advisor has saved many people from the disease. He even managed to get into the history books. Yet, you were the one who refused the baths. Hundreds of children, even years later, love you for that, because I quote "Bathing is really awful".
Mandatory baths!
That is wise, Sire. We now have a reduction in the occurrence of diseases.
A few days ago, you had public baths installed in your city. Although this is an excellent idea, the townies are afraid of water and do not dare to wash themselves. \n\nWhat should we do?
Heat the water.
Let's store enough wood to be able to heat the water for the baths.
It's perfect. The water is at a pleasant temperature and we have managed to convince some residents to wash.
Unfortunately, your efforts were in vain and the disease still began to spread in your city.
Leave them alone.
As you wish. If outbreaks ever occur in the village, you better not come crying!
For several months, few inhabitants washed themselves. And when one of our townies fell ill, he infected three others! Some were even convinced that the disease came from the baths.
Heal the townies.
Bath time
Bribes.
You went to see the religious and asked, in exchange for a few coins, that they announce in their sermon that bathing will make them beautiful.
Provide the necessary money.
All that remains is to pay the amount to the religious, Sire.
Thank you Governor, so I'll spread your message.
It seems that your efforts have paid off. The disease is less virulent and will be for some time!
Force them!
And here we go! May our criers announce this good news!
Not all the villagers are happy with the idea of bathing regularly. Some even say they feel weaker after soaking.\n\nOthers say the water is too cold and they refuse to have a bath.
Question the magician.
As you were about to question him, a thick smoke began to engulf the whole domaine, you could not even see a meter in front of you.
