Now you are faced with a dilemma: to deliver the necessary resources or to let the situation deteriorate, come hell or high water. You should hurry up and act, who knows what the two magicians at large are capable of doing.
Sire! We failed, the magicians managed to take our resources and run away.
Give resources.
Let's try to provide all the resources to this junk magician!
We were able to produce all the resources requested. All we have to do now is deliver the goods to the specified location.
On your advisor's back, you planted a trap for the magicians. As soon as they come to collect the goods, they will be immediately caught in a net! Let's hope your ingenious idea is effective.
Sire! We managed to catch a second magician!
You have two guards stationed near the resources. The other two magicians show up and are slowly approaching to pick up the resources. When they are halfway there, your guards set the trap.
Do not give in.
So you want to provoke the anger of my brothers. I wouldn't like to be in your shoes, Governor.
The man we work for will make you pay for it!
Ah! You finally admit you're under someone's orders!

The magician bit his lip, in a gesture of regret for having spoken too quickly. So he is sent by someone who is personally angry with you.\n\nNo matter how hard you try to think who it might be, no name comes to mind.
Your adviser comes running, he looks panicked: "Sire! Magicians at our doorstep! They're asking us for hospitality for a few days. Should we accept?
Governor... This is all an unfortunate misunderstanding. My brothers and I didn't want to cause you so much trouble.
So they are your brothers. Why did you start fires?!
We did not want to, Sire. We're a little clumsy, that's all…
Who do you work for? The bandits?!
Far from it! However, if you want to get rid of the thick smoke that is gradually swallowing up your entire territory, you better grant my request.
And what is your request then?
I wish you would give me resources and money!
And then what else? Tell us where to find your brothers!
If you refuse, further disasters are to be expected.
Sire, this person who hired the magicians, couldn't it be the Duke of Cannes? I suddenly remember that he made threats against you when you started writing letters to Queen Frygith.
Your adviser may not be wrong, you remember just now that the Duke of Cannes had proposed to Queen Frygith, but following your meeting and this famous dance, she refused his advances.
You're a cheap wizard! So the Duke of Cannes is your employer!? We know everything!
Indeed... You solved it. Let's make a deal. Give me a good amount of money and me and my brothers will let you be. We won't bother you anymore.
Sire, we are not in a position to negotiate. Let's give him the amount he's asking for and get this magic thing over with. We cannot fight supernatural disasters.
Although you don't like to be pressured, you have to admit that your advisor is right. The well-being of the townies is more important than your ego.
All we have to do now is release the magician and pay him the money.
Glad to have done business with you, Governor!

The magician vanished with the big wad of cash. But you never had to deal with them again.\n\nAs for the Duke of Cannes, you sent a letter to the Queen, who promised to take charge of his case personally. All's well that ends well.
After coming to your senses and saving your city from the flames, you ask the guard to summon the three magicians.
Your soldiers tell you that they have managed to find only one of the three magicians. \n\nThe other two are missing.
Sire! Are you all right? The magicians blew up buildings!
We need to extinguish the fires as soon as possible!
The last of the fires has been brought under control, Sire.

There are three magicians. They seem relieved that you have responded positively to their request. You provide them with a room at the inn. Seeing that they no longer need anything, you return to your duties as Governor.
As soon as you leave the inn, you hear a huge bang. BOOOOOOOOOOOM! Now several buildings are on fire!
Close access.
Oh, no! We have a plague epidemic and several buildings that have caught fire! It's probably a magicians' trick!
Hahahahahahahaha!
Let's hurry up and heal the townies and put out the fires!
Once again, we have escaped a real disaster…
Continue the research.
We will continue the search, Sire!
There's one! Get him!
Your guards start chasing the second magician, when suddenly, a thick smoke covers the village. Your guards stop their pursuit, no longer seeing where they're going.
Sire, we are facing a new problem! We can no longer move fast! It's like we're walking through jelly!
We should retreat into the castle and question this magician we managed to capture.

Following the advice, you decide to barricade yourself in the castle grounds, in order to start the interrogation of the first magician. In addition, you ask the chief of the guard to secure the castle so that no one can enter or leave the castle.

You decide to keep the two magicians away from each other and question the magician you managed to catch, thanks to your amazing trap.\n\nUnfortunately, you didn't manage to recover the resources, the third magician took them with him.

The second magician seems much more confident than the first. And without hesitation he tells you this: "Congratulations Governor, you caught me with my hand in the cookie jar. But know that if you don't free me immediately, terrible things will happen to your village.
Free him.

You are far too afraid of what your village might go through and decide to free him.\n\n"You are a player, Governor," said the magician, before disappearing into a halo of smoke the very moment the guards removed the chains.
Sire! The first magician also escaped! His brother appeared next to him and then they both disappeared!
...We're back to square one.
We will patrol for these rascals, Sire! You can trust us.
All we have to do now is wait for the patrols to return, Sire.

For a long time, your guards have been trying to find these magicians. Unsuccessfully so far. However, day after day, the city saw the strange cloud of smoke that was slowing everyone down slowly dissipate.\n\nThe mystery surrounding these magicians will remain unsolved.
Keep him prisoner.
The Magicians
Send them in.
Blue.
Green.
A bold choice, I must say. The blue one. Who could hate such a pretty color? The color of dream, wisdom and loyalty. That says a lot about you, Governor.
We received a guest in the renovated room of the castle, Sire.
Unfortunately, the colours of the room have kept him awake and he holds you entirely responsible.
Oh Sire, our guest was delighted by this room. He particularly liked the color! He decided to give us some prestige.

It is true that green has a reputation for signifying misfortune. But it is also a symbol of hope, luck and stability. It is in harmony with all the other colors of nature. I have to say, it's a good choice.
Governor, we just renovated one of the rooms of the castle. What color would be better?
The Room
Absolutely not.
Send spies.
There is no such thing as magic.
Summon the witch.
Sire, that's awful. How is that possible? Could it be a magician who is adept in dark magic?! No one should have such powers!
That's a wise decision. Let's send our best spies to follow this crazy townie and wait for their report.

Your spies came back with a report.\n\n"We followed this townie, the thief of joy. It seems that his word triggers great sadness in the inhabitants. The townies don't remember the joyful moments of their lives.

Sire! One of our inhabitants seems to be stealing the joy from his comrades. \n\nSeveral townies have filed complaints against this thief. Here is the testimony of one of the victims: "He came to talk to me one morning. I listened carefully to him and suddenly I felt very sad. As if his words were consuming my joy.
Sire, should we do anything to solve this problem?
Governor, what should we do?
Help the witch.
There are no such things as ghosts!

The measures we have taken seem to be working well, Sire. 

The thief of joy continues his misdeeds, but we will fight him now. 

Should we send the guards and bring him to justice for his actions?
Let justice be done.
Do nothing.

You're a sensible person. Only science can explain and solve this problem of the thief of joy.

You call your best scientists to work on a formula that would allow the townies to be happy again.

Of course, science is not free. Scientists are asking for a lot of money. Otherwise, you can wave goodbye to happiness altogether.

This joy thief problem didn't alarm you enough. However, cases of depressed townies have continued to increase drastically.

Disoriented, you went to take refuge in your castle. Not knowing what to do about this disaster. They say that time heal all wounds. 

Let's hope your patience isn't wearing thin.
The witch is gone. Some say she even left the village, not wanting to suffer like everyone else because of you.
Shortly after she left. The situation has become unbearable. All the villagers are overcome with deep sadness.\n\nWho knows how long this will last?
Let's send guards to get him!
Your guards have been searching for hours and hours. Nothing. They all came back sad and depressed. Yet they say they heard the thief of joy, but they never saw him.

Shortly after the guards returned, an owl flew by with a message from the witch.\n\nShe revealed that the thief of joy was none other than a ghost who fed on the joy of the people. Leaving them with nothing but sadness and despair.

Despite the efforts of your scientists to delay the process, the whole village was left unhappy. With the witch gone, you had no approach left to defend yourself against this ghost. \n\nLet's hope that time will heal the townies.
Time has passed and the village is back in its good mood. This thief of joy is now but a distant memory.
Ask the witch for advice.
Negotiate.
Sire, I will try to negotiate with these scientists. Let me do it, I'll take care of everything!
Your adviser, this fine negotiator has succeeded in lowering the price of scientists! Well done.
Ouch. Your advisor was unable to negotiate properly. Scientists have now increased their prices and no longer want to discuss with you.
Pay the scientists.
If we have to pay, then let us pay, because if we continue waiting, it will be our doom.

Your inhabitants are simply suffering from depression, Governor. They can't see a silver lining in anything. \n\nThe solution is to show them the bright side of life and prove to them that life is not so gloomy.
Let's start by adding some decorations and building brewing fest grounds. Music lifts morals.

The city is starting to feel better. Some inhabitants, whose joy had disappeared, seem to regain consciousness of the little joys of life.\n\nHowever, the thief of joy continues to strike horror into people's hearts.
Thief of joy
It's been years since we've had recourse to this witch, Governor... I hope this does not bring more misery to our village than we already have.
Good morning, Governor. Good to see you again. So you're in trouble?
After explaining the situation to the witch, she just smiles. Has she found the solution to your concern or is she playing a bad trick on you?
Well, then speak! Why are you smiling like that?
Your thief of joy does not exist, Sire.
But it has to be true because one of our spies suffered the consequences of talking to him!

He simply saw a ghost of sadness. It occasionally appears after the construction of a religious establishment. They are spirits who feed on people's joy. \n\nBy absorbing joy, the ghost gains strength and increases its powers. Unfortunately, joy does not return to the people he stole from.
How do we get rid of it?
I know a solution, however, I would need your help.
We will help you. What do you need?
We need a mausoleum and gravestones.
As good as done!
We have completed your quest, witch. It's time you show us what you can do.

The witch is heading to the mausoleum and disappears inside. You hear incantations. Suddenly, a wind is getting up, a terrible storm seems to be brewing.

The witch is still not coming out of this mausoleum. 

You suddenly sense great sadness. You feel very cold and surrounded by darkness.

Then, in the distance, a ray of sunshine. A very small sunray. You focus on it. It is becoming more and more intense. 

The sunray seems to take the form of a memory. One of yours. Your happiest memory.

You feel good again.
Governor... What was that all about? Did you feel that too?
Sire, you are now free of the ghost of sadness. From the look of your expressions, I guess you encountered him. It's over now. He's trapped.
It was awful! Thank you so much!
The village is now rid of this strange ghost. The inhabitants have regained their joy and they are grateful to you.
Sire, if you won't help me in this ghost project, I can assure you that it will be your doom.
So be it! Get out of my sight with your evil witchcraft!
Let them play.
I want to play!
A board game festival?! What a strange idea, sir. How are we going to do that?
Sir, our soldiers play so much in their watchtowers that the inhabitants do not feel protected at all. What do we need to do?
The Tower Games
We need wood and stone.
We need to find game ideas and designers.
With a small donation, we could increase our reputation with the King, my Liege.
Build a guard tower in range of a barracks.
Water
Be quiet, will you?
Let us start building the well to prevent these kinds of incidents.
Oh Sir, please, our crops are in danger, if you do nothing, we will never get a chance to have a peaceful winter.
The Governor has already spoken out on this issue. If you keep coming to the castle and telling us about your whining, we're going to have to lock you up.
… You'll be disappointed soon!
SIR! THE FIELDS! It's awful! Nothing grows anymore, the heat has been so intense that our crops are ruined. You should have trusted that farmer a little bit more.... Now it is too late.
Let us make haste and build wells, Sir.
The construction of the wells has been completed. Prevention is better than cure! The future will tell us if we were right to listen to this farmer.
Oh Sir! The farmers told me that a heat wave hit their fields BUT thanks to the construction of the wells, you avoided a lot of trouble.
Sir! I had another premonitory dream! The fields were on fire. Nothing was growing anymore. No water was available.
Premonition
Give her a herbal tea to calm her down.
Well, speaking of herbal tea - we're going to spread the idea. Let the surrounding cities know that hot water with herbs and a catchy slogan is great.
Improve defenses!
Let's improve the military defenses, Governor!
We have done some great work, "the herbal tea that makes you forget the sheep" is an innovative slogan…
Let's wait now... For all we know, we made all this fuss over nothing. We should have given her a herbal tea...
Despite your expectations, as well as the improvement of defenses in case of surprise attacks by bandits, they never came. However, you now have some lovely military buildings to admire.
Oh no, Sir. The old lady is doing it again! She's shouting from the rooftops that the witch of the forest will make her way through our village and destroy everything in her path.
The Witch's Path

Ah Sire! 

It was incredible down there! A lake of immensity and beauty! 

The woman was there! I ran after her for a good kilometer in the tunnels of the mine, before I lost sight of her.

And then... when I thought I'd come home empty-handed, I saw thousands of lights. Oh Sire, you should have seen that, I've never seen anything like it! \n\nShe told me about her plans to escape with all the loot and start a new life elsewhere. Ever since her husband's death, she has had trouble staying here, too many memories…
Sire, we are now ready to enter the mine to find the loot. Several crosses are indicated on the map.\n\nWhere to start?
Northern Hiding Place
South Hiding Place
Oh, SIRE! We were lucky! Our team managed to escape unscathed. The tunnels have collapsed!
The result of this first expedition is very satisfying! Your people managed to return safe and sound from this expedition and with a part of the pirate's treasure as a bonus.
Sire, we are now ready to enter the mine a second time.\n\nWhich hiding place should we check?
Eastern Hiding Place
Western Hiding Place
An incredible opportunity is offering itself to us, Sire! Twice we have emerged victorious from this treasure hunt!

You are carefully studying the mine plans. You can see the location of an underground lake, fed by a river that leads straight to the sea. A very useful access for pirates!\n\nHowever, these tunnels are not safe and they are in danger of collapsing at any time.
Good news! While you were helping this blacksmith, your advisor was able to get plans of the mine.
Secure the mine.
Send scouts to this mine!
Let's invest in the mine so that it can be secured, Sire. This is a task that requires a lot of resources from us, but I assure you that you will not regret it.

Unbelievable, Sire! We managed to secure the mine! Our first scouts went out on patrol and found the pirate's wife!\nShe managed to escape, but she left a map of the mine with cross-marked areas. I think these are the places where the treasure is hidden!
All we have to do now is pay the tribute, Sire.
Scouts, scouts... We don't have 50! I'm going to do it myself. But I, at least, need certain equipment first.
All right, I'm all set!
Your advisor went to the mines to find out a little more about this woman.
Bring me the necessary equipment to make this mission a success.
You suddenly lose your patience with this blacksmith. You order him to get this equipment as soon as possible and that his urgent order is not your concern. That you don't care if he goes bankrupt.
I... I will bring this to you as soon as possible, Sir…

You were rude to refuse to help this blacksmith. You have to understand, he has to work for a living and this delivery seemed to be very important for the economy of your city. I hope he won't hold it against us.
Ouch, Sire.... You should have been more cautious. The blacksmith told everyone how you treated him. Several townies are now protesting. And the blacksmith refuses to return to the castle.
Sire, I see no alternative but to build a jousting grounds. This will distract the people and allow them to release tensions.
The inhabitants seem to have calmed down. However, we are not done with this pirate story!
Sire, jousting grounds are necessary. Otherwise the townies will be neither happy nor productive. This strike will waste precious time on this pirate and mine affair.
Sire, while we were busy with this revolt, the pirate's wife took the opportunity to recover the loot that was in the mines. That was where the treasure was!

Our spies found a note from this woman saying that she could no longer bear the absence of her husband and that she was going to isolate herself a little on a heavenly island where she owns a small castle.
It seems we have missed a nice sum of money, Sire. See where your hasty decisions lead us? Anyway, we can now turn the page on this event.
Let's build a jousting grounds.
You are wrong to take this kind of decision lightly, Sire. Who knows what we might have discovered?
A few days after you refused to deal with this complaint, the mine collapsed. Your people hold you responsible for this tragic event.
Your people are beginning to forget this whole mine thing that collapsed. Time has passed and their morale is high.
We were unable to access the locations indicated on the map, Sire. We could not bring back any loot. But we're alive, that's the most important thing.

Despite your failure, this adventure has brought you some prestige. Who would have thought that pirates could hide such treasures in your mines?\n\nFor now though, your career as a treasure hunter has ended.
Oh, Sire. I am told that the tunnels in the mine have collapsed! We were lucky to be able to come back twice with treasures.

For once, you decide to organize a big meal for your soldiers, to thank them kindly for bringing you these treasures.\n\nThis pirate story is now far behind you. Who knows? Perhaps one day you will find a map that will lead you to other mysteries.
The treasure will soon be yours! \n\nYou give the order to your soldiers to go and find this treasure and bring it back to you.

Unbelievable! Look at everything we found in those mines! You were right to secure them before sending your people there. An incredible wealth! The rumors about this pirate were true all along. We're rich now!
With the information we have, there's not much we can do. It would be wise to seek out an expert for advice.
Summon a miner.
That's a good idea, Sire. Maybe they can give us a map of the mines and help us to understand more.
Sire, I am glad you asked me to help. I brought with me the plans of the mines. I hope this will help you.\n\nThese tunnels are old and I fear that they will collapse.
Summon the blacksmith.
The blacksmith will surely know how to provide us with information on the stones that this woman is trying to break.

Sire, we have received several complaints about the mines.\nA woman goes there every day, she moves stones, sometimes breaks them. But what is certain is that she is always going further and further into the tunnels.
Go find out about this woman.
It is not my concern.
Townies are worried, tunnels are not secure and the mine could collapse at any time.\n\nIt is our duty to check what is going on behind this story.
I hope you learned your lesson!
While your advisor is out hunting for clues, it would be a good idea for you to take care of your town for a while. Try to improve the lives of your people.
Here I am again, Sire! I followed this woman on a tailing operation. It has not been easy.

It seems she's looking for an object. I saw her breaking several stones and looking carefully at the debris.\n\nUnfortunately, I couldn't follow her very far. She seems to know mines like the back of her hand!

Your advisor has returned from his mission with news.
In her report, it states that this woman has recently become a widow. 

Her husband was a very famous pirate. It is said that he possessed the greatest treasure of all time and that he has hidden it not far from here.
I have a theory, Sire. I think this woman was threatened by other pirates to reveal exactly where the treasure is!
Continue the investigation.
Let it go.
The woman and the mine
The blacksmith arrives in a hurry. Your guards pulled him out of his forge. He seems preoccupied.
Sir, what can I do for you?
We are currently on a mission and we need your expertise.
I'm listening.

Your advisor explains the case to the blacksmith.\n\nHe also shows him the broken stones he was able to pick up. You can see from the corner of your eye that the blacksmith seems to recognize this type of stone.
Holy Moly! Those are a lot of geodes!
Geodes, you say?
They are special crystals, they can contain treasures. Quite often it's crystals that can be very precious.\n\nSome pirates used codes based on geodes to remember where their treasures were hidden.

I have some of them in my workshop, I can show you how to open them with the right tool.\n\nBut... I have an important and urgent delivery to send and I would appreciate your help. As a token of your gratitude for the information I have provided to you.
Refuse.
Accept.
I have to produce tools for miners. It's a big order.
These are the geodes. Look, I'll show you. With this device, they can be easily opened. Quite often, there is nothing particular about it, but sometimes we come across pure wonders!
CRR CRR… CLING !
Oh sir, look into this geode! That's a magnificent thing!
Search for new ore deposits?
Repair everything!
Do you want to repair all buildings?

Welcome, my Liege. On these countless little islands, we can build a town connected by bridges. What a splendid idea, don’t you think?
This wonderful island is a nice place for a village, don’t you think so too, my Lord?\n\nI believe it won’t take long until the King will provide us our first tasks for us to complete.
My Lord, the war has finally ended. Now we stand before the ruins of our once so beautiful town. We should start rebuilding at once, my Liege. The upcoming winter will not be easy on us…
My Lord, a messenger has delivered new orders from the King.\n\nThe King would be very pleased if you would make time to fulfill his requests.
Complete all tasks within the time limit to win the wager!

Steward, as your King I am really proud of you.
You managed to complete all tasks I gave you with flying colors and organized a truly magnificent tournament.

I will remember that, when declare the next duke.

Thank you very much, my Lord.

You showed that you really care about our town. The preparations for the coming winter are now complete.

My brothers and I are convinced that you are indeed the perfect Governor for our town and we all agreed upon organizing a festival in your name in the coming spring.

Darling, it is really touching to see how you took care about that little town.\nThe King is very pleased about your tribute and will send some support soon.\nI think we should stay in this town for a while and attend business. The view over the delta is simply too gorgeous to leave, don't you think?

Your Town name

Buildings can be built by expending either resources or Prestige.\n\nResources have to be transported to the construction site for the construction to proceed. This takes time. Using Prestige, on the other hand, is instantaneous.
Your Townies will leave burning buildings and wait for the flames to be put out. When the flames are not put out for some time, the building will collapse!
As your town grows, the risk of a fire breaking out is increasing. You should build a fire lookout tower to be prepared.
The fire lookout tower has a limited range. Firefighters can only put out fires that are within this range.\n\nPlace it at a location where it covers as many buildings as possible.

The needs of your Townies are food and water.\nIn addition to that, your Townies have desires.\nThe happiness value is the sum of all needs and desires. You should always keep an eye on your Townies' happiness!
Welcome to the Tutorial. Now you will learn the basics of Townsmen.
Move the screen by dragging the map with the left mouse button. Zoom in and out by using the mouse-wheel.
You can move the camera by swiping over the screen. You can zoom in and out by using the + and - buttons.
Move the camera by swiping over the screen. Zoom in and out by pinching with two fingers.
The castle is your most important building. It acts as your first warehouse and you can assign Townies to be carriers here.

On the upper right side of the screen you can see how much Prestige and Thaler you have, as well as the number of unassigned Townies and your town's size.\n\nImportant messages are shown on the upper left.
Prestige is a special currency that grants you various advantages. Always keep an eye out for the crown icon!
Each townhouse increases the number of available workers.
Now you have to take care of your Townies' needs and desires. All important information can be found in the statistics menu.
The icons that are displayed over buildings and the alert messages will inform you about a lack of storage space and other problems.
Use the fast forward feature to speed up time in the game. You can spend Prestige to recharge it.
Your town looks very nice!\n\nYou can save a screenshot by clicking the camera button. When taking screenshots, the icons will be disabled automatically.
Your town looks very nice!\n\nYou can save a screenshot on your device by tapping the camera icon.
The Townshop has great offers for acquiring additional Prestige or to remove the ad banners, if you are playing the free version! You can take a look at it any time.
The Townshop has great offers for acquiring additional Prestige, unlocking unlimited fast forward or buying unlimited double XP. You can take a look at it any time.
Resources and goods are temporarily stored in production buildings until they are either used for production or transported to the warehouse.
Build a well.
You just received your first quest! Your town needs wood! Enter the build menu and look for the forester's hut!
Roads speed up the transport of goods and resources, but you should plan their construction wisely.\n\nNow build some roads in your town.

When not regularly maintained, buildings deteriorate and may even catch fire. You can identify deteriorated buildings by their grimy appearance.\n\nClick on a building to access the building's menu and then use the repair button to repair the building.

When not regularly maintained, buildings deteriorate and may even catch fire. You can identify deteriorated buildings by their grimy appearance.\n\nTap on a building to access the building's menu and then use the repair icon to repair the building.
Don't forget to keep an eye on the statistics menu to stay current on your Townies' needs and desires!
In addition to public buildings, like the marketplace, your Townies' happiness is also increased by town decorations!
With your freed-up worker you can now build another townhouse.
Buildings without workers assigned to them are dormant. Get more workers to continue production.\n\nYou should assign a new worker to the forester's hut.
Fisherman's huts supply your village with fish as a food resource. Build a fisherman's hut to satisfy your villagers need for food.
The well supplies your village with water. Build a well to satisfy your Townies' need for water.
Your townhouses pay taxes regularly. The amount of Thaler generated depends on happiness and tax rate.\n\nClick the coins over the townhouses to collect the taxes!
Your townhouses regularly pay taxes. The amount of Thaler generated depends on happiness and tax rate.\n\nTap the coins over the townhouses to collect the taxes!

Some buildings use resources to produce goods.
To speed up building a sawmill use the "instant build" feature.

You can also use prestige to instantly complete a construction site by clicking the button in the context menu of the site.

Some buildings use resources to produce goods.
To speed up building a sawmill use the "instant build" feature.

You can also use prestige to instantly complete a construction site by tapping the appropriate icon in the context menu of the site.
You should build two additional townhouses to increase your workforce.
Your Townies will be happier when you build a marketplace for them.
You should sell some goods at the market.\nKeep an eye out for the merchant icon. It informs you when the merchant is in town.

You should assign another carrier to the castle. The more carriers you have, the faster the goods will be transported between buildings.\nClick the castle and assign a worker to one of the empty slots!
You should assign another carrier to the castle. The more carriers you have, the faster the goods will be transported between buildings.\nTap the castle and assign a worker to one of the empty slots!
Now it's time to turn your attention to your Townies' desires. How about constructing a church to satisfy their desire for religious life?

You should now build another townhouse to increase your population. But since you are lacking workers for this task, you first need to unassign a worker from the forester's hut.\n\nClick on the forester's hut to open the building's menu and then on the worker icon.

You should now build another townhouse to increase your population. However, since you lack workers to do this, you need to unassign a worker from the forester's hut.\n\nTap on the forester's hut to open the building's menu and then tap the worker icon.

You should now build another townhouse to increase your population. However, since you lack workers to do this, you need to unassign a worker from the forester's hut.\n\nTap on the forester's hut to open the building's menu and then tap the worker icon.

You should build a farm to make sure that food production is ready to support a larger population. A farm will supply your village with wheat that can be processed into flour, which is used to make bread.
In addition to wood, stone is also one of your most important resources. You should build a mine at a rocky hillside and start to quarry stone.
Build a forester's hut.
Build 2 roads in your town
Repair your townhouses.
Attain high Townie happiness.
Build a deco statue!
Build a new townhouse.
Reassign a worker to the paused building.
Build a fisherman's hut.
Collect 40 Thaler in taxes.
Build a sawmill, but this time use the "instant build" feature!
Build two more townhouses.
Build a marketplace.
Earn 50 Thaler of profit through trading at the market.
Assign another carrier to the castle.
Build a church.
Unassign a worker from a building!
Stop the sawmill production by removing the worker.
Build a mine.
Most quests will reward you with Prestige. Open the quest log and collect your rewards.

Once the tutorial is over you can demolish a building by selecting the demolish icon in the building's menu. Demolishing a building retrieves some of the resources that were used to build it.\n\nDecorations, forests and roads can be erased with the "shovel" tool. When in "shovel mode" you can drag the mouse over multiple objects or select individual objects you want to remove.

Once the tutorial is over you can demolish a building from the building's menu. Demolishing a building retrieves some of the resources that were used to build it.\n\nDecorations, forests and roads can be removed by activating the "shovel" mode and swiping over the object you want to remove.
Housing conditions affect your Townies' happiness and productivity.\nUnhappy villagers are less productive and sometimes they even go on strike and refuse to work!
Excellent! You have learned a lot about the world of Townsmen. This concludes the Tutorial.\n\nNow you can start one of the scenarios or a sandbox game!
The more Townies you have, the more decorative objects you need to keep up happiness!
As long as you have unassigned Townies, your construction sites will be manned immediately. Now go and get your reward from the quest log!
In Townsmen, the male Townies work as carriers, resource producers and craftsmen while the Townettes see to keeping the home stocked with food, water and luxury goods.
The better you are at fulfilling your Townies' needs and desires, the happier and more productive your Townies will be! Happier Townies can also be taxed higher without incurring too much protest.
The sawmill is part of a production chain that turns wood logs into planks. Later you will encounter more complex production chains.
At the marketplace you can trade goods when a merchant is in town. However, his stock will be limited.\nThe market is also the place where Townettes go to pick up jewelry and clothes, if available.
When you are low on money and have a surplus of goods, you can sell some of the goods to make some quick Thaler.
You can assign more Townies as carriers by building more warehouses.
Each type of public building addresses a different wish of your Townies. There are several public buildings, for example the church, the tavern or the jousting grounds.
In addition to wheat you can also produce wool at a farm. For this you have to build a sheep pasture next to the farm building and reassign a farm worker to wool production.
Sparkling patches at rocky mountainsides indicate iron ore or gold deposits. If you place a mine at an ore deposit, you can assign your worker to dig for iron ore or gold instead of quarrying stone.

Here you can see all your stored resources.

Available goods from the main storage are shown to the left, wares stored in the buildings are shown to the right.

Only goods that have been transported to the main storage can later be sold at the marketplace.
You can bolster tax revenue by increasing the tax rate. However, keep an eye on how the tax rate affects happiness and productivity!
Tutorial town
Townies not only have needs but also desires, like public buildings, good housing conditions, decorations, clothes and jewelry!

- Townies can get sick => cure them with the infirmary
- Townies eventually leave town, when not cured
- Fire can break out in town => fight fire with the fire lookout tower
- Badly maintained buildings have a risk of fire breaking out
- Buildings can now burn down!
- Townies will now leave town when their homes are destroyed

Update Changelog: Townsmen v1.6 - „Bandits vs Soldiers“

Raiding bandits can now rob resources, lay fire or demolish buildings in your town!

The whole Kingdom is ravaged by the plague. His majesty the King wants you to lead a new initiative to fight this new outbreak of the devastating illness. Heal your population!
The Black Death
Let it be known throughout the kingdom: His majesty the King has declared war on the neighboring country. All stewards are advised to fortify their towns and build guard towers.
Border conflict

A new edict has just been signed by his majesty. The losses in livestock have to be compensated. A lot of animals have died because of the unknown illness that struck farms all over the kingdom. Breed pigs, my lord.
Large scale breeding

The King was very disappointed the last time he visited the country villages. Most of the towns were ruinous at best. So he ordered governors from all over the country to initiate the new craftsmen edict. Every town shall construct enough carpenter‘s workshops so the towns are in the best condition the next time the King visits.
Craftsmen Edict
By order of the leader of the diocese! The neglection of the faith is not tolerated anymore. The stewards of the country are advised to construct more churches in their villages!
Church convention
It's cold outside and the townsfolk have no appropriate clothes. Be so benevolent and produce some clothes.
Clothes for the people

The kingdom is suffering the fourth month of prolonged drought. It is your task to ensure that fires in your town are extinguished immediately. It would be a disaster if the town fell victim to the flames.
Conflagration
The King has ordered the enlargement of the town. Vow obedience and start constructing new buildings straightaway!
Construction project
Your lordship has been nominated to complete several special assignments by his Majesty the King. Complete several scenarios successfully!
Dedication to the Kingdom

The King is planning a nation-wide event to celebrate his successful campaign against the bandit incursion. He wants new fairground buildings in every town of the country. Make the necessary preparations for it!
Celebrations
A grand festivity is planned by his majesty. The King has ordered your town to provide the necessary amount of brew for the guests.
Festivity supplies

The people are worrying about the fire safety of the villages in the Kingdom. Countless buildings have already been consumed by the flames. It would be wise to order the construction of more fire towers.
Safety first

Since the beginning of the age of discovery, the King is desperately trying to construct a fleet of fast ships to start a large expedition. You have to produce a large amount of wood planks so His Majesty can complete the task.
A new fleet
A new decree has come in by horseback messenger. You have been ordered to embellish the town to increase the glorification of his majesty. Build decorations!
The King's glorification

Since the neighboring Kingdom had a vast inflation and a degrading currency, his Majesty the King has ordered all stewards to increase production of gold ingots. This way we can combat inflation and detach our own country from financial dependencies to our neighbors. Produce gold ingots, steward!
Gold reserves

My Lords and Ladies, the Kingdom is in grave danger. The plague is spreading and without the necessary infirmaries, most towns will suffer a lot of casualties. Each town of the country will have to build more infirmaries or the Kingdom is doomed!
Medical emergency

News from the front! Our brave soldiers are winning the war! But they need the support of every village in the country. The best swords are made out of the finest iron ingots. Our smelters just need to produce more ingots.
The real iron
My Lord, the nobles are complaining about a lack of luxury goods. Would you be so kind and produce more jewelry?
Shine bright like a diamond

The King has made the following decree: He wants to find out who is the best knight of the country. All stewards are ordered to begin construction of jousting grounds in every village of the Kingdom. Soon the biggest tournament the world has ever seen will start.
Grand Championship
His Majesty plans to hold a banquet for guests from the neighboring countries. Preparations are almost done, only a large amount of grape juice is missing.
Juice for the Banquet

A horseback messenger just brought news about the next fashion trends from the capital. The King‘s new fashion advisor has ordered the finest leather from all over the country. For the collection of his newly invented leather jackets he needs tremendous amounts of leather.
The newest fashion
After his last visit to your town, the King has witnessed the startling decay of the town firsthand. He ordered the repairs of the buildings in your lands to be taken straightaway.
Maintenance duty

Since the King has ordered to increase trading with the neighboring countries, the actual amount of goods traded was very low. This has to change. We need a lot more marketplaces to fulfill this order!
Trade mission

The townsfolk is starving, my Lord. We have to produce food for the village, fast! Meat would be sufficient enough to ensure a healthy diet for the villagers. Send some hunters into the woods, my Lord. We need meat for the townsfolk.
Food supplies
Get your quest reward!
A horseback messenger has delivered a decree from the court. It bestows you with a new position of governance for several years. Don't disappoint the King.
Contract by the year

After several months of a raging plague in the country, it is now time to repopulate your town. The King has ordered the construction of large townhouses, since it's deemed unsafe to live in the old, plague-ridden buildings.
New buildings for the town

Sausages!

The King‘s soldiers love these delicacies. The military leadership advises you to extend your production of these exquisite goods.
Supplies for the troops
The King has ordered all counties to stock up on bread for a harsh winter, before it is too late. Winter is coming, Lord…
Produce supplies for the winter
A drought has devastated our neighboring countries output in food resources. The King has promised to support them with goods. Your town has been selected to produce wheat for the neighbour.
Support for the neighbor
To ensure the successful war against organized bandit gangs in the Kingdom, his Majesty has ordered a large amount of taxes to be collected by the communities.
Taxes levied
By order of the King and with immediate effect, all Lords are to clear the forests around their towns of bandit camps!
The bandit campaign
My liege, the town has to be expanded in order to complete our tasks. First we have to establish a stable economy. For that, we need to produce tools.
New Tools of the trade

The King demands that his villagers around the kingdom do not have to live in fear of bandits raiding their town anymore. He instructs all lords to ensure that the towns are well protected and bandit raids are intercepted forthwith.
Town guard
A new trade agreement between the Kingdom and it's neighbors has taken effect. You are ordered to increase the profit at the market by trading surplus resources.
General agreement of trade

By order of his majesty the King, your town has been nominated to serve as host for the Kingdoms defensive force. As the lord in question, you have to ensure the army is levied in time by building enough barracks.
Undersized army
By order of the King, all Lords have been advised to produce armors for the war effort. Everyone has to contribute one's share to the victory over our enemies.
War effort

The King‘s soothsayer has notified us about several upcoming events: apocalypse, demon invasion, normal war and several smaller catastrophes of no consequence. To ensure each village is prepared, the King‘s adviser recommends to build more warehouses. This way, enough room is available for the goods worried villagers might like to store.
Panic buying
The King has made the following request: The front shall be supplied with newly smithed weapons to support the King‘s army.
Weapons transport
Visit the encyclopedia to get help!
The encyclopedia is located in the options menu. There you can find important information about the game.
Sometimes the merchant is not available due to events or weather conditions. This prevents you to make trades until the event is over.

We are using device identifiers and similar data for personalized advertisement and analyzing the usages of our products.

This game uses Flurry Analytics which places an agent into an application, so that performance data is tracked, logged and reported back for analysis. This information is confidential and available only to the developer to analyze and aggregate. Individual user data is not identifiable.

This game uses Google Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Google, Inc. ("Google"). Google Analytics uses "cookies", which are text files placed on your device, to help analyze how users use the game. The information generated by the cookie about your use of the game (including your IP address) will be transmitted to and stored by Google on servers in the United States. Google will use this information for the purpose of evaluating your use of the game, compiling reports on game activity for game operators and providing other services relating to game activity and internet usage. Google may also transfer this information to third parties where required to do so by law, or where such third parties process the information on Google's behalf. Google will not associate your IP address with any other data held by Google. By using this game, you consent to the processing of data about you by Google in the manner and for the purposes set out above.

This game uses Kiip to present offers and rewards to the user. Kiip and its affiliates may track user data according to their respective privacy policies. For further information, visit https://app.kiip.me/privacy

This game uses SponsorPay to present offers and rewards to the user. SponsorPay and its affiliates may track user data according to their respective privacy policies. For further information, visit www.sponsorpay.com/privacy-policy/

This game uses SupersonicAds to present offers and rewards to the user. SupersonicAds and its affiliates may track user data according to their respective privacy policies. For further information, visit http://www.supersonicads.com/about-us/privacy-policy/

Lord, how about we maintain this momentum to continue improving the village. The agriculture could be expanded. How about a hop kiln? This would allow us to produce and process hops.
Bravo, Sire. From now on, our town will certainly be known for its good hops.
Your Lordship, we have just received a message from the neighboring country. They are suffering from famine and are asking us to share our food. Should we send them the necessary raw materials?

My Lord, it's terrible. We have received news from our neighbor. The famine is driving people onto the streets. There are uprisings and many deaths. The King there has been murdered... The country is destabilized and waves of refugees are on their way to us. We should have helped them...
Time left to help our neighbors:
We got the necessary resources in stock, my Liege. All we have to do now is to deliver the goods in order to help our neighbors. Time is running out!
The neighboring country thanks us warmly, Sire! I believe, we have just saved them from starvation. Who knows what could have happened if we had not made that gesture?
Help the neighboring country.
Damn it, Governor! Look around you! Do you notice anything?\n\nYES, exactly! Where are the decorations? Everything looks so dreary! Hurry and build decorations before the King reaches the city.
Well, that's much better! Good thing I was there to remind you of these simple things.

Sire, I finally found you. Our village could really use another source of food along with bread. What about a fisherman's hut as well as a hunter's cabin? This would allow us to eat a more balanced diet.
Thank you, Lord, for your kindness. We now have enough food sources to improve our diet. As a result, the inhabitants will be able to live much healthier lives.
Build fisherman’s hut and a hunter’s cabin.
Considering the work we are about to undertake, it would be wise to build an additional townhouse.
That's better! This new home will also be an additional source of income.
Governor, may I welcome you to this village. At the moment, it is just a small town, but I am sure you will make this place flourish, Sir.
Speaking of prosperity, I have a very important job for you. As you can see, I am no longer the youngest, and although I may still have many good years ahead of me, my time here will soon be over.
I would like to leave a trace of my reign here which could inspire future generations. I already have some ideas, but I need your assistance to make them a reality.

I will send you letters containing memories from my life. Each remembrance will be the subject of a task for you. Do not disappoint me. When the last letter is sent, I will come and visit you in the village.
By being closer to his people, he was able to help them better. So he would like to see a tavern built in this city, where tales and legends from other lands could be passed on.

The first letter has arrived. It is very interesting, Sire! When our good King was still a young teenager, his father forced him to join the common folk in order to understand the tasks of each individual Townie.

Thus, every week, he discovered a new profession of his people. One week as a lumberjack, the next one as a fisherman or even an innkeeper. Afterwards, he was able to more accurately estimate the needs of his people. That is remarkable, my Lord!
The profession of innkeeper has particularly challenged him. At first he thought it was only parties and drinks, so he found himself very deprived when he realized that it was offering a lot more.
The tavern allowed for informal debates. From philosophy to the stories told by foreign travelers, everything was a source of wonder and reflection.
Wonderful, Sire! The inhabitants are delighted with this new place full of life and warmth. The long winter evenings will be more pleasant this way.
It is said that our application to work can bring us the greatest treasure. To honor his ancestor, the King ordered us to build vines on our land. Have you already thought about a location?
We have just received the second letter. The King tells us about his childhood in the southern vineyards. During the summer, he often went there to meet his grandmother.
She told him many fables. The one that most impressed him was the one of the farmer and his sons, where he learned the importance of work.
The King is very proud to see the vineyards in our village. The farmers here will take good care of it.
Therefore, the King orders us to build a warehouse and pass the message on to the people. In this sense, we can help friends in need when our stocks are full and theirs are not.
Another letter has just arrived. In it, the King talks about the famine that occurred when he was barely ten years old. The whole kingdom was affected.
The royal family decided to take matters into their own hands and sent diplomats to all neighboring countries to get help.

No one wanted to help the King. Most other countries were only concerned with their own survival. But the King did not despair. In the end he found a kingdom that would help. In fact, they had vast food resources, and generously shared with the other realms.

The moral of the story is that you always need someone smaller than you to help. It is important to the King that the population is willing to help others in need. So, it is inevitable to stockpile goods in times of prosperity in order to be able to share them in times of need.
This new warehouse is perfect! Now we are able to store large stocks of all necessary goods in case of unexpected circumstances.
Our mission is to raise a statue of the King in our city, so that his wish will be granted.
Sire, we have received a letter. It comes from the King. At his crowning ceremony, a great celebration took place. All the governors of the cities of his kingdom had gathered at the palace.

But his dream was to be present in all the cities and villages at the same time, in order to treat everyone equally. Of course this is physically impossible. But, if a statue were placed in each city, then it could grant his wish.
How wonderful! The King will be thrilled. A truly magnificent monument in his honor!
Build a statue of the King.
My Lord, the book has been completed. Our beloved King will be thrilled.
To do this, we need to collect enough skins so that our monks can write. Let's get started right away!
The last letter has just arrived, Sir. The King writes about the greatest personalities of this world and how they shared their memories in books, which were then spread all over the world.
The King wishes his memoirs to be captured in a book. It is very difficult to produce a book, but I think it would make His Majesty very happy.
The writing of the book can begin! Our monks will make sure that the book is ready for the King's arrival. It's so exciting! We're probably going to get famous around the whole world for this book!
Make a book that contains the King's memoirs.
Sir! The King is coming! I hope we haven't done anything wrong and that he will appreciate our efforts.
Governor, my regards. I see that your city has grown well during my absence. Oh! That's a beautiful statue you have there! And these vines! They look like my grandmother's!
All my letters have been taken into account, especially the book I so much wanted. It's perfect! Now I can finally enjoy my retirement with the certainty that my knowledge will not be lost.
I count on you to make my legacy memorable; to make every memory a lesson in wisdom for those who want to follow me.
Thank you, Governor, for this incredible work, you have been very thorough and all my requests have been taken into account. I am proud of you. The whole Kingdom is deeply in your debt.
Help the King in his quest.
My Lord, we will soon run out of raw materials, because we are using a large portion of them for the construction of new buildings. Should we perhaps build a mine?
Congratulations, Lord Governor. Now we have a suitable supply of raw materials to calmly tackle the other construction projects in the village.

Good afternoon, Sir. I am a messenger of the King and I was ordered to make sure that everything in the village is prepared for his arrival.\n\nWhat is THIS? Your village is far too unsecured! Build a fire tower immediately! Imagine what could happen if a fire were breaking out?!
That's a lot better! You never know what might happen. You did the right thing listening to me.
Next scenario

Farmers can't work until crops are regrown. If you build several smaller fields, farmers can rotate fields and avoid downtime.
Make sure to assign enough townies to warehouses as carriers to avoid transportation delays.
The tavern is more effective when supplied with grape juice from a juice manufacture or brew from the monastery.
A public building, like a church, can only serve a limited number of Townies.
Some decorations are more effective at increasing happiness than others. Larger populations need more decorations to maintain the same level of happiness.
Keep an eye on your Townies' happiness. Use the statistics menu to stay current on your Townies' needs and desires.
The better you are at fulfilling your Townies' needs and desires, the higher they can be taxed before they go on strike.
When the merchant comes to town you can buy urgently needed resources or sell surplus goods for money.
A farm can produce either wheat, wool or herbs. For wheat, you need a wheat field. For sheep, you need a pasture and for herbs a herb garden. Place them in close vicinity to the farm.
Quickly build townhouses early on so that you have plenty of Townies to work in your production buildings.
A small village can be easily supplied by fishermen or hunters but a bakery or butcher's workshop is better suited for large villages.
Always keep an eye on wood production. Many buildings need wood as a resource for production.
Some buildings can produce more than one resource, for example the mine and the farm.
Try to get a feel for the input-output ratio of your production building chains. That way you can make sure that they operate at full capacity.
You can earn Prestige in sandbox games by completing optional tribute quests.
Scenarios consist of a number of tasks that have to be fulfilled in order to complete the scenario.
After having completed a scenario you are given the option to continue playing.
Build a treasury! The tax collector goes around town and increases the tax revenue from every house he visits.
The carpenter's shop is extremely useful. The carpenter goes around town and repairs decayed buildings by spending resources and coins.

Building condition is extremely important. Run-down townhouses make your Townies unhappy and production buildings that are in bad condition are less productive. Buildings in bad repair also have an increased risk of a fire breaking out.
Townies have their own daily routine. When they are taking a break from work, they use their free time to go home to eat or to satisfy their desires.

When demolishing a building, half of its construction costs can be salvaged. The resources have to be hauled from the ruins by Townies, though. If you build another building in the same spot before that happens, you will lose the resources.
Mines can only be constructed at rocky mountainsides. Mines placed on ore deposits can mine iron ore or gold ore in addition to quarrying stone.
Roads speed up the transport of goods and resources. Your townies usually prefer to use roads. Transportation on cobblestone roads is faster than on dirt roads.
If your tax rate is too high, your townies will be unhappy and might even go on strike. If you fulfill some of their desires, though, they might be willing to pay higher taxes.

Townettes supply townhouses with food and water. They also visit the marketplace to buy jewelry and clothes, once these goods are available. Male townies, on the other hand, work in production buildings.
If your building stores are frequently full you need to build more warehouses and assign additional carriers.
Hard working Townies will grow tired eventually and take a break. They will resume work once rested.
A whole annual cycle takes 60 minutes. Not all maps have changing seasons and some have much longer seasons.
Fields lie idle in winter! You should prepare for the cold season by stocking plenty of wheat, herbs, hops and grape juice.
Hunting is an excellent source of food in winter. The hunter will provide the town with meat and skins, as long as there are enough deer or rabbits in his vicinity.
Some tasks can fail if you don't complete them within a given time.\nFailing a task mostly means that you will not get the reward for the task, but some can fail a scenario.
After completing a scenario you are given the option to continue playing. The game then switches to sandbox mode.
Having too many hunters may decimate the prey population.\nHow quickly new deer or rabbits appear depends on the size of the forest area on the map.
Some tasks have a time limit. The time remaining for the completion of the task is displayed as a warning message in the upper left of the screen.
Disable overproducing buildings to prevent overloaded warehouses or destroy resources in the warehouse menu.
You can increase your level by completing tasks and improving your town. The higher your level, the better the unlocked rewards!
The doctor can cure sick Townies with herbs from a herb garden.
XP can be earned by constructing buildings, trading at the market, achieving high happiness in town, completing tasks or reaching a large population.
Building upgrades are very powerful. For example, they enable you to assign more workers to a building or increase a building's storage space!
You have several options, when a mine's resource deposit is depleted. Look for another deposit and build a new mine there or assign a geologist to a depleted mine to make more deposit accessible.
By increasing your town's level, you unlock powerful research. For example building upgrades, increased tax income or better quest rewards!
Upgraded buildings also have disadvantages:\nAdditional workers increase resource consumption and the building's repair costs increases with each upgrade!
When you reach certain town levels, building upgrades will be unlocked. You can upgrade buildings from their building menu by spending Prestige.
Researching the geologist is very useful! When you assign the geologist to a mine, he gradually replenishes the ore deposit.
When a new town level is reached, additional research options will be unlocked. When a research is completed, the bonuses are permanently available for all your towns!
Once your town reaches a certain size, there is a risk of a plague outbreak! You will need an infirmary and a herb garden to cure your Townies.
When plague strikes or a fire breaks out in your town, you should immediately build an infirmary or a fire tower. The doctor cures sick Townies and the fireman extinguishes burning buildings.
Upgrade a building to improve its performance. You can find the upgrade tab in the context menu of the building.
Take care of your buildings! If you don't repair them regularly, they could start to smolder and might even burn down.
When your town is ravaged by plague or fire, your Townies might leave town. They will come back eventually, once the danger is over and if there are sufficient empty townhouses available.
A barracks can only supply guard towers in its area of influence.
When your soldiers lose a fight, they will head back and recover from their injuries.
The context menu of a building is full of useful information. Just select a building on the map.
When bandits attack a building, they can steal resources, lay fire to or demolish the building.
A bandit raid on a building can be interrupted by your soldiers, but the time to do so is limited.
Animal skins for the tannery are produced by the hunter's cabin or the butcher's workshop.
Military research can give you great benefits in combat and protection of your village.
Try to cover as much as possible of your village with guard and fire towers.
The carriers working at the barracks will get the soldier's supplies from the warehouse and deliver them to the guard towers in range.
Check out the menu to see the current influences on your town. They can be temporary or permanently active on a map. Examples are: Active bandits, a long winter or reduced tax income.
When supplying the soldiers with equipment and food, their offensive and defensive stats are directly affected by it. Soldiers supplied with swords will have a greater offense value.
Try to supply your soldiers with food and drink to raise both offense and defense stats.\nWell supplied soldiers are well fighting soldiers!
A battle consists of several phases: Both sides have to roll who begins in the initiative phase. After that the two sides strike and defend rotationally.
Use the ‘Follow Townie’ mode in the context menu of a building to see what the inhabitants or workers are doing at the moment.
Bandit attacks can come from the map border or a bandit camp situated on the map. A bandit camp can be upgraded, which means the camp is better defended.
Barracks, Guard towers and fire towers have a sphere of influence in which they work. Outside the sphere, the fireman, for example, will not interact with burning buildings.

You can see the sphere of influence of a building while placing it, in the coverage mode or in the context menu of the building. This view mode is available for barracks, guard towers and fire towers.
If you want to know more about a building and its production, visit the context menu of the building and go to "building info".
Many production chains and your economy are dependent on wheat. You should have a lot of wheat in stock before the winter starts.
The more flames are blazing on a building the more the fire has progressed. The building may collapse!
The wish for entertainment in your town can be satisfied by several entertainment buildings. Each of the buildings can only satisfy a certain amount of Townies.
Each season has its own influences on your town. The winter for example increases the need for clothing.
In winter, your village can be endangered by snowstorms and avalanches.
In summer, your town can be drought-stricken. Your fields will start to wither until the effect is over.
The monastery needs an oast house so it can be supplied with hops.
The juice manufacture needs a vineyard that supplies it with grapes.
The infirmary’s doctor does not harvest herbs. A farm is responsible for harvesting herbs. The doctor will get his herbs from the warehouse.
Weather conditions have special influences on your town. After some rain, your farms are temporarily more effective.
While a thunderstorm is moving over your town, lightning can hit your buildings and may set them afire.
Each season, there will be festivals on the fairground. Any time there is an ongoing festival, the general happiness will rise temporarily.
Take a look at the influence screen in the menu. There you can see which influences are at work in your town.
When one of your buildings got destroyed, you can select the signpost in the rubble to rebuild it.
While a blizzard is affecting the town, your townies walk slower and buildings decay faster.
When one of your buildings appears to be locked or unavailable, it maybe lacks a special requirement.
While a thunderstorm is lasting, lightning can strike your buildings!
Your buildings decay faster during heavy snowfall!
The quick menu is a good way to repair buildings, assign/un-assign workers and follow villagers very quickly.
Under "buildings" in the tab for "statistics" you have an overview of all buildings. Selecting one allows you to switch through all buildings of that type.
In the coverage overview you can switch through the different types of overlays.
The event menu allows to directly jump to events like a completed quest or research.
In the "town info" category you can rename your town.
The current family count can be found under "town info".
In the event menu you can sort warnings by severity and even hide them on the screen.
The windmill needs to be supplied with wheat by several farms to operate efficiently.
Fires can be put out by rain.
Sick villagers have a small chance to heal by themselves.
The Townie language is a mix of Dutch, Finnish and Volapük.
All currently active effects of a building can be seen in the context menu of a building.
The trade guild can automate trade. Buy or sell orders will be commenced each time a trader is in town.
Taxes are collected automatically in regular intervals. You can adjust taxes in the menu for ‘happiness’ under the category ‘taxes’.
The population in Townsmen consists of families from Townie and Townette. Capacities of buildings always refer to families.
Avalanches can only occur in winter and on some mountain slopes. If an avalanche is triggered, buildings in the area of impact are damaged or even destroyed, depending on their condition.
Sometimes bandits attack the city in several big waves. The city guard should be large enough so that the city does not suffer too much from the attacks.
Repairing buildings costs resources. The more advanced a building the higher the costs.
To access all actions available for a building via the context menu, use the actions button there.
Fishermen's and hunting cabins are the only reliable suppliers of food in winter.
Some content, such as the harbor, are only available in „The Seaside Empire“ .
Short stories in an endless game are small events with decision-making possibilities in dialogues. Some decisions have permanent consequences!
Sometimes, options in short stories and events are not selectable or even hidden if a certain condition is not fulfilled.
Many events can only trigger once per city. Most short stories are unique.
Short stories and events can be aborted in most cases. Once they have been started, however, they can only be ended by a decision.
Short stories and events, as well as the military castle are only available when you start a new endless game. Here you will also find several options to personalize the endless game.
Bandits, catastrophes, random tasks or short stories can be switched on and off in endless mode. These settings can only be changed when starting an endless map.
Short stories can be triggered when certain conditions are met. For example, if a certain building has been erected or the number of inhabitants has reached a certain size.
Sometimes one or more choices within a decision situation of a short story are not available. This results from the fact that a prerequisite is not fulfilled.
The military castle just has a small storage capacity, but it can supply defense buildings with provisions. Allows assignment of carriers, soldiers and quartermasters.

The Seaside Empire. Experience countless hours of content, new buildings, decorations, maps, scenarios and great events, that offer choice and consequence in a completely new setting with beautiful beaches!
The medium townhouse and the city house offer living space for 4, respectively 3 families by default.
Almost all buildings in „The Seaside Empire“ have received a new look.

From now on it is possible to choose the type of castle in endless mode. The normal castle has an overhauled look for „The Seaside Empire“. Additionally there is now a military castle, which offers decisive advantages against bandit attacks.
If you want to find out more about "The Seaside Empire", you can find detailed information on the help page. There is an extra entry describing the DLC.

Sometimes there are events that change the productivity of buildings. This could be increased productivity of farms after rain, but also decision specific, e. g. reduced productivity after an unsolved task.
Upload your savegames into the cloud regularly, to avoid data loss!
Your savegames will not be synchronized automatically with the cloud! To save your game into the cloud, use the cloud button in the game menu or the Google Game Services.
Your savegames will not be synchronized automatically with the cloud!
Townsmen will remind you about saving your game into the cloud. You can enable or disable cloud save reminders in the options menu.
To save your game into the cloud, use the cloud button in the game menu or the Google Game Services.

The treasury building allows you to collect all due taxes with one click.\n\nThis comes in particularly handy in big towns. It costs a few Prestige points to do this, though. You can find this feature in the context menu of the treasury.
Come back and visit your Townies frequently! Returning to the game earns you a Prestige point reward.
Special buildings, like the infirmary or the fire tower, unlock the „Extinguish all!“ and „Cure all!” functions in the building's menu.
You can move the camera with the keys {KEY_BINDING_CAMERA_UP}, {KEY_BINDING_CAMERA_DOWN}, {KEY_BINDING_CAMERA_LEFT} and {KEY_BINDING_CAMERA_RIGHT}.
When an incident has occurred in your town, you can jump directly to the warnings by pressing {KEY_BINDING_ALERTS}.
You can save your game anytime in the menu or with the shortcut {KEY_BINDING_QUICKSAVE}.
There are many keybindings in the game. You can find a list of keybindings in the menu.
Prestige has multiple uses. It can be spent to upgrade buildings, construct decorations or complete building constructions instantly.
Some buildings have powerful features in their contextual menu.\n\nThese buildings are: carpenters' shop, treasury, infirmary, fire tower and the mine.

How about earning Double XP permanently?

Reach new town levels much faster and unlock new and powerful research options!

What are you waiting for? Visit the Townshop!
Use “double XP” to earn twice as much XP while playing the game!\nThis will help you to reach the next town level faster and unlock new powerful research options!

Your mobile device will notify you when your townies are missing you and if there is a prestige reward to collect.\nYou can disable the notifications in the Townsmen application options.

You have several options, when a mine's resource deposit is depleted:
- Replenish the mine with Prestige
- Look for another deposit and build a new mine there
- Assign the Geologist (can be unlocked via research)
The carpenter's workshop allows you to repair all buildings in town with one click. The cost in Prestige points depends on how much total building damage needs to be repaired.
You can watch tutorial and gameplay videos on our Townsmen YouTube channel, just select the YouTube button in the main menu.
From the main menu you can watch tutorial and gameplay videos from our Townsmen YouTube channel. Just click on the YouTube button.
From the main menu you can watch tutorial and gameplay videos from our Townsmen YouTube channel. Just tap the YouTube button.
