A lagoon with a lot of small islands is the perfect place to build a town that is connected by bridges and traversed by canals.
In this bay lies an idyllic island. Can you establish a town of real importance in this remote location?
The castle overlooks the ocean from a high cliff. On the surrounding plateaus, you can build a nice coastal town.
Cliffs and Coasts
This lush valley is perfectly suited for building a flourishing town.
This map was created to test the performance on all devices. A really large town is sprawling all over the map.
The rippling waters of the rivers in this region invite Townies to go fishing or have a swim in the crystal clear water.
Beneath the shady plateau a small village may grow into a huge town.
The kingdom is suffering from a drought. The river has dried up. This makes cultivating the land an feeding your Townies a challenging task.
Establish a flourishing trading post on the plateau. Lucrative deals with merchants and knights await you.
Establish a mining colony and provide resources for the construction of a monumental cathedral.
Make preparations for a grand royal wedding.
Build a large town near this dried-up riverbed, but remember that water is a scarce commodity in this area.
There is a small plateau near the edge of the swamplands. An ideal place for a town.
This quiet place at the coast is the ideal location to found your village.
An isolated mountain region in the middle of nowhere. No water, but countless ore veins. The perfect place to strike it rich!
The King needs a lot of planks to build a big fleet. Find out why the delivery of planks stopped and set up a Trade Guild.
This beautiful region is a perfect place to build a big city. The vast hills provide ample room for countless buildings.
A small town has become a big metropolis. Fulfill the desires and needs of the Townies in the given time.
Change the jobs of the given Townies wisely to build a marketplace and a tavern.
Plan your town well, space for buildings is sparse between the falls and the terrain can be difficult to traverse.
There are heavy avalanches in this region. Besides that, you should establish a little town and use the rich ore deposits.
Build your town in the canyon. You can find everything you need, but some areas are difficult to reach.
Cross the river to reach the needed resources for your city.
Save up a bunch of coins. But be careful, bandits have made a lair in the area. Additionally to the bandit threat, unhappy townies will not pay their taxes.
Establish a village on a wonderful, hidden island. Enjoy the fresh sea air!
Establish a village on a wonderful, hidden island. Enjoy the fresh sea air!
Bring your town through the unforgiving winter.
On this frozen plain, you have to build a functioning town very fast or starve during the winter.
Support the King in his undertaking to build a great fleet of ships, while keeping the growing unrest in your town under control.
Use the surrounding woods in this region to your advantage when trying to establish your town. Water is scarce here, so fishing can't be relied on.
The King has entered a wager and it is your task to build a big city before the archduke does. You don't have much time to complete all tasks. Do not disappoint him!
Swamp areas make finding suitable building ground difficult. Make sure to make efficient use of the available building ground!
A rocky valley containing a lot of resources, but room for buildings is scarce.
A small group of islands. Colonizing them will be a challenge.
A small group of islands. Colonizing them will be a challenge.
This is the tutorial map. Here you will be introduced to the world of Townsmen.
Build up a town surrounding your mountain fastness. But be carefull, a long winter is coming.
The King is going to visit his estates. Get prepared for his arrival.
The King's birthday is coming up. Now you search for the perfect brew as a gift. Maybe the monks at the monastery know more...
The king suffers from a mysterious disease. It is up to you to cure him and find out where the illness came from.
War has a good grip on the land. Far away from the front, you have to establish a thriving town and support the King's army.
The King wants to be prepared for bad times and your town was chosen to deliver the required goods.
Learn the details of warfare from a veteran.
Fulfill the wishes of your wife while dealing with an extortive bandit.
Your castle is located on a small river island. Use the surrounding riverbanks wisely and build a thriving economy.
Build a small village at the banks of a beautiful lake.
Your town has been chosen by the King to host the region's greatest joust!
Winter is coming! Help your Townies to prepare for the frosty season!
Support your wife and make the economy of a rundown village thrive again!
The town is suffering from a curse. Strange diseases and disasters burden the population. It is up to you to find a way to solve the curse as soon as possible. No matter what it takes…

The King has married again. To honor his new wife, you are ordered to host several seasonal festivals. The planning and execution however, might prove to be difficult. It will be a race against the clock…
High up on a cliff stands the icy hold. Difficult to reach but once scaled, one can see far into the surrounding area of the cold tundra. The winter is very long in this area!
The Queen of a friendly country comes to visit the city. Lucrative trade agreements are to be sealed, but there is a language barrier that needs to be overcome first.
Diplomatic visit
A majestic mountain is dividing this your lands. Furthermore, you can conquer an island not far from your castle.
Divided shoreline
The Queen Frigyth needs a new governor to manage this part of her Kingdom. Build a magnificent town in this new land.
Kingdom of Frigyth

The last war has left most of the town in ruins. Snow covered remains of the town now mark the place where the great battle of the armies occured. Now it is time to rebuild the town.\n\nThis is a winter only map!
This country is crossed by mountains and hills. The view is great when you reach the peaks.
Welcome to the highlands, governor. This region is full of mysteries. I am sure that, if you are attentive and caring to the inhabitants, the lands will soon reveal all their secrets to you.
Highlands
You are called to a village where the Duke seems to be insane. The Townies refuse to pay any taxes!\nEach choice you make will lead you to a different ending.
Insane Choices

The King has a new task for you. He is growing quite old and fears that he will leave this world without leaving a legacy. One that will pass on the lessons he has learned while being King to future generations.
The Legacy
Wide plains and a lot of building space extend to the horizon. Here it is possible to build a truly large city.
Lowlands
In this region many wet grasslands contribute to the biological diversity of the land.

Lord, look at this perfect balance between land and water. I am happy to welcome you to this quiet place.\n\nThese residents here will soon witness your efforts in helping this region to true greatness!

A long time ago in a kingdom far far away, a clash occurred between two groups of Townies.\n\nWill you be able to restore the peace and reunite the two families under their former name?
A Tale of two Clans
In Queen Frygith's lands, a small border town is torn apart by a conflict between two factions. Then a terrible beast starts to attack the Townies. \n\nYou are tasked with investigating this mystery.
The Beast
Far from the castle and the river, lies a sink, only called the pit by the locals. In the middle of it stands one single tree. Only the bravest of governors would dare to build a town near the pit.
The Pit
Two rivers meet in the lower part of the valley to form magnificent waterfalls along the mountains.

Governor, this is one of the most desirable places in my entire kingdom. May you govern these lands in my name. Take good care of them. I am sure that you will soon help this little village to true greatness.
The Waterfalls
Your popularity in the city has plummeted. The people despise you!\n\nMake sure the Townies love their ruler again! Complete the twelve legendary tasks without failing!
The Legendary Tasks

There's hardly anything growing in this wasteland. No existing river or lake makes urban development even more difficult. Can a successful city be built here at all? \nOn this map it is always autumn.\n
Wasteland

Produce wool.
Make a rope.
Thank you my Lord! Oh, it’s about the language Queen Frigyth speaks? It is true my father was from the same country, but I never learned the language, I am sorry.
You should ask the old lady on the other side of town. I heard she speaks many languages and generally knows a lot of stuff.
Thanks a lot for the help my Liege. Yes it’s true, we know this young maiden. We rescued her from drowning.
Now she lives near the monastery and helps with the harvest. I taught her our language but her mother's tongue is a northern dialect.
Thanks my Lord, you are too kind. Sit down, I will tell you what I know.
I am sorry, but I don’t speak the ancient tongue. But I know a girl who lives near the river, right next to the monastery.
She was rescued from the river a few months ago by the monks. Maybe she can help you.
I have asked around town to find a capable person to help us.
The butcher’s father comes from the same country as Queen Frigyth, I have heard. Maybe he can help us.
Oh! Nice to see you there, my Lord. Are you here because of my inquiry?
Those confounded bandits! They came at night, stole all my pigs and burned down the pig farm. I lost everything, my Liege.
I will gladly look into that translation business of yours, if you help me rebuild my pig farm, alright?
Oh, good that I meet you, Governor. Weeks ago I made a request that the monastery roof is in urgent need of repairs. Would you help us?
Repair the building.
Come closer, my Liege. My eyesight isn’t the best anymore. Would you kindly help me harvest these herbs? I need them to craft the medicine for my back pain.
Congratulations, my Lord! We have found some coins and weapons.
If the bandits manage to successfully raid the town too often, the trade negotiations might fail.
Don’t let too many bandit attacks succeed.
You may have destroyed our camp. But we are still here. Surrounding you! We will never stop! You better be prepared…
My Lord, you have to make a choice.
Let’s buy bread at the market, so we can give it to the queen immediately.
Deliver some bread

I disagree with this young girl. The Queen looks impatient. I think we should give her something to eat immediately and not wait until our local baker has made the bread. We can buy some at the market and give it to her.
A nice bread for you, hope you will enjoy it. We made it as fast as we could.
Trust the adviser
Sire, at least we can learn about some habits and customs from our new friends. In order to be well prepared for the festivals, we should add some decorations in the town.\n
Decorate the town
I am really disappointed in you, Governor!\n\nManaging a couple of demands was such a simple task, yet you still failed to do it! Was it too much to ask? Now get out of my sight!
My Lord, you didn’t stop the bandit attacks. The Queen looks very displeased. I hope we do not fail her again.
Find a translator.
I am sorry, my King, her dialect is not the same as mine, but I will try harder…
I might have confused banners and benches. She just wanted to sit after her long trip.
Excuse me, my Liege, if I messed up earlier but I’m pretty sure that she wants something like a tavern.
It would be a shame if we are making her angry again by not providing what she wants. Imagine the consequences for the negotiations.

After her long and exhausting trip, she thought that she would have been welcomed by…ehhm, let my think... her banners. But she can't see any. I think she wants to see her banners flying in this town.
I will do my best to translate the Queen's wishes for you, your Grace.
Hoist the colors
My Lord, I do not think our translator is qualified enough to represent us in trade talks. If we make another mistake, the Queen could be very angry.\n
Congratulations, Governor. We made it. From now on, every four years festivals are held in this village to celebrate the alliance of our kingdoms.\n

Thank you, Governor. The Queen is enthusiastic about your drive for action. We will now move to the trade guild for the negotiations. Nothing stands in the way of a successful trade agreement anymore.
Well done my Liege, we have a really nice city now, I can’t wait to share our habits and customs with our neighbors.
And you should also know that in the kingdom of Queen Frigyth, when you trust someone, you give him herbs. It’s a well known symbol of loyalty and friendship.
Oh no. The Queen has reached the village! I am afraid it is too late now. He won’t be happy at all…
Just in time
Complete the quest “Just in time“.
We have a limited amount of time. We should find this translator and a place for the meeting to be held. We better do it before they reach the village or the trade negotiations will fail.
Prepare the visit
Queen Frigyth does not speak our language, my Liege. You should focus your efforts on finding a capable translator who speaks her language.
Be our guest
Governor, these bandits attacks are getting too dangerous. It is not safe in your town anymore. The trade talks have been aborted. The Queen has left already.
Good afternoon, sir. The villagers complain about high activity of bandits nearby. You should consider setting up a city guard. We need barracks and watchtowers.
Good morning, Sire. Several bandit attacks have been reported by the villagers. I suggest we build some defense buildings.
Well done, my Liege. Now we can at least fight back when the bandits attack the village.
My Lord, we have to make sure that the bandit attacks do not disrupt the Queens visit. This could prove to be a disaster.
In order to house the delegations of the other nations, we need to provide more housing opportunities for them.
Great my Lord, we now have a decent number houses for the guests. The preparations for the trade talks are complete.
Welcome to our lovely town, Queen Frigyth. I hope you had a nice trip. As you can see we have found a translator. Is there anything we do for you?
Nilik het elk jos paitse, mielellaan?
Complete all tasks.
Enough is enough. Governor, you should have trusted the translator. We have failed! Queen Frigyth is leaving and the trade talks are over before they even started…
Miliki het elk ustabili freto, mielellaan?
She doesn’t look very happy. Are you sure that you are translating right?!
My Liege, thank you for trusting me. We still need a church in this village. For a long time the inhabitants have been asking for a place where they can gather and practice their faith.
Especially in times like these, when bandits haunt the surrounding forests and you can't feel safe anywhere, the inhabitants need a safe haven.
A tavern? Having a church seems more important to have in our town, now especially with the recent bandits attacks, people need a place to feel safe.

A jousting ground... are you sure? I think she means a fairground. This would be definitely a better option for our village. It will allow us to get to know the different peaceful festivities of both Kingdoms.
The Queen will teach us the traditions of her Kingdom, and we conduct many festivals where we can dance and sing. Should we initiate the construction of the fairground, my Lord?
If I understood her correctly, the Queen would like to see a place, where different nations gather and compete in different challenges. I think she means a jousting ground.
And I am wrong again, my Liege. I am so sorry. I believe I misunderstood Queen Frigyth. She actually wanted a place more peaceful...like a church.
You have chosen wisely my Liege. She will be pleased to see that in addition to a nice tavern, we have also delicious beverages for her.
My Lord, she said that it would be nice to have something to eat after this long trip. \nWe should offer her some bread produced in our own town.
Jüo mudi stul kas tyrskahti aitinsa?
Trust the maiden
Queen Frigyth said she would have expected for there to be a place to get together. I think she is talking about a tavern, it would be the perfect place for that.\n
The Queen will be so thrilled, a place where all the nationalities can prove their skills. My Liege, should we start the construction of the jousting ground?
I’m sure that Queen Frigyth will appreciate to discover the bread from our lands.
Here is the bread for Queen Frigyth, my Lord. Probably the best bread we have ever baked in town.
Let’s continue the tour, Queen Frigyth. Do you have another wish?

Congratulations, my Lord. The Queen seems to be pleased with the bread. She said that this bread will sell at a good price on the market because she is planning a trade route to us. Our bread will then be known in both kingdoms.\n
Oh. She seems disappointed and happy at the same time. What does this mean?
The Queen said she will increase the prices for bread on the trade routes, since we seem have no problem to buy bread instead of making our own.
She is very glad to see that our people now got a place in town where they can gather.
Seems like we got it all wrong. The Queen is upset. Why did you listen to your adviser? He doesn’t even speak the Queen‘s language!
The Queen has already send letters to the neighboring countries and invited them to a grant tournament here. Many thanks, Governor.
Governor, it seems like you have trusted the wrong person! Queen Frigyth wanted a church to be built and not a tavern.
Good morning, my Liege. The King’s entourage will arrive with Queen Frigyth soon. This meeting is of utmost importance for the diplomatic relations between the two Kingdoms.
The trade guild has been destroyed! This is an utter disaster, my Lord! The negotiations cannot be held in our town! The King will be very angry!

My Lord. For the trade negotiations, we need the right place for it to be held. The merchants have proposed that we should construct a trade guild building in our town. This would be the perfect place to hold the negotiations.
Well done, my Liege, the trade guild building has been completed. Soon the trade talks can take place there.
Sir, we must ensure that the trade guild is secure. The bandits must be prevented at all costs from disrupting the trade talks. Otherwise, we must cancel the negotiations.
Protect the trade guild
Well, Queen Frigyth has spoken! I didn’t understand a word of it, but the young maiden here will surely tell us.
You better try harder. After all, this is about trade routes and orders with Queen Frigyth. We cannot tolerate any mistakes! There is a lot of money involved!
Nice to finally meet you, my Liege. My pronunciation is not quite perfect but I’m glad if I can help you with translations in the negotiations.
You have failed in your investigation, Sire. The case has not been solved. If I were you, I'd leave before the Queen hears about this.
Resolve the factions' conflicts.
Sire! I take my hat off to you! Despite the various obstacles you faced, you succeeded in your investigation. The conflict in town has been resolved.
Investigate the problems in town.
Good morning, my Lord! It's about time you got here. There is a serious conflict in this town.
Since the Queen opened the borders to her kingdom, a lot of newcomers arrived here to try their luck on this side of the border.
But, you see, it has not been easy here in town lately, my Liege.
The problem is that there are conflicts between the locals and the newcomers in town all the time. They argue about absolutely anything and everything!
I don’t think that the money we have will be enough to complete all the tasks. You’ll have to decide what to spend the coins on.
Besides, a lot of Townies are unhappy and very poor here and I fear we are on a brink of a revolt against our Duke.\n\nThey won’t be paying any taxes, until the situation improves!
You see my Lord, whatever a man sows, he reaps.

My Lord, welcome to our town. We are really glad that you have accepted our invitation. Your reputation of solving issues is well known in the whole kingdom.\n\nI hope with your help, this town will be able to maintain a certain balance between the factions.
Solve the problems in town.
Our guardsman have successfully raided the bandit camp. Our troops found a man being held hostage in their dungeon. He was exhausted and is sleeping now. We haven't been able to interrogate him yet.
So you chose the hard way. As you wish, we are coming for you!

My Lord, investing the money in the fishing trade instead of in the protection of the town might have offended the villagers.\n\nI have seen several of them walking the town with pitchforks and torches.
All right. What do we have here? Is it for us? A gift? How nice of you, Governor! But, next time put some sausages in too, okay?

My Lord, a Townie found a message hidden in a bottle while he was fishing. It mentioned a place where herbal medicine grows that is rumored to cure all illness. \nMaybe we can ask the doctor about it.

I'm telling you, a good bath can't hurt them. Of course it will take a few more days or even weeks for all the inhabitants to get used to this new routine but believe me, it is the best for all of us.
The strange smell is starting to fade! Well, at least I can breathe almost normally again. Thank you!
Build a bathhouse.
You've made a reasonable decision. I am delighted to see that you have chosen to build an inn on my land. The money will flow in heaps!

Sir, that smell is horrible... The people of the village have stopped washing themselves. Perhaps bathhouses would improve their daily lives, as well as ours. But on the other hand... the Duke would rather have an inn built to increase the income of his estate. \n\nIt is up to you to make this difficult choice. What will it be: The inn or the bathhouse?
Wealth is coming our way! What a splendid idea this inn was. It is a beauty.
Build an inn.
You are building glorious buildings here and there, but it may be time to start erect additional guard towers. Our defenses were too weak last time, it's time to counteract.
SPLENDID! All they have to do is behave themselves, these cheap bandits.

You have been a true friend to me, Lord. I am truly thankful to you for your support in the affairs of the town.

Unfortunately, the population thinks differently. The ungrateful rabble is standing in the castle courtyard with torches and pitchforks. I suggest you take the secret passage and escape the town as fast as you can.

I will stay here and talk to them. I think the true culprit of this mess should face the consequences of his actions and clear his conscience.

You have always stood in my way, Lord. From the beginning on you decided against my wishes. The town was more important to you than the Duke.

Unfortunately, the population does not see it like me. The ungrateful rabble is standing in the castle courtyard. Why don't you join them?

My brother has been freed by your men and from now on he will reign the place. He has always been the true ruler here.
I will now go outside because the true culprit of this mess should face the angry Townies and come clean with his conscience.

My Lord, you have truly proved that through all these difficult decisions, you have represented both the welfare of the Townies and the desires of the Duke with the best of your knowledge and conscience.

In spite of the fundamentally equal treatment of both parties, you have attended to the Duke's needs more and given priority to his demands.

You really deserve the reputation of being a problem solver.

My Lord, you have truly proved that through all these difficult decisions, you have represented both the welfare of the Townies and the desires of the Duke with the best of your knowledge and conscience.

In spite of the fundamentally equal treatment of both parties, you have taken more care of the population of the village and given priority to their demands.

You really deserve the reputation of being a problem solver.

You have been a true friend to me, Lord. I am really grateful for your help.

I always knew that I could count on you. You have proved that you have good leadership skills right there.

But from now on, I will run this town again. The bandit problem will soon be solved. I promise you it will be taken care of with diligence.
Here is a small gift for you. Please take this chest of gold and have my thanks.

My Lord, you have truly proved that through all these difficult decisions, you have represented both the welfare of the Townies and the desires of the Duke with the best of your knowledge and conscience.

You succeeded in finding the perfect balance between the two parties. You really live up to your reputation as problem solver.
No, we should wait until our army is strong enough.
Let's strengthen the army.
My Lord, you are probably right. It is wise to wait a little bit longer until we get stronger.
Let’s raid this bandit camp by sending the town guard.
Send the guard!
The bandits are a threat to the town, my Lord. \n\nShould we send the army to raid their camp ?
I guess you won’t be using that fishing lodge anymore?
My Lord, your choice to spend the money on making the town safer might have offended the Duke.
He regards it as an insult that the financial backbone of the village, fishing, was not close to your heart and that you preferred to help the anxious Townies.\n
I’m glad that you have chosen to invest in our fishing trade. I see, that I can count on you doing the right thing.\n\nWe need to produce a certain amount of fish in order to be profitable.
Selling these culinary delicacies provides us with some good turnover to keep the town running.\nThe prices for fish are really favorable at the moment.
Finance better fishing equipment.
My Lord, as you learned before, our Duke had a twin brother.
They were physically identical. But deep inside one of them, a madness was growing, slowly turning him into a bad person.
One day, the twins found out that only one of them could rule the town. The good twin was ready to leave the place to his brother but, for the other one, it was not enough.
The evil twin forced his brother to fight in a duel. But his twin was too strong and he lost the fight.
The evil twin couldn’t live with this defeat. He faked his own death by jumping into the river. Even his brother thought he was dead.
After that, the good twin ruled the town. That time was prosperous and full of joy. But in the forest, helped by the bandits, the evil twin was preparing his revenge.

A few weeks ago, he started his plan of revenge. Nobody noticed it, but the evil twin took the place of his brother. Reversing all the good work our Duke has done and burning down the town little by little.\nUntil you, my Lord, answered my call for help.
Sir, I don't want to rush you, but you're going to have to make a decision sooner or later. Should we build watchtowers or attack these naughty bandits now?
My Lord, the roads are in a very poor condition. Would you be so kind as to order the construction of new ones? I almost broke my ankle yesterday.
On the other hand, the town would really need a new bakery too. It’s your choice my Lord.
Choose an approach.
I hope this was a wise choice…
My Lord, thank you for choosing to build a bakery in town. I hope the Duke won’t be destroying it like the last one.
That bakery will make a difference, my Lord. All the Townies have gathered here to thank you in person. Some villagers have even left some goods for you.
Choose to invest money in a new bakery.
Of course, I can help you, my Lord. But I have one request first. Would you bring me some meat? I would be really thankful and haven’t eaten meat in a long time.
Oh I see that you have the goods. Give it to me and I will tell you where I got my herbal medicine from.
It’s down by the river. But I don’t get there anymore, some nasty bandits have set up their camp right next to the herbs.
Now, I will tell you where I got my herbal medicine from. It’s down by the river. But I don’t go there anymore, some nasty bandits have set up their camp right next to the herbs.

My Lord, I must confess. I miss the old times when the Duke and his twin played in these streets. The town was bright and full of joy. I remember when they were talking about how they would rule the town together. But...things went differently.\n\nAaahhh...I should not talk about that, what's past is past, right?

My Lord, I would like to thank you for fixing the roads. \n\nI also have a message for you. A few days ago, I found a note near the river. It was a call for help. It seems like a person is being held hostage by the bandits. Maybe you can do something.
Complete the quest  "the price of fame" in time.
Raid the bandit camp.
This money will be used for fixing the roads in town. To further increase the transport of goods, we should build even more roads.
These roads truly benefit our town. I’m really proud of your work. You have my thanks!
Choose to invest money in new roads.

My Lord, one of our fisherman found a message in a bottle. Most of it is incomprehensible, but the rest of the message reads like this:\n\n“...it’s been a while... I don’t know how he made it... He is the evil one of us... thought he was dead… we were so wrong... Please... Help…”
While you were busy with the Duke’s demand, the Townies caught some kind of strange disease due to the lack of variety in their diet. I’ve heard that most of them are ready to leave town.
My Lord, it is advisable to cure the villagers before the sickness starts spreading in town.
Everyone is feeling better. But the Townies blame you for everything and they believe that you are just as much of a madman as the Duke.
You chose poorly by spending the money on the roads. They think that a bakery would have been more beneficial for the town. The Townies could really use some variety in their diet.
My Lord, you must know that from time to time, our Duke acts very strangely. He demands insane tasks of us. If they are not carried out to his satisfaction, he orders the destruction of buildings.
There is another problem, my Lord. The treasury is empty.
I’m glad that you have chosen to invest the money in the protection of the town. A couple of torches will dissuade the bandits to raid our town.
Now the streets are safer and well lit at night. Thank you my Lord.
Finance new torches for the town.
Oh my Lord, that’s terrible, the construction is taking too long. The Townies are thinking that it was on purpose. Some of them are calling for a revolt…

If things go on like this, my Lord, the village will soon be in trouble. In such times, one should be prepared for everything. I'm talking about things like fire...don't you think a fire tower would be a good investment?\nShould I commission the construction, sir?
That fire tower was completed just in time, my Lord. Townies are happy to see that we care about them.
The construction was completed in time, my Lord. The villagers are delighted with your concern for their well-being.
Oh my Lord, bandits have heard of our small guard force in town. They might come here sooner than expected.

My Lord, may I make a suggestion?

In order to prepare the population for the threat of bandit attacks, we should organize a competition. That way we could find out who is suitable to be a guardsman and who knows how to use the bow.

Should I have a contest site commissioned, sir?
This archery contest was a success! Some Townies are asking to be guardsmen that are patrolling our streets. Maybe we really do have a chance to fight off the bandits.
My Lord, last season the Duke destroyed the farms. The villagers are unable to provide for themselves and their dependents. \nIt would be advisable to construct a new farm to ease their problems.
Great news my Lord, the villagers are already talking of your kindness.

My Lord, why don’t we walk the streets so you can see for yourself what the situation is. It might have a positive influence on the villagers if they see that you are concerned about their well-being.
My Lord, the bandits in this area are getting stronger by the minute. We need to prepare, in case they are attacking our village.\n\nShould I order the construction of guard towers?
My Lord, the bandits in this area are getting stronger by the minute. We need to prepare, in case they will be attacking our village.\n\nShould I order the construction of defense buildings?
With these towers, we will be able to see the bandits a long time before they are in town.
I have an idea my Lord, please hear me out. Why don’t we just pay the bandits? Maybe they would leave us alone then. We could bribe them with some nice goods. And money, of course.
Oh, we got all the resources for the bribe, let’s give it to the bandits.
Pay the bribe.

My Lord, I just came from the Duke. He instructed me to have a tavern built.

But on the other hand, the Townies have been asking for a church for a long time now.

The choice is yours.
FIRE! FIRE! A fire has broken out in town, my Lord!
My Lord, did you hear the swearing outside?\nThe Duke just tripped on the roads and fell into the sewage next to the road. If I were you, I go on the run.
I thought you spent MY money on something useful, like the roads. Now they are still in an unusable state. I want you to do something NOW!
Oh no, my Lord, the people heard that you have chosen the Duke’s task over them. Out of anger, they have set a building on fire.
Oh my Lord, the Duke heard that you have chosen the Townies over his desires. He ordered the destruction of some buildings in town.
That new tavern will bring prosperity to our little town. Many travelers will stop by to take rest and have a drink. You have my thanks.
You did the right thing. Having a tavern is much better than having a church in town, don’t you think? Besides, it is already full of newcomers.
Choose to build a new tavern.
Thank you my Lord, finally we are going to have a new church in town.
That is wonderful! May you be blessed and, please, take this as a token of my gratitude.
Choose to build a new church.
My Lord, the prisoner we freed from the bandit camp is finally awake. You won’t believe his story.

Oh, I almost forgot! Hector came to me, asking for help with his new project which aims to bring all villagers back together.\n\nThe farm, which is run by the locals, could use a warehouse. Let's help him.
Very good, my Lord! This will enable us to build up large stocks! The locals seem to appreciate the gesture.

Let me introduce myself! I'm Hector, ready to serve you.\n\nI am part of the federation of artists. We arrived after the borders opened. I have to admit that we've got a mixed reception by the locals here in town upon our arrival.
We would like to ask for your help in order to enable us to do something for the locals - especially those who have trouble accepting us newcomers. Maybe some food will convince them of our goodwill.

...Yes, I think so. I was attacked by a demonic beast! It grabbed me by the arm and dragged me several meters to the forest's edge. I shouted for help as much and as loud as I could, before I fainted in pain.\n\nWhen I regained consciousness, my husband was by my side.

Did you hear that, my Lord? Maybe it was one of the locals who did it. But doing laundry on a Monday when it is customary for it to be done on a Saturday is also a strange idea. Anyway, the important thing is that she's safe and sound.
Are you alive? You're alive! Seriously hurt, but alive!\n\nAre you able to describe what happened?
One last question before we leave. Do you think anyone wants to hurt you in the village?

One thing is certain, the beast has hooves. But... why the baker? Unlike the young woman, he is one of the locals. Could it be revenge from the newcomers? We are still in desperate need of more clues!
My clothes? Yes, why not, I don't need them anymore. But before that, can you bring me some new ones?
Well done, my Lord! In your generosity, you have also provided clothes for the rest of the town! Everyone is feeling more united. Both the locals and the newcomers reduced  their differences.
Send clothes.
However, the analysis of the baker's clothing did not yield anything.

A beast from hell threw itself at me! Then it trampled me with its hooves and tore my robe! I have never seen such a beast before. These eyes.... they were the eyes of the devil! Excuse me now, I need to rest and tend to my wounds.
Thank you for your information! My Lord, do you think truffles are a way to control the beast? If so, then we would be dealing with one of the villagers! It's outrageous!

Well, let's see what we have here… These are animal tracks. Could be cloven hoofed... They're deep in the mud - the beast must weigh a lot! The young woman was evidently dragged for a good three meters. Fortunately, her husband arrived just in time!

Ah another clue here, my Lord. What is this... Looks like a mushroom...maybe a truffle. I don't know if this has anything to do with the beast, but in any case, I'm looking forward to asking the kitchens for the meal of the day.

Sire, we have only time to choose one of the paths, so you have to decide what to do. When you've made your choice, give me a herb. It's... a tradition in this kingdom, like a sign of trust used in sealing a contract.

My Lord, we could question the victim or search the area for clues. Since the victim is in shock it is recommended to question her now, before details get lost. \n\nIf we want to search the area for clues, we should do it now, because it is starting to rain and many folks wander through here. Clues can be destroyed easily, you know.
My Lord! You have to come with me! There has been an attack in town! We are not sure what exactly happened…but some townies are talking about a beast. You have to see for yourself.
The news about the attack have reached Queen Frigyth! She demands a clean and thorough investigation!
Queen Frigyth wants you to be the chief inspector in the case. She also mentioned that we have to make haste, before the news of a beast spread all over the Kingdom.
Choose how to proceed.
Hmm. We haven't learned a lot. A demonic beast? What the hell is that supposed to mean? Maybe a new attempt by the locals to drive out the newcomers?
Would you like to ask this young woman another question or should we interrogate her husband instead?
Question the victim's husband.
Ask the victim a new question.

Ah.... What I saw? Not much, actually. I heard a growl, a little like the sound of pigs, but more... wild. And of course my wife who was calling for help. I ran and found her unconscious. I didn't see anything else.
Sire, my wife has often been influenced by her father, the merchant. He used to have crazy ideas which got not only himself, but also his daughters in trouble...
Question the victim.
Investigate the crime scene.
Well... now that I think about it... Since my sister was banished for unproven accusations, the locals are looking at me strange. I wouldn't be surprised if some of them wished the plague upon me.
Oh no, my Lord! I have just learned that the beast struck again! Let's hurry to the scene! This time the victim is the baker! One of the locals!
Here... I wonder if the beast may have left any clues on the clothes of our good, old baker.
Examine the baker's clothes.
Should we ask him to hand over his clothes or should we focus on investigating the crime scene?
Are you all right? You look badly hurt. Your clothes are hanging down in shreds!\nThe beast has injured you badly. Are you able to describe what happened?

Well.... In contrast to the first crime scene, the fight here was a lot fiercer. Oh! A tuft of hair from the beast! This might help us to learn a little more. And look here, the same footprints and... these look like human tracks right by its side!
Investigate the crime scene.
It is true that I did not like them very much, but nevertheless... They brought good mood and new inns to this desolate village. I was just beginning to like them.
No offense, but I was attacked by the beast! I'm one of the victims, not a criminal!
Perhaps you have forgotten, my Lord, but I almost died from my wounds when the beast attacked me!
Either we follow these footprints and hope they lead us to the solution, or we gather all the Townies to question them…
My Lord, we must build a rope out of cloth so we don't get lost in the woods. I refuse to put small stones on the ground so let's hurry up and make this rope.
Can anyone testify that you were not present at the time of the attacks?

It's certainly the farmer who did it. He kept bothering us to leave this village. By attacking the baker, he ensured that the federation of the locals would be beyond suspicion. My daughter was wrongly accused.
She is an herbalist by profession and she saw that the vines were in a bad condition. Of course, suspicious as it may sound, she just didn't want to talk to people and ask for permission…

And the other villagers really believed that she was poisoning the fields while she was actually trying to save them. This farmer doesn't know his job! And then she was forced out of the country by the Queen's orders!
I'm afraid now they'll take it out on my other daughter. You met her a short time ago. She was the first victim of the beast. And that's no coincidence! They don't want us here!
MY LOOOOOOORD! A NEW ATTACK! This time we have a missing Townie! One of the farm workers is missing!
Look, my Lord, here are some footprints. I only see two ways to solve this investigation.
My Lord, the Queen demands answers. It is time for us to crack the case. Let us hope that the evidence we have will be sufficient to proceed with the charges.

My Lord, let us not forget that one of the villagers is still missing. This trail won't take us any further. Let's go back to the castle and solve this mystery with the clues we've managed to accumulate.
These footprints could lead us to the missing Townie and to the culprit!
Let's follow these footprints!
Why not gather all the Townies and confront them with each other? The culprit is among them, that's for sure.
Good morning, my Lord. You say these footprints led you here? Well, I don’t know anything about it. It's probably just another joke of the locals.
Gather the Townies.
Everyone, gather at the town square! We have to ask you some questions.
A bakery to make good bread would be an excellent start. As my mother always said, a full stomach is the cure to all worries!\n\nDo you think you can help us?
Thank you, my Lord! I think we are on the right track! We now have enough resources to produce some good bread and share it with the whole town.
For example, we have quite a few new buildings, but no fire tower in sight. If a fire breaks out, we are doomed. The new inhabitants are really selfish not to think about that!
Thank you, my Lord! Oh, those people, they want new, fancy buildings here in town. But not one of these newcomers is thinking about safety! I'm really sick of them.
Build some fire towers.
Oh my Lord, I'm at the end of my rope. Since my daughter was banished, no one buys anything from me anymore… Could you help me?
Thank you for your help! Now I'll be able to get back in the race.
My Lord, this beast story is haunting me, but we also have a village to feed. Why not kill two birds with one stone by organizing a hunt in the woods? We need more hunters.
Very good, my Lord! Although we did not find the beast, which is responsible for the attack, we now have enough meat for the village.
Build two hunter's cabins to hunt for the beast.

During the trial against my sister we could do nothing to protect her. So she was banished from the kingdom. She served as an example to let everyone know that us immigrants are not welcome here and we must behave decently if we ever want to be accepted by the locals.
We never came to terms with this situation, because my sister had to return to all the misery in our old country without even being able to say goodbye.

When we were very young, our father taught us how to tame boars. A few years ago we managed to breed a real splendid specimen. He was especially strong and listened to us like a faithful dog. By placing truffles here and there we could give him precise orders.
I had ordered him to attack the baker, because he played a key role in the case. To cover my tracks, I pretended an attack on myself. And finally.…

The farmer who disappeared... You will find him in our cellar. He is alive and fine. He was the witness who accused my sister of poisoning the vineyard in the past. I wanted him to pay for his prejudices!
I confess everything! My father and I were at the origin of this vendetta.
And what was the reason for the crime? What was the perpetrator's motive?
Who is the culprit?
And who was the accomplice?
So you're the new governor? Nice to meet you. I am Basil, one of the locals. It's really not the same now that these... "artists" have arrived in town. We've already had a lot of trouble with them.
You ask what trouble? Trouble like a… huge crowd of strangers invading our town… if you know what I mean.... No?
Oh, while you're here, could you help us? The town is in great need of improvement, a little support here and there would be nice.
Well, it started a few years ago, when the Queen had to interfere in the city to banish someone. The girl poisoned our beautiful vineyards! She was also a stranger, ... I mean, not a local.
Your investigation took the wrong conclusions, Governor. My other investigators say, that you've determined the wrong acolyte. This is very unfortunate!
You got it all wrong, Governor. You've determined a wrong motive for the attacks. Did you really investigate in this case or did you simply wander around aimlessly?
You've determined the wrong culprit. Your incompetence is unacceptable, Governor!
You really disappoint me, Lord. Not only did you fuel the conflicts in my town, you are also a bad investigator. I banish you from my lands! Now get out of my sight!
Governor, I have ordered a second investigation next to yours, so that I can verify your results.

My Lord, the transport of goods is delayed because of the bad roads in town. It is imperative that we optimize the transport routes. I recommend you order the construction of dirt and stone roads, wouldn’t you think?
Excellent Sir, we built some nice roads. The transport of goods should be a lot faster from now on.
Build some roads in town.

My Lord, we could use a helping hand on the farm. I have received several requests for wool from the weaver, but we no longer have any sheep, because I had to tear down my sheep pasture to make room for new houses.
Thank you, my Lord! With your help, our farm will be able to meet the need for wool. I hope that no more newcomers will move to our lands, so that we won't need to demolish everything again.
Build a pasture and harvest some wool.

This tooth comes from a wild boar! Have you found truffles at all the crime scenes? Either someone has placed them there, or our country has suddenly become rich in truffles! Anyway, this beast has an incredible strength. I am surprised that a wild animal can behave like this…
So, you're the ones running around the village playing detective, aren't you? Well, you could do me a favor and set up a new infirmary. Then we'll see.
Thank you very much for your help, Lord. Now it is my turn to help you. Let me see your records of the beast case…
Make a profit by trading.
My Lord! There was an arson attack in the village! It is rumored that some of the suspects are locals, my Lord.
My Liege, how about we build an armory? We will be able to produce some goods and sell them to the Burrow.
Now that we have an armory of our own, we could not only craft swords for soldiers. We have also the possibility to make some good money by selling weapons and armors at the market.
The Clans have decided, my Liege. It is time to celebrate the reunification of the two clans and rebirth of the Thornburrow. My Liege, why don’t we arrange a festival at the fairground?
What a wonderful day, my Liege! It’s an honor to witness this occasion. I would not have thought that the two clans could ever be reunited to the Thornburrow again, but you did it!

Our name shall be Thornburrow again!

But first, before we can start with the preparations for the reunification, we have to take care of the wood situation in town. It seems our stocks are running low.

How about building another forester’s hut?
Well done! With these two forester’s huts we won’t run out of wood anytime soon.
My Liege, we need another mine to replace the old one.
Well done my Liege, now we can mine again, but this time let’s make sure it won’t collapse again.
This trading route was a fantastic idea! I have another suggestion my Liege. How about we improve our town even further by building a new warehouse?
Thank you my Lord, transportation of goods will be much faster with this warehouse.
Grandpa! We need your help. You have to find a cure for the fields of my friend here.
The rusty sword I gave you? Haha…\n\nSee, I was right, you can’t keep anything in good condition. Never mind, it was just a rusty sword, I am surprised that it didn’t break earlier.
Alright. Let’s find this old botanic book of your grandmother.\n\nAh! Here it is. I will need these ingredients and the fields will be regrowing in no time. And I want something to eat, I’m hungry!
If your grandmother saw me... making a cure for a Thorn. She would not be proud of me. Don’t mention it to her. The cure for the hop fields is ready.
Deliver the ingredients.
This idea of a trade route was really fantastic! I have a suggestion, my Lord, why not improve our city further by building a harbor?
Thank you, my Lord. With this new harbor we will be able to sell double the amount of goods! And our storage capacity has increased.
Build a harbor.
Bloody Burrow knight!\nI’m sure it was you who poisoned my fields! So I will destroy something of value to you! How about your grandfather’s sword…
My Liege, some Townies from both clans are in a fight. You need to go there and stop them before something terrible happens.
Hello, my Liege. As you already know, 16 years have passed since the dispute. Both clans changed their names after that into the Thorn and the Burrow.
If I may say so, my Liege, I think it’s time now to reunite the two clans under our former name – Thornburrow . It won’t be easy, but I have faith in you.
Settle the rivalries and reunite the two clans.
My Liege, we have to find a way to get the Burrow back to the negotiation table. There has to be a way…
You never visit me and now you want my help? Is that a member of clan Thorn I see standing next to you?
Of course it wasn't me!
You people from Thorn are so incomprehensible. But yes, if you really will give me a new sword, I might indeed help you.
Great news, my Liege. The Burrow soldier made peace with the Thorn monk. They both start to think that it might be a good idea to be one clan again.
My Lord, a few days ago some Townies from Burrow stole some planks from us. In order to not worsen the situation, we should produce some more planks. Can you help us to refill the stocks?
Thank you my Lord, we have now stockpiled planks for the next couple of days to come.
My Liege, according to a geologist, we have some large gold deposits on our lands but no goldsmith’s workshop to craft some jewelry. Should I order the start of the construction?
Now that we have a goldsmith’s workshop of our own, we could make some great deals with Burrow merchants.
That’s it! I have an idea, my Liege. \n\nMaybe you could order the construction of a marketplace. So when the Burrows need some goods, they will come to us.
Well done, my Liege! I have heard that the first Burrow traders are on their way.
You need to stop accusing my grandson, because I know he is innocent.
He was helping his frail grandmother around the house all day. He just went outside to find the necklace that he lost earlier.
Soon, the hops will be growing again.
Oh no, my Liege, that’s terrible! Someone is still in the mine! We need to help him.
So you never went near my fields? You’re not the one who poisoned my hops?
With all this poisoned fields and wrath of the gods, I’ve completely forgotten to get a new necklace for my loved one!
This necklace is perfect! My sweetheart will be thrilled. You have my thanks, my Liege. I am in your debt.
Deliver the jewelry.
If I give you a new sword, would you help me with a cure for my fields?
There you go. It is forged from the finest steel and fits perfectly to an honorable warrior of the Clan Burrow. I hope you keep your promise and ask your grandfather to find a cure for my fields.
Deliver a new sword.
Oh you foolish men! \n\nStop arguing or the wrath of the gods will be upon us!
Now it’s too late. Look, the sky is already getting darker.
My Liege, now that the townie from the mine is rescued and we have a new mine, we might want to shift our focus on the two fighting villagers again. They are still arguing.
But some old hatred between a sister and her brother divided our town. Day after day, they convinced more and more people to choose a side in this strange fight until one day…
Everyone was fighting their neighbors. It went so far that brother and sister decided to go their separate ways. They founded the Burrow and the Thorn clans.
Before the clash, our town was well known for its famous brew. In fact, Thornburrow was the best brew in the kingdom. It was truly a delicious drink. Ah! I will never forget that taste.
Come on. This rusty old sword? Damn, now you broke it!\n\nGrandpa will be complaining again about how I can’t take care of his stuff.

My Lord, I might have found out who was poisoning the fields. To make sure, I will have to do some investigation in the tavern and I could need your help. \n\nCould you make sure everybody is enjoying their time in the tavern, so I can complete my investigation? People will talk if they are happy.
My Lord, I might have found out who was poisoning the hop fields. To make sure, I will have to do some investigating in the tavern and I could need your help. \n\n
Could you make sure everybody is enjoying their time in the tavern, so I can complete my investigation? People will talk when they are happy.

I got it my Liege!\n\nA competitor from another town was afraid that his own brewery would be ruined, if the Thornburrow brewery takes up production again. That’s why he decided to poison the fields of the monk.
Have everybody enjoying themselves at the tavern.
Many thanks my Liege, I appreciate your effort. If only our clans could be reunited. It would be nice to produce the Thornburrow brew again. I promise to speak on your behalf to the clan chief.
The field was poisoned. You need to find the person responsible to make it grow back.
My Liege, a man from the Burrow Clan is longing for some brew. If we could deliver some barrels to him, he will surely speak in favor of the reunification.
Here my Liege, you just have to sign the invoice and the barrels are on their way to Burrow.
Deliver some brew.
My Liege, this townie in the mine needs help. We will need equipment to dig him out.
Congratulations, my Liege. We now have the necessary equipment to save the miner.
Get the necessary equipment.
He helped me get my sword back. Well... Actually your sword.
And now, we just need to wait…
My Lord, because of an animal sickness the neighboring kingdom is in need of pigs. We should sell some pigs to the merchant.
My Lord, we have only limited time to complete this task!
My Lord, I think we should give the city guard some equipment. This would greatly improve their survivability in combat.
Deliver a tribute of fish.
Deliver sausages.
Deliver a tribute of stone.
It will be very difficult to drive this disease out of the village. Shall we start building an infirmary? Remember...we have to hurry!
Now there is a doctor in the village! If he has enough medicinal herbs, the problem with the disease will soon solve itself.
Sire, let's not put the cart before the horse. Before we can produce fabric, we need a weaving mill. I advise you to order the construction of this building as soon as possible.
The construction of the weaving mill has been completed, my Lord. Our Townies will be able to produce fabric from now on.
Sir, for the good of our Townies, we must possess at least one guard tower. Hurry up! Time is running out!
Ah, these robbers won't be so stupid as to attack us now... Well done, my Lord, this is a good defense we built here.
My Lord, our city does not have many roads, why not build some to facilitate the paths for the inhabitants?
I am delighted with your success, my Lord! From now on, we no longer have any excuses for not completing the work on time.
Um, Sir? We don't have any sheep yet. The last ones disappeared during the great storm. It is time to have sheep on our land again.
It fills my heart with overwhelming happiness! Look at those plain, old sheep, inhabiting our lands once again. Let us hope that the disasters we have faced in recent years are far behind us.
Birds sing, animals play... Yes, Sir, winter is over! Spring, a gentle rebirth, finally opens up its gardens for us.
Sire, the wrath of the Townies is so great that they set their own houses on fire to prove their point! Let's hurry and see to it to make their anger subside.
Two or three good deeds don't make up for all those unpleasant years so quickly, Governor. We didn't forget that you let us down for so long!
My Lord, I have investigated your popularity with the residents to see if we are on the right track, and it doesn't look too good. Maybe a gift from you can make a difference.
The villagers accepted your gift gratefully! They are relieved that you thought of them. Now they can prepare for the winter as well.
All that remains is to deliver the goods, my Lord.
Soothe the inhabitants with a gift.
Someone set fire to the marketplace. This is a strong message! It is important to help the Townies to regain an acceptable level of well-being.
This marketplace is just a reminder of our misery! We can't afford to buy anything there. We've been barely surviving for the past few years. We too have the right to live decently!
Sir, I have once again asked the Townies about their feelings and they are very uncomfortable with the cold. Maybe we could give them some wool so they can knit warm clothes for themselves?
They thank you very much! Maybe they'll even offer you warm socks to get through the winter.
All that's missing is the delivery of the goods. This will certainly fill the Townies with joy.
Give wool to the Townies.

Good news, Governor, spring is finally back! From now on you can expect my boys and I to visit your village from time to time. In winter it wasn't easy for us either. In autumn you had nothing of value to us.  But now your city looks ripe for a robbery!
My Lord, it is our duty to make this city safer. Let's have some buildings erected for the town guard in case of bandit attacks.
Excellent, my Lord. Now we have a solid foundation for military operations in that area.

It's hot, don't you think, Mylord? I would like to take a dip in the river! If only I had brought my swimsuit.... We will soon reach the end of this challenging year, are you prepared for the final tasks?
Brrrr, it is a cold winter day! You need to dress warmer, Governor. Winter will be harsh and long. We have a lot of work to do.
The first job is to repair the damages in town. No renovation work has been done for some time. We should change that.
Very good, my Lord. The first task wasn't really difficult, but you have to start somewhere, don't you think? The villagers are happy with the repairs.
Many Townies preferred to leave our city rather than to remain in this misery. If we build a few more houses, it will probably attract new Townies.
Well done! Life is starting to return to our village. What a pleasure! Now, let's see if the next task will be as easy to you as the last one.
Build some new houses to increase the population.
My Lord, this season is almost over. We should gather supplies for the winter like a squirrel would. We have many new workers in the village. This new job should be dealt with soon.
Winter may come! We are well prepared. I see you are more of a predictive hamster than a locust dying in winter, my Lord.

Sir... It seems that, due to the recent population growth of our village, some Townies have not followed all the hygiene rules and now they are suffering from a strange disease. We should treat this as soon as possible before others become infected.

Truly a brilliant achievement, my Lord. That went faster than I can pronounce "cucurbitaceae"! You have mastered another challenge! Now more and more inhabitants will regain their trust in you, I promise you that.
Winter is harsh, my Lord. I advise you to start producing fabric so we can manufacture clothing if necessary.
It is a fabric of incomparable quality! I believe that in my whole life as an adviser, I have never seen such a beautiful product. Our village can already be proud to have you as its governor.
Our church was destroyed by a major flood a few years ago. The townies could really use a place to gather. Why not mark the occasion and build a magnificent cathedral?
Amazing! It is massive, yet magnificent at the same time! If this is not enough to make the Townes remember your incredible cathedral for a long time, I will eat my hat!
Build a cathedral.
Lord, this city is a little dreary. Some decorations could increase the well-being of our inhabitants.
Oh! Your sense for beauty is extraordinary, my Lord!  The village looks truly wonderful.

One of the challenges is to build a building that is synonymous with community, celebration and joy. We already have a cathedral, but...maybe a less formal place, like a tavern without a roof or something? A brewing festival ground  would be a great thing to have in the city. Let's not wait any longer and start building it, shall we, my Liege?
Oh, look how happy the Townies are about this new brewing festival grounds! They embrace life to the fullest.
Build a brewing fest ground.

During the summer, bandits have appeared in the town’s vicinity. They pose a serious threat for the village and its inhabitants. And they rob and stop travelers from reaching the village. We must solve this problem, NOW!
Ah! We're finally rid of these shameless bandits! Tourists will now be able to come to our village without fear.
My Lord, the year is drawing to a close and here we are at the final challenge. Organize a summer party for the city. I think it would be advisable to build a fairground for it.
We've done it, Lord! A truly beautiful feast is being arranged to celebrate the restoration of your honor and the rebirth of our proud town!
Last year we started building the foundation for a cathedral. However, the construction was stopped shortly afterwards for lack of raw materials, my Lord.
My Lord, I can't believe seeing you leaving the castle again! I'm glad you found the strength to take over the reins once more. How about you start confronting the problems in town!
Yeah, it's true that the townspeople hate you. They don't feel like you care for them anymore. You have been gone for too long. But there could be a way to fix the mistakes of the past!

There is this ancient tale about a boy who tried to regain the trust of the people after he disappointed everybody. This boy had to prove himself by overcoming twelve legendary tasks in one year to be accepted back into society.

After his success, he became the official messenger of the royal family and was able to fulfill his dream of becoming a resourceful member of society. Since that day, the accomplishment of these twelve tasks has been highly respected. Maybe that's where your salvation is, Lord!
We have failed... My Lord, you must leave the village as soon as possible. The inhabitants are at the gates. They have torches and pitchforks with them. I fear they will lynch us.
Now it's up to you to prove your greatness by completing the twelve legendary tasks! It is your responsibility to regain the trust of the villagers.
Thus end the twelve legendary tasks! Hear the people cheering for you! In one year, you rebuilt the village and regained the trust of the people.
Complete the twelve legendary tasks.

Autumn has just begun, Sire. Each season allows you to accomplish some of the twelve tasks. If the challenges and demands of the Townies are not met… then, I fear, your reign here will be over, my Lord.
My Lord, we have run out of time... Not all the tasks of this season were completed in time.
Now a new season has started and once again there are challenges to accomplish. In order to regain the confidence of the people, we have to make haste. You can do it, Sire!
Congratulations, my Lord! You have successfully completed all tasks of this season. This is a good omen and may bring us luck for the future tasks.
We have almost made it through the year, my Lord. The last season! Let's hope it goes as well as the previous ones.
Congratulations, Sir! You have passed the summer! That concludes the end of the year and the challenges it entailed.
Remaining time:
Build guard towers.
Special event!
Event completed!
As you wish, My Lord.
I will get some clothes for some villagers.
The whole village shall be supplied with clothes.
Really? I don't have time for this right now.
Clothing shortage
My lord, the population is dissatisfied with the supply of goods. There is a lack of clothing! You should act quickly, it could lead to an uprising.
I'm so hungry, My Lord. You have to do something. Your people are starving.
Build a fisherman’s hut or a hunting cabin.
My Lord, it would be advisable to begin with the construction of a hunting lodge or a fishing lodge.
I'll make sure there's enough food in stock!
A new fishing hut or a hunter’s cabin should solve the problem.
These are hard times, we gotta hang in there!
Finally something to eat! You are too kind, my Lord.
Thank you, my Lord. Soon we will be able to produce enough food.
Food scarcity
My lord, the population is starving! You should make sure there is enough food in stock. If you do not act soon, it could lead to an uprising!
My Lord, my family is close to hunger. Would you be so kind as to give us some food?
I'd really like some new jewelry!
Ohh, how beautiful! These are really splendid pieces, which are now available at the market. Thanks for the jewelry, my Lord!
We nobles demand an adequate supply of jewelry, my Lord!
We will start producing jewelry here in the village.
Everybody should have enough jewelry, I promise!
Now? I don't have time for such trifles right now!
Jewelry shortage
The population is dissatisfied, my lord. The nobles do not have the jewelry to express their prosperity. If you do not act soon, parts of the population may call for a strike!
You have failed us, my Lord. You better not ignore our needs…
My Lord, the supply of new work and leisure clothing is inadequate. The residents are asking for a decision on how to deal with the problem.
My Lord, the population has hardly any food available. The villagers want you to decide how to solve the problem.
The demand for jewelry in the village has risen tremendously, my Lord. You should not forget the needs of the Townies! How should we proceed?
It is a very hot summer, My Lord. The fields have completely dried out and the Townies are thirsty. Additionally, this years harvest is in grave danger if we don't do anything about it.
In the middle of the night, you're woken up by a very loud bang. At the other end of the city a bright light is visible as you look out of the window of the castle. What happened there?
The following morning, the blacksmith of the village comes into the audience room and has a strange lump of metal in his hand. The object is reminiscent of a stone, only slightly different.
My Lord, last night a star fell from the sky. This lump of metal is what is left of it. It seems to have unusual properties. Certainly, something special can be done with it.
My Lord! A riot has broken out in the village! The farmers and craftsmen have a difference of opinion!
My Lord, us farmers are concerned about who is more important for the village, the farmers or the craftsmen? What do you think, my Lord?
The people need fuel to heat their homes in this cold. We have to find a solution before the villagers do something ill-considered out of frustration.

There has been an accident in the mine! A cave-in has several miners stuck far below the surface. They have not much air left to breathe. About half way to the miners, there is also a big pile of resources stashed. We will not be able to save everything. What shall we do?

A convoy full of refugees has arrived in our town. When the first traveler steps out of the cart, the villagers notice that some may be infected with a disease. The traveler promises he was never in any contact with ill persons in the last weeks.

My Lord, I am a poor farmer and my daughter is going to be married soon. I spent the last decade serving you and cannot support my daughters wedding ceremony. Would you be so kind and help a poor man out?
Wild boars escaped from a farm two summers ago. They have proliferated in large numbers and despite regular hunting, this is not enough. They have been seen near your town, threatening your land.
Improve the irrigation system.
Limit distribution of water.
Build more wells and water the fields by hand.
We will manage it… Somehow.
The Drought
It's your choice, but be careful. Do you want to punish or release the nobleman? However, keep in mind that your decision may upset the villagers.
Throw him in the dungeon!
Release him! He did nothing wrong!
How about we just have a new farm built?
Speak!" scolds the soldier on guard. "Why did you burn down the farm and the fields on the outskirts of the town? This was my grandfather's farm! How could you do that?
It was my land and property! I bought it from your grandfather and can do whatever I want with it," the man cries angrily, but anxiously.
He sold it? How can that be? Just before he died?" the guardsman blurts out. “The farm and the property were a landmark of the town and you destroyed them! You belong in the dungeon if you ask me.”

My lord, this man must be punished!" cries the baker, who has been in the background the whole time. "The farm was important for the village. How are we supposed to harvest enough grain for the winter without the farm?

You must make a decision, my lord," says your counselor in a calm tone. "The inhabitants are angry, you can see that," he continues. "However, the nobleman has not really committed a crime. Here are the documents about the purchase of the land. It's all legitimate.

A Townie suddenly comes running into the audience hall just as your adviser discusses some plans for improvements in the village. Out of breath he reports: "My Lord! We found the culprit who burned down the fields and destroyed the farm! It's that nobleman who recently moved here, my Lord!

Shortly after, a nobleman is led into the hall by soldiers. "My Lord, this is a..." the nicely dressed man wants to say, but is immobilized by a kick in the knee pit, causing him to fall to the ground.
Even though he's innocent, Sir? Are you sure? Well, at least it will satisfy the villagers.
My Lord, most villagers are very pleased with your decision. The nobleman has now been taken to the dungeon.
But I also have bad news, my Lord. The other nobles in the village are appalled and have proclaimed that they will not pay taxes for a year in protest.
In protest against your imprisonment of my friend, I will not send my merchants to your village for a year!
My merchants will come back to your village again from now on.
Despite the fact that he is actually innocent, some villagers are dissatisfied with your decision, my Lord. I fear there will be riots.
Thank you, Sir. Thank you very much. I am in your debt and will make it up to you.
How dare you release this criminal. He destroyed my grandparents' farm. Apparently I have to see to justice myself.
The parties to the conflict are clearly somewhat irritated. The villagers seem to be only moderately satisfied, but the nobleman is relieved.
Lord, the bandits have been taken care of and their camp is now destroyed! The attacks will stop.
The news just came in that some of our soldiers have disappeared into the woods and are now considered bandits. It could be that we are in danger of retaliation from them.
Wonderful, the farm has been rebuilt and the nobleman and the soldier got along over a brew. I think we made the right decision.
When asked why he tore down the farm, the nobleman only said that he wanted to use the land for a new vineyard.
My Lord, I will of course pay for the destroyed farm and apologize to the soldier whose farm I unwittingly demolished.
How will you react? Will you help the inhabitants or the nobles?
A difficult situation has emerged in the village. On the question of how the cemetery should be expanded, two parties are arguing about how to proceed.
Evasive Maneuver
Sell it to a collector in the capital.
Improve the equipment in the smelter.
Build a statue of the King from this strange metal as a gift.
The Fallen Star
The hard work of the farmers is most important for the village!
The town needs the goods of the craftsmen.
What nonsense! Both are equally important!
Farmers or Craftsmen
How do you want to deal with the firewood situation?
I'll organize some firewood right away!
We should build more forester huts.
We could heat with coal!
Why don't you go into the woods and get some wood?

Hello, Sir," the elderly lady says. "I speak for the middle class in the village." She shyly glances at the adviser who nods to her. "I don't want to be rude, my lord, I hope you know that..." She begins to hesitate, but then continues to speak.

...while your castle is being heated with a lot of firewood, a large part of the population is freezing! We're running out of firewood, sir!" "The people are freezing and the castle alchemist even said that it would get much colder," the adviser commented.
My lord, I have spoken with the villagers. As a thank you for quickly solving the problem, all Townies want to pay more taxes until spring. Isn't that nice?

The temperatures have dropped immensely, Sir," says your faithful adviser as he recites the weekly tasks and announcements in the audience hall. "Some villagers would like to make a request to you. I will invite them in..." he says and walks towards the door.
If you can't or won't help us, then we have to provide warmth ourselves.
Thank you, my lord. Now the Townies will get through the winter well. I will spread the good news in the village.
The villagers have finally calmed down, Sir. The strike is over!
The positive effect in the village is over, my Lord.
However, the inhabitants still want to thank you and have left some tools as a gift for you.
Firewood
Let us hope this was not a mistake, Lord. I have unsettling reports of bandits nearby.
Men, to arms! We're under attack! Bandits have been spotted in the outskirts!
Alert the city guard! Our helpers from outside are scoundrels and bandits afterall! I had warned you, governor!
I warned you, Lord. Now we have bandits at our gates!
Do you really want to pull out the city guard and help with the harvest?
Both the farmer and the knight look at you quizzically. The peasants need help with the harvest, but the military is needed to protect the city. How do you want to proceed?

The knight is back to the audience hall. He comes to your desk and says "My Lord, I can only strictly advise against requesting help from outside". He pauses for a second and then continues speaking. "There are many bandits and robbers in the area. Chances are high that these rascals will come to our village. Do you really want to attract bandits with a reward?"
Send the soldiers out as harvest hands.
The soldiers are needed to protect the city.
We could call for external help.
I'm busy right now.
As you wish, my lord.
I will pass on your decision.
I'll arrange everything that's necessary.
I understand, Sir.
The farmers need help harvesting the fields. Could the military possibly help out?

One morning, an elderly farmer stands in the audience hall. "My lord, do you have a moment?" he says sheepishly. "We farmers are preparing to harvest the fields. But we need help with the harvest. We are not enough helpers this year".

We could assign some of the city guards to the farms and vineyards," says your faithful advisor as he watches the small faction of the city guard. A knight comes up to you and says: "I can only advise against your plan, my lord".

My scouts tell of shady figures in the outskirts of the town and in the surrounding woods. If we pull out the city guard, the city will be virtually unprotected, my Lord," the Knight says as he shows you positions of suspected bandit camps on a small map.
Good news, my Lord. By helping with the harvest, the city guard has optimized the farm operations. They will temporarily supply more raw materials.

Thanks to many friendly helpers from the neighboring village, it was finally possible to gather the whole harvest within a very short time. Many new friendships were made on this day. The following harvest festival provided for extra joy. This whole time, no bandits were seen in the vicinity of the village.
If you want to lure helpers into the village, we should offer a reward, Lord.
This will make it considerably more difficult for us to collect the harvest. I hope you will be patient with us when the people go hungry in winter, my lord.
The productivity of a building has returned to normal, Sir. It will be able to produce raw materials as usual again.
Solve the issue with the harvest hands.
Harvest Hands
Invest money.
Invest resources instead.
What else could I give you?
Naaah, I don't know. I'm out.
Invest a large amount of money.
Invest a moderate amount of money.
Invest a small amount of money.
High risk
Medium risk
Low risk
I am in.
Risk, you say? No, I am out.
Wait until the situation has eased up again.
The village has calmed down, my lord. Everything is back to normal.
The people will welcome your decision, my lord.
The nobles are glad you made the right decision.
Both sides look at you questioningly. Neither of them is happy with the decision.
The two parties leave the audience hall furiously. This is likely to have consequences.

You must make a decision, my lord. What is certain is that we should build a new cemetery. You have to decide whether you want to please the nobles or the lower classes. But you could also do something for both of them.
A cemetery is needed in the village. Both the nobles and the common people have conditions. Who will be satisfied in the end?
We're building a cemetery for the people.
Let’s build magnificent mausoleums.
Why not compromise?
I don’t want to be bothered by this, please excuse me.
In order to comply with the wishes of the people, various graves and cemetery walls must be erected.
Very well, Sir. The people will be very pleased. The nobles, however, are disappointed by your actions and have announced that they will pay less tax from now on.
Build a cemetery for the common folk
The nobles have asked for more mausoleums, you should build a few and some cemetery walls.
Very good, Sir. The nobles are already celebrating the consecration of the first mausoleum. The rest of the inhabitants are furious.
Build a cemetery for the nobles
To accommodate both parties, both a mausoleum, graves and walls should be built, my lord.
