Very good, Sir. The majority in the village is satisfied with your approach.
Build a cemetery for everyone
The counselor arrives in the audience room with a nobleman and an elderly lady. Both seem to have a request that needs to be clarified. It is about the extension of the cemetery.

First the elderly lady speaks: "My lord, I would like to stress once more that we need a cemetery with enough graves in the village", she looks at you urgently and continues: "The people need a place to honor their deceased".

The nobleman now steps forward and announces his request: "The lady's wish is certainly justified, my lord," he speaks in a calm voice, "I can understand that the little people ask for graves, but you should also think of the higher positioned here. We need big magnificent mausoleums for the nobles!" You will not regret it.
Last resting place
I am grateful.
Damn.
The joy in the village is so great that all inhabitants will make a special effort in the future, my lord.
What luck!
Since the village is still in a state of mourning for a long time, the inhabitants will initially show less effort in everyday life.
Send soldiers to search for him.
He will come back eventually.
That poor man.
My lord," the farmer calls to you. "I am so grateful that you have found my daughter. I will always pay my tithe on time in the future. Promise! I'll even put something on top.

This storm has created some permanent advantages for our village. Through the constant repair of the buildings by the carpenter, we have learned some construction methods that slow down the decay of our buildings permanently.
Farmer and daughter are reunited. The whole village celebrates. "This terrible storm already had some good sides," says your faithful advisor, while you both look at the happy family.

Our men will be ready for action sooner, my lord," the knight reports as he joins your group. When searching for the girl, the guardsmen have learned a lot. They will recover from fights a little faster now.
My lord, our buildings are severely weather-damaged. This constant storm is a threat to the village. How about we hire a carpenter to continuously repair the buildings.
Very good. As long as we can afford the materials for repairs, the carpenter will take care of the dilapidated buildings.

My Lord", the farmer starts to talk. He seems to be afraid of you. "It's about my daughter. She ran into the storm. The sheep broke out of the pasture and she was trying to catch them. Now I fear the worst. I need your permission to go into the storm and find her, Lord. Please let me go find her?
Let him go.
Stop, it's too dangerous.
Send the guards.
Establish a rescue team and find her.

Despite the danger, the father wants to run into the storm. Let's hope he finds the girl. Before leaving, he asks for your help again. "My Lord, would you be so nice and supply me some material for a rain coat?
Give him what he asks for.
Let him go unsupported.
Noo, you can't do that. She is in danger, you have to let me go find her. At least send someone to find her...please?!
She will come back eventually… We wait.
A father seeks his daughter during a devastating storm. Help him to find her.
Before we can continue, let us take care of the fires in the village, my lord. Security in the village must be ensured.
The firemen report that all fires in the village have been extinguished.
I see you have the materials together. When you are ready, we can hand them over.

You are in the castle, looking out the window. A unusually strong thunderstorm is having the town in its grip. Lightning is flashing over the skies. You watch as fireman tries to control a fire in a building near the castle where lightning struck.
Suddenly the door opens and your trusted advisor comes in with a farmer. "May we ask for your help, Lord," the advisor asks.
What do you want?
You disturb me at this hour? Get out!
With the equipment you gave him, he runs off into the night. Again, lightning hits a building. The farmer gets illuminated by the bright light for a second, then he is not seen anymore.

Without any equipment the farmer runs out into the storm. In seconds he is drenched through. On the muddy ground he slips and falls. Quickly, he stands up and runs into the fields to find his missing daughter.
You wait for hours. The thunderstorm is still on-going, when you get the notice.

The guards have returned with the daughter! "She was quite lucky. We found her under a fallen tree in the rain," the guard exclaims happily. The whole town is in a good mood after the daughter has been found.
The storm lasts for hours without getting any weaker. Finally, in the early morning hours you get the notice.
The city guard have found her heavily wounded under a fallen tree. The villagers are furious and will be for a long time.

The farmer is devastated when he learns that his daughter could not been found. He will never be able to fully process her disappearance. Thus productivity and effort on his part are permanently decreased.

After several hours, the storm hasn‘t gone any weaker. Suddenly, you hear people yelling in the streets. As you rush to see the commotion, another building is struck by lightning. Thanks to the rain, the roof is too wet to catch fire. Then you see what this is all about.
The daughter has found her way back into the town. She even brought most of the sheep back with her. Everybody is cheering.

The farmer has returned with his daughter! "Thank the lord, I have found her under a fallen tree in the rain. Thank you for helping me, Lord". The whole town is in a good mood after the farmer found his daughter.
You have to wait until the next day. Around noon, the city guard reports a lone person returning.
The look on her face is fearful as you tell her about her father is still being out there looking for her.
It's the farmer who came back alone. His daughter was never found. Only the sheep were returned to the farmer. The Townies will mourn for a long time, that's for sure.
You've waited a long time. Finally, the arriving soldier reports that the sheep have been found at the edge of the fields. However, father and daughter are nowhere to be found.
The drama of the storm is now omnipresent in the village. A certain lethargy can be felt in all the inhabitants. It will take a long time until the mood in the village will return to normality.

The farmer has returned to the village with the city guard. He could not continue his search and spend the storm in a small cave. The guardsmen found him and told of his daughters return. The town's mood is very good.
You have to wait until the next day. Around noon you finally get the notice.
The farmer has returned to the village alone. It was too dangerous to continue the search and had to spend the night in a small cave.
In order to assemble a rescue team as quickly as possible, we need barracks and some soldiers.
My lord, the rescue team is standing by. As soon as you give the order, they are ready to go.

The joy is great when both meet again. Farmer and daughter are immediately in each other's arms and cry bitterly. "Promise you will never do something like that again, child!" says the farmer and the daughter only nods and cries tears of joy.
The thunderstorm is finally over, Sire. We survived it.
Some time after the incident in the storm, the bad mood in the village repeatedly leads to friction between the inhabitants. The chances of strikes are increased.
Try to find the daughter in the middle of the storm.
The lost daughter
Rescue attempt failed!
Rescue attempt successful!
Tap the deposit! We need those resources!
The men shall only tap half of the resources.
It's too dangerous. The men should avoid the area!
Get the necessary equipment!
It is too dangerous.
My lord, we don’t have much time to act. Soon the deposit will be unreachable.
We missed our chance, Sir. The area where the gold deposit was, is now out of reach.
The men are now on their way to the dangerous area, sir. Soon we will know if they were successful.

At the last moment, the squad leader sees the gas leak.... But it's too late, one of the men holds his torch in the escaping stream of gas. There is another explosion in the mine... The rescue operation has failed.

We've lost the mine, my Lord. The rescue team, the miners and the resources in the mine have been lost. The whole village is in a very sad mood and all work in the mines will be discontinued for a long time.
At the last second, the troop leader sees the gas leak and orders all torches to be extinguished. Shortly thereafter, the troop reaches the trapped workers and begins the rescue work.
We were able to save the miners, Sir. Everyone is well, but the mine is lost. The whole village is in a very good mood, but all work in the mines will be discontinued for some time.
Slowly, the rescue team feels its way through the narrow parts of the mine. It is pitch-black. Steam and smelling gases have collected on the ground, it gets difficult to breathe.

The rescue team works their way up to the resources and begins the salvage. At some distance, the squad leader can hear the cries of the trapped miners, but the mission priorities are clear. Get the resources out of there!
Some time later the team returns with the goods, just in time before the mine collapses and buries all the trapped workers.
The mood in the village is not good, Sir. Despite the compensation for the families, all the inhabitants are very concerned. It will take a long time until someone will work again in the mines.
The population is disappointed, Sir. Nobody wants to work in the mines anymore. I fear that the Townies will mourn for a long time to come.
The people are angry, my Lord. Nobody wants to work in the mines anymore. I am afraid the Townies will let out their anger in the village. We should be on our guard.
Start a rescue mission to free the miners.
The resources have priority, the workers are lost.
We won't send anyone in there! Compensate the families.
Well, it’s a dangerous life in the mines.
The mine is in danger of collapsing for good, Sir. We have only limited time. We should hurry!
Save the missing miners before time is up.
To save the buried miners, the rescue squad needs some equipment.
My Lord, the necessary equipment has now arrived at the warehouse. Should I inform the rescue team that they should go into the mine?

We have the following options, governor.\n\nEither we open up all the deposit, and risk losing everything, try to cautiously remove half of the deposit or we avoid the area completely and miss this chance.
Send the goods
Send coins
My Lord, a large deposit of gold has been discovered in one of our mines. It is, however, in a dangerous area which frequently becomes unstable due to gas leakage.
The men could exploit the deposit, if we could provide additional tools in time and hurry before the area becomes unstable again. My Lord, this could mean wealth for the village!
The Mine Accident

Some time later, the workers return from the mine with many crates and sacks of raw materials. The action was a complete success, all resources could be recovered before the deposit became inaccessible.
Some time later, the workers return from the mine with some crates and sacks of raw materials. The action was a complete success, even if only a few resources could be recovered.

A moment later, he's disappeared just as suddenly as he came. You briefly think about what would have happened if you had decided differently, but what has happened cannot be changed. You will never know.

The next day you see how happy all the residents are. The blacksmith has met a new woman and is new in love. The carpenter has finally announced his latest project full of joy. A crib. How beautiful! Everyone is in a good mood. What a beautiful day.

It's early the next morning. Suddenly your faithful advisor comes to the sleeping chambers. "My Lord! You won't believe it," he bursts out. He continues stuttering "..t..th...the treasury! It is chock-full. We have become a lot richer overnight!

When you wake up the next morning, you feel a severe headache. It's as if you'd had knowledge blued in with a hammer. It feels as if you now know all about everything, everything goes around in your head. You can recite all the books in the library by heart and remember everything, even your infancy. You have attained true wisdom!

It has been a good year for the town. You have almost forgotten about the mysterious visitor from a year ago. You are sitting next to your fireplace with a tasty ice cold brew, enjoying the warmth of the fire.
Suddenly the air in the room gets very cold! You look to your desk and then see him sitting there again. The mysterious stranger is back!
Quickly, you get a torch from the nightstand and turn towards the figure again. It is gone…
Strange.
Weird.
Must have been a dream.

I have a proposal for you..." the stranger says. "I believe there is something I can do for you. You just have to name what you want the most," he continues. He waits for you to answer the question...
Happiness
Wealth
Wisdom
No pedlars welcome!
The stranger smiles and disappears in the shade. What does he mean? What will happen now?
He looks at you with a shady look for a long time before saying the following sentence: "I am here to get what is due. I said a reckoning was coming.
What?
The reckoning?
Guards!
The stranger nods briefly and smiles. A moment later he speaks the words "There will be a reckoning..." and disappears. You have a bad feeling about this. What is going to happen?

My lord, fires have broken out all over the village!" the counselor bursts into the audience hall. You had just smelled a fire smouldering. Now came the confirmation. "I gave the firefighters top priority and alert level." Is this the reckoning?
The leader of the fire brigade shall confirm that all fires have been extinguished or have been allowed to burn in a controlled manner. The village is safe again.

The door of the audience hall jumps open with a loud crash. It is the doctor who brings bad news. "My lord, you should be informed of the new situation in the village." He pauses for a few moments. "The plague has broken out. There are many sick people and many more are infected. We should act quickly". The reckoning has come!
The outbreak of the plague is over, my Lord. The town is safe again.

Something strange is happening, my lord. See for yourself" he points out from the window to a building completed yesterday. It looks like a dilapidated ruin. "My lord, the buildings… they are decaying rapidly. What's going on?" The reckoning has come!
Your loyal advisor enters the audience chamber. "I think it's over, Lord." he says joyfully. "The abnormal decay of the buildings seems to have returned to normal.

At the entrance gate of the castle you meet a farmer who is beside himself and wildly discusses with the pig herdsman. When asked what was going on, the farmer reports excitedly. "Everything is dying, my lord. The fish in the rivers as well as the pigs of the shepherd. The game in the woods and the fields. Wheat, hops, grapes. Everything is dying. We are cursed! The reckoning has come!
The fields, my lord! They grow back again. I think we have finally overcome this curse. What luck!

Something very strange is happening in the village. You noticed early that all movements are extremely difficult. Everything seems incredibly slow. When you look out of the window, you see that all the inhabitants of the village move very slowly. Is that the reckoning?
After half an eternity the speed of movement in the village normalizes again. A stroke of luck! It seems as if the reckoning is over.
So all you desire is to live happily ever after with the love of your life in the village of your dreams!
So you want to be the wealthiest person in the Kingdom?
Ahhh, you yearn for the one true power… Wisdom! Good choice.
A mysterious stranger appeared to you that night and made you an offer.

The castle is bitter cold this night. Wind howls through your chambers. Getting up to get thicker blankets from the cupboard next to the door, you see a shadow in the corner of your eyes.\nThere is somebody in the room!

Could it be your trusted adviser? Or somebody is here to do harm?\nSlowly, you turn around and see a shadowy figure sitting on the chair next to your desk. The figure does not move… it just sits there.

It has gotten late and you are tired. You walk upstairs to your room in the castle tower. Just before opening the door to your chambers it suddenly gets very cold. Slowly, you start opening the door. Almost half way open, you see in your room there sits that figure again!

In the soft light, you stand before a man in clothes you have never seen before. You feel uncomfortable. Something is not right. The man slowly gets up from the chair. There is something weird with his movement, but you cannot describe what exactly it is.\nWith a deep and slow voice he starts speaking.
To every wish, there is a reckoning.
Take the offer...You want it!
The Mysterious Stranger
My lord, many inhabitants tell of terrible dreams that plague them at night. The people are dissatisfied and cannot work with complete effort. They lack sleep.
By improving the irrigation of the fields and the supplies for the town, we can handle the drought much better, my Lord.
As always, we will overcome this burden and make it through these dire times...with thoughts and prayers.
Alright, My Lord. But I do not think the villagers will like your decision.
Very well, My Lord. I think with the measures we have taken, we can overcome the drought better.
Very good, my Lord. I will commission it immediately.
We've found a buyer, sir. The stone will make a good price.
With the help of the stone we were able to improve the equipment of the smelter. From now on it will be able to work permanently more effectively.
Governor, have my thanks for this wonderful present. The statue is really something special!
Your decision will have consequences, my Lord.
So you think our work is worth less than the craftsmen's, my Lord? Well, we'll see.
Well, I knew you'd prefer the farmers, my Lord! Let's see how this develops.
I think you've disappointed our people, my Lord. Now both factions are angry.
Due to your decisions, the productivity of a building is temporarily affected.

As you look out the window of the castle over the countryside around the village, you see the Townies fearfully isolating themselves in their houses or camping in front of the infirmary. There are a number of rats clearly visible on the streets, but they avoid the areas lit by torches. They are still only limited to the dark crossroads.

It's the plague, the rats have brought this terrible disease into the village, my Lord," says the adviser, who entered your chamber unnoticed and found you sunk in thought at the window of the castle. "The villagers are upset and accuse you of indifference, my Lord. The mood in the village is at the bottom of their socks. They could prepare a rebellion.
The villagers think your decision was quite harsh. They are afraid that you will throw them into the dungeon, too, when they become ill. This will affect their happiness for some time.
Before they were forced to leave the village, some of the refugees started fires in several buildings.
After your decision the refugees leave your village with grim faces and move on.
We took in the refugees, my Lord. Some of them have even left some goods for you as a token of their gratitude.
Supplying the town with coal is a good idea, my Lord. This way the inhabitants will not need as much resources to heat their homes.
Very good, my Lord. I will prepare your decision.
That's too bad, my Lord. That would have been a great opportunity for us.
I will make your decision known immediately, my Lord.
As you wish, my Lord. But I think the population will not be satisfied with this decision.
My Lord. I think the people will welcome this decision.
Result of a decision
I understand, Sir. You are very busy. I won't bother you anymore.
Thank you, Sir. You are truly too kind. With these tasty drinks, we now have a real feast. I will make sure that the whole village is invited.
You are too kind, my Lord. Thank you very much. I will never forget your deeds and will work even harder from now on.
Some Hunter's cabin need to be built. Should I commission the buildings, Sir?
We need help, Sir. Many inhabitants are ill, food is scarce. We had to destroy all meat and bread, because it was also infested.

The citizens report a plague of rats, my Lord. We must act as soon as possible before it is too late." The face of your faithful adviser is marked by fear. Apparently, he too would like to leave the city. "The inhabitants are close to panic... How shall we proceed?
The blacksmith should make enough tools so that the traps can be built, my Lord.
Have the toolmaker build some rat traps!
Building hunters cabins could help!
Didn’t we have a doctor? Don't worry.
Let the Townies visit the doctor.
Some rats have been killed, but there are so many rats following that it has not worked.
What do you intend to do, my Lord?
Calm the villagers before a panic breaks out!
Order more infirmaries to be built!
Isolate the sick and avoid places where rats have been seen!
Find someone who can help! Offer a reward!
Send our riders to the capital for help.
Send a ship out looking for help!
More and more rats are burying their way to the surface, my Liege. They are bringing the plague! The villagers are outraged by your inactivity so far!
Lord, with respect, you must do something... There's a riot in the village! The angry mob is burning down the buildings!
There won’t be any riots in my town!
Send riders to all surrounding cities and seek help!
We need to keep faith and pray for a solution.
All right, let the man work his miracle!
We can do it on our own.

One morning the scouts report, that the messengers have returned. They have brought a rat catcher specialist. The funny looking man, talks with a broad smile while demanding payment up front. He is pretty sure that he can handle the rat problems in town though.
Pay the man what we owe him. The full amount.
Pay the man the full amount, including the bonus!
The town cannot afford it… We are very sorry.
You can get half… nothing more!

The man takes out a very old looking toolbox. Out of it he gets an ancient and heavily ornamented flute. He cleans it slowly and after some time he starts to walk around the village and plays on the flute. Some time later the first rats can be seen coming out of their hideouts and keep following the flutist and his nice melody.

After some time, the rats start to follow him out of town. The village elders can see the man walking towards the river. He stops next to the shore, while the rats continue on into the water. Soon they drown in the rushing floods.

After his deed is done, the flutist returns to town with a smile on his face. He looks at the village elders and demands his payment. With a rough voice and a much fiercer smile on his face he says, “Since you did not pay up front, my fee just increased a bit.”
Depressing news

The man is escorted out of town and leaves with an angry face. You watch him for a very long time until he disappears in the distance. Somehow you have the feeling this is not the last time you see him.
After several days, The village elders propose a festival to celebrate that the plague of rats has been overcome.
The festival is a great success. Many villagers attended and feasted extensively for countless hours into the night.
Many people thought of the strange flutist, but in the end everybody was just happy to know, that the rat plague was over. They did not notice until the next morning, that something was amiss.
The flutist celebrated with the villagers, but in the morning he was gone, never to be seen again.
Although no agreement could be reached with the flutist, the villagers celebrated their victory.

The people told the next morning that their neighbors were nowhere to be found or left their workplace without a word, only to disappear completely afterwards. Some even destroyed their homes before disappearing.
Send the man away. We can handle our own problems.
We accept his help. But first the work then payment.
This is a lot of money... Okay, Take the money.
Well then, pay the man in advance!
A strange man arrives the next day at the castle. He wears a green hat with a pheasant feather and awaits an audience with the Lord. He says he can help the town, but only for a huge amount of coins…
Send out the best riders in all directions.
Let the hunters search the woods near town.
The town guard can surely find the missing Townies.
Let us concentrate on rebuilding our village… Send thoughts and prayers!
My Lord! The council of village elders thinks you should organize a search party to look for the missing inhabitants. What do you think?
Lots of the villagers are missing, my Lord. There is rumor circling around town… People say that the flutist has come back and collects villagers instead of the rats with his flute.
The town is in shock… Nobody can think straight… whole families are gone and the rest of the Townsmen are almost inable to work.
On the way from the fairground back to the castle a mysterious melody can be heard in the village... Strange... It is almost hypnotic.
Let’s take a look.
Tell the men to come home.

The search is going rather bad. After three days, the missing townies have not been found. When the search party is about to turn back, they can hear something in the distance. Was it a voice, barely audible? A small cave can be seen from the road…

On the way back the search party thinks about the flutist. He had given them his word to bring the missing villagers back. Will he really stick to his promise? As the villagers stuck to the promise to pay him? They just have to trust the man.

When the money was finally handed over to the Pied Piper, he smiles broadly and says: "Now I will pick up the missing villagers. We will return to your village together in a few days. You have my word.
Pay the flutist the desired amount and let him go.
You will rot in the dungeon! Take him in chains.
The village is too poor to pay you... we are sorry.
The cave entrance is a little overgrown with all kinds of vegetation but a glow of light is noticeable from the inside.

Slowly the search party enters the cave. After some time you see a shadowy figure sitting at a small campfire. It is the flutist. While the search team approaches him,they notice that he is sitting alone. No villagers are with him.

Well, you've found me," says the flutist in a rough voice. "You are certainly looking for the missing inhabitants. They won't come and aren't here either," he says as he scrutinizes the members of the search team.

You now have the choice to finally pay me for my services and I will see to it that you get your missing ones back, or you do whatever you think is right, but with the consequence that you never see your missing ones again. Decide, but the price of my services has gone up again.
The village is afflicted by an unknown disease. Many suspect that there is a connection with the recent rat plague. There is cause for concern!

Just as the men of the search party are about to jump at the rat catcher, something strange happens. The flutist stands up in a quick movement and kicks some dust into the campfire. Suddenly, there are strong flying sparks in the narrowness of the cave and the men are blinded. When they were able to see again, the flutist had disappeared. They tried to search for him in the surrounding area, but there was no trace of him to be found. He just disappeared.

The search party returned to the village without the missing townies. The remaining inhabitants of the village were deeply distressed. All their hope was frustrated. It took a very long time for the village to recover from the situation.
In the end, the events with the rat catcher brought a lasting benefit to the city. Each villager developed a natural resistance to the plague, resulting in fewer outbreaks of the terrible disease.

A few days later the men of the rescue team are back in the village and sit at the campfire near the city border. They play some dice poker and discuss loudly. The men are startled when they hear a melody from afar... it's the flutist!

I promised you that I would keep my word if you kept yours," he said, as he stepped out of the shade and lowers the flute from his mouth. Behind him, the missing villagers, now separated from their spell. The turmoil attracts some Townies to come to the campfire. Families and friends fall into each other's arms, all overjoyed.

The joy in the village continued for a long time, but it took just as long for the village to return to normal everyday life, because much of it had been destroyed and had to be rebuilt. All the inhabitants were in such a good mood that everyone helped, because it's always easier to reach every goal together…
The people do not agree with your decision! A big mob is moving through the city in the meantime.
The situation is bad, Sir. Travelers have learned that we have a strange disease. Traders will avoid us from now on…
The Flutist gratefully accepts the bundle of coins. "You kept your word," he says with a smile. "Far too often I have been deceived after I have done my job properly."
The rat catcher gratefully accepts the bundle of coins. "Thank you," he says with a smile. "I'll get to work immediately."
The rat catcher is visibly disappointed that he has been deceived. "You will regret your decision, I promise you," he says with a bitter face.
It will take some time for the men to return!
The Rat Plague
Let them in, I don’t fear any illnesses.
Send them away, they are not welcome here.
Throw them in the dungeon! There they can be ill!
Refugee Crisis
Scouts report a convoy of wagons approaching the town.

One morning a desperate farmer comes to the audience hall. Out of breath he begins to speak in shame, "My Lord, my wife and my children are seriously ill... Could you help us? We need medicine and a doctor." He looks at you with sad eyes...

After the farmer has left the room, your loyal adviser emerges from the adjacent room. "This is not an isolated case, my Lord," he says in a depressed voice. "There are rumors of an infectious disease here in the village." As he walking towards the door he says, "We should take precautions, Sir."

Another resident asks for audience, my Lord." says the counselor as he lets an older man in. "My Lord, my neighbors speak of countless rats that roam around in the cellars." He looks at you with a sinister expression. You can read his fear clearly in the torchlight. "Do we have to worry, my Lord?”
My Lord, the grain is afflicted with some kind of disease. What do we do? I think it is the rats that have brought something rotten to our village.
Handle the situation.
Complete the task before the time runs out!
Treasure under the Mountain
It's not gonna be a nice party without a little dough, is it?
Support them with drinks
Get lost! I don’t have time for this nonsense!
Wedding Helper
What shall we do?
The doctor would like to conduct some experiments with the bread, would you be so kind and provide some of the special bread?
Thank you very much, Sir. I will start the investigation as soon as the bread has been delivered.

“My Lord, the villagers are furious about this witch situation” your humble adviser says. “They're demanding action. Now!” He looks around with an uneasy look. “You don’t believe she really is a witch, do you?”
I need time to decide.
Let the villagers decide their fate.
What happened exactly?
Suddenly the woman is starting mumbling in a strange language and is having some kind of seizure. Her movements and groans are nothing you have ever seen before...
Call the doctor to examine her.
I want to take a closer look.
Call the monks to have a look at her.

The woman squirms and writhes on the ground while waving her arms at the crowd. The villagers step away in fear as she went on with the indistinguishable mumbling. "We need to banish her", one of them says. Your trusted adviser looks at you and then over to the girl. "What should we do with her?
Throw her in the dungeon.
Let's hear everyone out.

The doctor arrives shortly afterwards. He examines the bruises while some villagers are trying to fixate her. He doesn't have a clear answer for you. "She could be poisoned, but this does not explain the things she says in strange voices. I can't be sure".

Suddenly one of the bystanding villagers screams and falls to the ground, having similar seizures and starts to mumble strangely, too. The crowd disperses. "It's spreading!", one of the others screams. "You have to do something, Mylord".
The doctor shall take care of them.
The monks shall inspect them.
Banish them from the village.

The monks from the monastery arrive after a while. The woman is thoroughly examined by the clerics. One of the monks looks at you and speaks with a low voice: "This could be a demonic presence taking possession of villagers, my Lord!" We could ask a preacher to perform an ritual or a doctor for advice. Another possibility is to have the villagers sort out the issue.
Call for a religious ritual!
Ask the doctor for advice.
Have the villagers sort the case out.
The recent incidents are very worrying. We should get to the bottom of this.
The doctor needs some specialized equipment for filtering solutions and for the examination.
My lord, I need special equipment for an examination to filter some alchemical solutions.
I need special tools for the examination. My lord, would you be so kind as to make them according to my specifications?
I want him to have the tools he needs.
Give the doctor specialized filtration equipment.

Some days have passed. Suddenly someone entirely different is having the same symptoms as the woman before. Again, the villagers want to banish the "witch" but when they try to bring her to the castle, she is already in a bad state and completely lethargic.
Maybe we need a doctor now.
Let the doctor examine the victim.

The villagers are speaking of the weird behavior of the woman. "She is a herbalist", the farmer says, "everyone comes to her when they are ill. Since a week or so she started acting weird. Talking with herself, doing strange things in her house.
What happened before?
What was she doing in the house?
Let her speak for herself!
The farmer looks at you, with wide eyes. "Well, we were all together harvesting the fields around town and there was the harvest festival afterwards".
Anything special about the harvest?
What happened at the feast?
I want to speak with one of the victims.

Well, one night we heard her scream around the house. Like she was seeing things... maledictions or something like that," the farmer says. "The other day, she was in front of the house when the demonic presence took hold of her, shaking her and starting the fever.
Maybe she was poisoned somehow?
What happened before she got weird?
Only mumbling comes out of the victim. She is very feverish and sweating heavily. When she does open her eyes, she can't focus on any face and her pupils are quite large.
Call the doctor!
Have the victim examined.
The monks may know what to do.

Well", the farmer says "The harvest was moderate this year. There was an unusual amount of brown wheat in the harvest. The miller said that it was not enough for the winter and the feast so he used the brown ones for the flour, too.

After the baker brought all the bread we had a big feast to celebrate the harvest. He even brought a special new type of bread he baked out of the brown wheat. The feast was unusually wild this year. A lot of the villagers complained about stomach pain the next day, but that is usually the case when a feast like that takes place. The baker threw away the rest of the bread, because he thought it tasted kinda funny...
Investigate the brown wheat.
Lets check the house of the woman.
Since the witch was quite poor, she seemed to have taken some of the "special" bread for herself after the baker threw it away. In her house you can find some of the bread still uneaten.
Let the doctor analyze the bread.
Interesting.
While the doctor is away, more and more villagers complain about stomach pain and having seizures. The villagers are asking for a cure. What should we do?
Destroy the remaining bread.
Wait for the doctor to return.
We have to find out what really happened.

After some time the doctor returns from the capital. He brings good news and immediately comes forward with them. "It is not witchcraft!” It is ergot poisoning of the harvest. We should immediately destroy the remaining harvest to make sure this won't be happening again. Ergot poisoning can lead to seizures, hallucinations and complete lethargy," he said.

You have to make the decision, Lord. Either we keep the remaining harvest and try to cultivate more of this ergot or we destroy everything of the harvest for the sake of our villagers. What do you suggest to do?
After some time the doctor returns from the capital. He brings good news and immediately comes forward with them. "It is not witchcraft!”

It is ergot poisoning of the harvest. We should immediately destroy the remaining harvest to make sure this won't be happening again. Ergot poisoning can lead to seizures, hallucinations and lethargy," he says. We have to destroy it.

My lord, wait! This ergot on the harvest, yes, it can be dangerous when overdosed. But the villagers were quite relaxed and happy when they consumed only small dosages. Maybe we have an opportunity here for the villagers prosperity and wellbeing.
Destroy the rest of the harvest.
Maybe this ergot has something good in it. We keep it.

A crying woman is dragged by a couple of villagers into the courtyard. She looks sore but otherwise unharmed. The villagers demand that action is taken against the supposed witch. What do you do with her?

After the harvest and all supplies with the ergot fungus had been destroyed, peace slowly returned to the village.\n\nNevertheless, the whole event had a positive effect on the village. The villagers are now more diligent at work and less exhausted.

From now on, the farmers will cultivate wheats that are faster infested with ergot. The medicus has already started to create a tincture containing small amounts of the new miracle cure.\n\nThis has the permanent positive effect that the inhabitants are a little happier, but also a little lazier.
My Lord, in order to prepare the healing power of faith, we still need some materials. Would you be so kind as to send me the appropriate ingredients.
The ritual is prepared as soon as you hand over the materials. Thank you very much, Sir.
Provide the necessary materials for the ritual

Angry villagers have arrived at the castle. The mob is carrying torches and pitchforks. "Lord!", the mob leader says, "We have found a witch in town!" A crying woman is dragged by a couple of villagers into the courtyard. She looks sore but otherwise unharmed.
“This witch needs to be taken care of, Lord” the mob leader cries. “She is acting weird. And we found herbal essences in her hut! She has to be a witch!”
With the right tools that doctor starts to examine the girl. Superficially looking, nothings seems wrong with her, until the doctor finds out, that she has black fingers and feet.
Thank you very much, Sir. I have produced an alchemical solution with which I could identify a special fungus on the victim's mouth.

The preacher and the monks take the victim to the church. On holy ground, they perform the ritual the same night. You can hear the singing all night long. In the morning, the monks come out and report the victim has entered a state of tranquility.

After the examination, the doctor believes he needs to get in contact with the university in the capital. He has a theory but needs to clarify with his colleagues and asks for some equipment for the trip.
I will leave as soon as I have received the equipment for the trip. It may take a while to get back. Be careful, my lord.
My lord, the villagers are going crazy! Many are sick or do not know what they are doing. They have started fires.
The stocks of wheat need to be burned, and the warehouses cleaned.
Get rid of the wheat in the warehouses.
Finance the trip of the doctor.
Handle the witch situation in the town.

My lord, there's a little problem with your order. We have no room in the dungeon at the moment. It has still not been repaired since the last flood in the grape juice cellar. But we could build a temporary dungeon outside the castle walls. A new treasure chamber would be an adequate building.
Very well, we'll take the possessed to the new dungeon immediately.
Build a suitable dungeon.
The Witch Hunt

More and more often you meet obviously sick inhabitants. Apparently all victims of the disease or witchcraft are very relaxed and content. Until the seizures finally begin and they just talk weird gibberish and eventually end up being lethargic.
Thanks for playing!
Perhaps later.
I'm not sure yet.
Please rate the game and tell us why you like it!
Yes, of course!
Yes, but only for free!
Remove ads
Perhaps later.
No, I like ads!
Yes, of course!
Yes, and I'll pay!
Do you want to remove the ads in the game?
Do you want to remove the ads in the game?
Yes, but only for free!
Yes, and I'll pay!
