So you are going to steal my nuggets? Well, you will see what you get for that. AAVVAALLAANNCCHHEE!
Wanna' know what happens to people who don't listen?! AAVVAALLAANNCCHHEE!
Where did you get that bread from? Whatever, I want some too! Or do you prefer another avalanche?
Fulfill the bandit‘s demands.
Oh, that‘s a huge bunch of iron. I‘m sure you wanna’ make some tools out of it for me.
How handy, you already melted the nuggets into ingots. I told you already that it is „my“ gold and I want it back, now! Oh and refine them a little bit more, okay?
I was thinking about getting new clothes. Do you have some in my size?
At least all townies could escape the avalanche, but the buildings hit by the avalanche have been destroyed.
The constant deliveries from this village have stopped. Governor, I‘m expecting you to deal with this problem.
The threat of the avalanches was no problem for you. I knew I could rely on you my Governor.
Accomplish the primary tasks and take care of the mines.
We should repair the warehouse, otherwise it will collapse, too.
Repair the warehouse.
At first we need a sawmill to rebuild all the town‘s buildings.
Build a sawmill.
My Lord, despite the danger of avalanches, we have to start the iron and gold production again. The King is waiting for a big delivery from this village.
Let your miners dig for iron and gold ore.
A smelter is more efficient when placed near the mines, but in the case of an avalanche it will be damaged, too. My Lord, decide wisely.
Excellent my Lord. The King expects a replacement for the missed deliveries. We should pay a huge tribute.
Pay a tribute to the King.
The production is very slow, my Lord. With more mines we could increase the ore digging rate.
We are running low on coal. You should give the order to build a charcoal burners hut.
My Lord, we should produce gold ingots to pay additional tributes. The King will be very pleased.
Watch out my Lord! Another avalanche, how horrible!
My Lord, many mines collapsed already. The king gave the order to rebuild them.
Build more mines.
My wife wants to pray for us so that no avalanches will cause us harm. Would you be so kind and build us a church?
My Lord, I know we need a lot of wood for the reconstruction but my family has no more fire wood and it‘s getting very cold. Maybe you can help us?
It is very difficult to tramp through the snow. A few cobblestone roads could help.
Governor, we can‘t grow wheat in this region. But we can buy bread at the market. Or we can just buy the wheat and bake our own bread.
Always just fish and meat. My Lord, can't we eat some bread for change?
Meet the desires of your townies.
Our clothes are getting torn by the harsh weather conditions. We really need new clothes.
Those rusty tools are nearly braking apart in our hands. I guess you need the iron, but using some of it for new tools will really help us.
In this snowy region we are happy about every little thing. My Lord, if you are not too busy, can you please beautify our town?
Men! Commence the attack!
Are you looking for the merchant? Well, he got lost and somehow found himself tied up in my camp. But don‘t you worry, he is fine. Just give us a small donation and he will be free again.
Alright, we will let the merchant go. Trade with him, so I have more to steal again.
Pay the ransom to set the merchant free again.
Bandits! Let’s get the hell out of here! We call it a tactical retreat. We have stolen enough anyway.
Did you just destroy one of our camps? By doing so, you are just challenging us. Attack the town, fellas!
Oh no, my Lord. The Townies are unhappy and not willing to pay taxes. We should fulfill their desires to earn taxes again.
Increase the happiness to earn taxes again.
Governor, I need plenty of coins. Establish a flourishing economy and pay tribute. But be warned, there are many bandits in the area. The whole kingdom is counting on you.
Very well done my Governor. I knew I could count on you. You shall be rewarded and gain more reputation.
My Lord, the warehouse stocks are running low on bread. This makes the people unhappy.
Have enough bread to increase the happiness.
Dissatisfaction is spreading, My Lord. The people are longing for brew.
Have enough brew in stock to prevent a coming strike of the Townies.
The carpenter has his work cut out for him. Many buildings need to be repaired, my Liege. I advice to build more carpenters.
Build a carpenter's workshop to increase the happiness.
I have nothing to wear. We need more clothes and dresses.
Have enough clothes in stock to increase the happiness.
Sir, the fire lookout towers are not covering enough buildings, we should build more.
We don‘t even have enough fish in this village. I will not pay any taxes!
Store enough fish in the warehouses to decrease the chance of a strike.
I want to surprise my wife with more jewelry. Too bad I cannot find any in this city.
Have enough jewelry in stock to prevent the Townies from striking.
There is not much to do in town. There is not enough entertainment. I think it's time to increase the number of entertainment buildings.
I am thirsting for juice. Sir, can you provide juice again?
Stock up on juice to increase the happiness and prevent a strike.
Again there is no meat available in town. When will we get any again?
Have enough meat to increase the happiness and prevent a strike.
Governor, with so many people in town, I can‘t take care of all. I need support if I am to help them all.
Build an infirmary to prevent a strike in town.
There is no room in our tavern. It is way too crowded. The new Governor is wasting our money instead of spending it for our needs.
My Lord, at first we should build the basic buildings for our economy. I recommend an additional fisherman's hut and a sawmill.
Construct a sawmill and a fisherman's hut
We can construct a mine nearby to gather resources very quickly.
Construct a mine.
The people are now asking for bread. We can either produce it by our own or buy it on the market. However, we should make sure to always have enough bread.
Have enough bread.
We don‘t even get some brew. For what am I even paying taxes if we cannot get such a simple drink as brew?
Store enough brew in the warehouse.
My Lord, the people like to eat all kinds of food. Only fish and bread is not enough, they want meat too.
Ensure enough meat is stocked in the warehouse.
It would be wonderful to have more than just one dress. Would you be so kind, Mr. Governor, please?
Stock up on clothes.
Since the city is growing, more and more aristocrats are settling down. They want to drink some juice.
Have enough juice in the warehouse.
A wonderful city. But it‘s lacking some luxury goods. Would you be so kind and offer jewelry?
Store jewelry in the warehouse.
The Townies demand for a church.
We require a tavern to make our people happier, my Lord.
My Lord, we should build a fairground for our people.
Our people are worrying about the fire safety. We should construct a fire lookout tower.
Governor, is there already a competent doctor in the city?
Build an infirmary
To increase the happiness of our people, we should build a jousting ground.
My Lord, the city is growing very well. To keep all buildings in a good condition, we should build a carpenter's shop.
If we don't do something against the bandits, they will deprive us of our dear homes and belongings.
We already have some soldiers. I hope we can defend the city against the bandit‘s attacks.
My Lord, it is time to put the bandits in their place and banish them from this region.
Apparently some clearer measures are needed. The town is now on strike!
Your Townies are on a strike. Wait until they calm down.
My Liege, what a wonderful day, don't you think?\n\nI came before you to ask if it would be possible to ensure the town is decorated enough for the festivities.
Raise the satisfaction with decorations in town.
You did a marvelous job with these new decorations, my Lord. The town looks splendid!
My Lord, the workers preparing the feast are very annoyed about the lack of entertainment between the festivities. I overheard several of them saying that they wish for a juggler camp.
Build a juggler camp.
Great my Lord! The workers are back on preparing the festivities. They are full of joy because we now have a juggler camp in town.
These thunderstorms are damaging the town immensely. We should make sure all buildings are adequately repaired, Lord.
Raise the building condition satisfaction.
Great my Lord! Now the buildings are in a very good condition again.
My Lord! A terrible thunderstorm is brewing over the town. You should get into safety of the castle. Lightning has already struck several buildings…

Might I take a moment of your time, my Lord?\n\nWith all these preparations... You should not forget what this festivity is all about... It can only take place when the harvest has been completed, my Lord!
Complete the grape harvest.
What a wonderful sight, my Liege! The harvest has been completed and the preparations for the festivity are nearly done, too.
My Lord, we have ran out of time. It is too late now for the festival. The King won’t be pleased to hear about this…
Great, my Liege!\n\nThe preparations for the festivity are complete. We are just waiting for your command to start the festivities.
By royal decree, I order you to uphold a year of festivities. Each season I want you to arrange a festival in honor of my new wife!\n\nNow go and start preparing! Do not disappoint me…
I am really disappointed in you, Governor!\n\nManaging a couple of festivities was such a simple task, yet you still failed to do it! Was it too much to ask for? Now get out of my sight!
Arrange all festivities in time!
Governor! This was a magnificent year of festivities.\n\nYou proved that I can rely on you whenever I have a difficult task.
What a nice festival it was, my Liege!\n\nBut now we have to make sure the Autumn festival is arranged as planned and before winter starts!
Arrange the autumn festival before winter starts.
To prepare the spring festival we have to make haste, my Liege.\n\nThe festival has to be completed before summer starts and we don’t have much time.
Arrange the spring festival before summer starts.

What a nice festival it was, my Liege!
But now we have to make sure the summer festival is arranged as planned and before autumn starts! 

Time is of the essence, my Liege!
Arrange the summer festival before autumn starts.
What a nice festival it was, my Liege!\n\nWe have to make sure the winter festival is arranged as planned and finished before spring starts!
Arrange the winter festival before spring starts.
My Lord, I recommend that we build a fairground as soon as possible. All festivals will be held there.
Build a fairground.
Great, my Liege! The festivity grounds are completed. This building is very important for the tasks at hand, so we should keep an eye on it.
My Lord, we need a fairground for the festivities!
The first thing we need is a proper maypole, my Liege. The lumberjack can cut us a tree that is well suited for this. However, he will have to cut down many trees to find the best one.
Gather wood for the maypole.
Our maypole has to be decorated properly. For this we need enough fabrics, my Lord.
Produce fabrics for the maypole.
What a nice looking maypole. Did you know that it is tradition for my brethren to steal the maypoles in the area each year?
HarHarHar! Your maypole is ours now! It will make a good decoration in front of our bandit camp. If you are able, you can come and try to get it back…
Protect the maypole from bandit attacks!
Damn it! Almost got the damn maypole. You defended it well, Governor!
My Lord! There is a bandit camp in proximity of the town. We need more men and another guard tower to secure the village.
Build another guard tower and assign enough soldiers.
Very well! Now our soldiers can defend the fairground a lot easier when the bandits attack!
The maypole has been stolen from our warehouses. We have to attack the bandit camp and get it back to make sure the festival can start in time.
Attack the bandit camp and get the maypole back!
A victory! The maypole is being brought back to our warehouse as we speak, my Lord.
My Lord! The farm is on fire! Please, you have to do something!
What a disaster, Governor! The farm has burned down and the harvest is ruined…
Save the farm!
I am forever grateful to you, my Liege!\n\nBut the fire has destroyed the harvest! The festivities might still have to be cancelled if we do not harvest the fields in time.
My family’s farm has burned down, my Lord! I will never make the first bread of the year in time for the festival. Would you be so kind and order the farm to be rebuilt?
Build a new farm.

Thank you, my Lord.

Without you, I would be ruined and the summer feast might have been cancelled!

But we have to make haste in order to harvest the wheat in time!
My Lord, we have to look after the harvest now. There is still some time until the festival starts. We have to make sure enough wheat is harvested.
Complete the wheat harvest.
It is very hot these days, my Liege. I hope there won't be another fire or drought to threaten the festivities. Nonetheless, now we have enough wheat for the feast.
My Lord, my fields are so dry I think we have another draught this summer. Would you be so kind and build a couple of wells to water the fields?
Build several wells to water the fields.
Nicely done, my Liege! The fields have been watered. Now we just have to wait until the wheat grows again. \n\nI hope it does not take too long…
The feast can start once we have finished baking the first bread of the harvest, my Liege. Would you be so nice to ensure the baking is completed in time?
Bake enough bread for the summer festival.
Splendid, my Liege. The bread for the feast has been baked!
My Lord! Something is still missing for the festival...we need brew! You should order the construction of a monastery brewery in order to get some brew produced by the monks!
Produce brew for the summer festival.
Very good my Liege. That brew is really tasty and refreshing in a hot summer like this.
I have a wonderful idea for the winter festivity, my Liege. On my travels I came in contact with a special winter wine called mulled wine. This would be the perfect drink for the winter feast.
Deliver the ingredients for mulled wine.
Perfect, my Liege. Now we have all the ingredients for mulled wine. I will start immediately and prepare the drink.
Lord, I come before you to ask about the tree decorations. It would be really nice to have some golden ornaments.
Produce gold nuggets for decorative ornaments.
Magnificent, Lord. These baubles are really pretty. I thank you for spending your precious time on these tree ornaments. I think this will be a wonderful festival.
The boys and me want to organize a nativity play for the festival. Unfortunately we are missing some crucial resources for the play. Would you be so kind and provide the necessary gear for us?
Prepare the resources for the nativity play.
Thank you, my Liege. Now we can start crafting our costumes for the nativity play.
My Lord, I thought about gingerbread for the feast. The necessary resources may be difficult to get, though.
Deliver the ingredients for gingerbread.
Great, my Liege. I will start baking the gingerbread immediately.
In these times we should not forget those in need. I am therefore collecting money for the poor. It would be really kind of you if you could donate some of the towns taxes for our cause.
Collect enough taxes for the poor.
Thank you for your generous donation, my Liege!
Governor,\nI am sorry to inform you, but I cannot visit your town for the time being.\nThere are bandits in the woods surrounding your town. It is too dangerous for traveling merchants right now.
Many thanks my Liege. Now that the bandits are banished from the area, I will visit your town regularly again.
The church has collapsed, my Liege. In these times, we need all the support we can get. We need another church in town.
Governor, something strange is going on in this town. We suffered seven catastrophes just in this season! We have to find out what is going on here. I am ready to believe that we are cursed.
We should leave the town immediately, my Lord. Everything is lost...We are doomed! The curse will never be lifted.
Find a way to lift the curse.
You saved the town! This is wonderful news. The curse is finally lifted and you even managed to survive the ritual.\n\nThe town will need some time to recover though…
The town needs a steady supply of medicinal herbs as soon as possible, my Lord. Otherwise the plague will be a constant danger in our town.
Produce medicinal herbs.
We will never overcome the plague without building at least one infirmary, my Lord. I would even recommend more.
The doctors in town need more material for bandages, in order to treat the victims of the plague properly. You should send some fabrics to them.
My Lord, the plague has hit the town! Unfortunately, no trader will visit us as long as these disasters are happening…
We need a windmill to process the wheat to flour, my Lord. In these difficult times, we need to adapt our food production, my Liege!
To produce bread, we need to order the construction of a bakery, my Lord.
Now it is time to stock up on bread. We need to feed the town. The last thing we need is a starving population.
My Lord, the livestock... all the animals, and the fish in the river… they are all dying! What is going on here?
The church is on fire, Governor. The Lord has abandoned us! You must help us…
I did some research in the church and found documents that might help us, my Liege.\n\nBut now the church is unsafe to enter and I cannot reach my documents.
Thank you my Liege. Here have a look at these documents. Once there was an ancient cemetery were now our humble town is standing.

There was once a special adviser at court. He was a soothsayer, but he understood pagan magic and such things. He went crazy and tried to poison the King, so he was imprisoned.\n\nI will contact the King. Maybe he lets us talk to the man.
Repair the church.
The king won't help us, we need to take matters in our own hands and free the soothsayer.
My Lord! The townies are in panic! We have to show some military presence to calm them down.
Governor, I will not release this vile and treacherous man from my prison. I don't care about your curse, this man tried to kill me. He will rot in prison.
Goddammit Governor... why do you attack us? I know we robbed you countless times, but this...
We witnessed the curse firsthand, Governor. Us bandits can't rob wealthy merchants when things like that are happening in the neighborhood.\n\nWe will help you get that guy out of prison...

There is a bandit camp near our town, my Lord. Maybe can 'persuade' them to help us free the soothsayer from prison.\n\nThat man must have some answers! Order the attack on that camp, to initiate a small… ahem… 'negotiation'.
What a wonderful victory over the bandits, my Liege. Now let's have a talk with them…\n\nMaybe they help us break the curse.
It seems to be the wrath of heaven, my Lord. The farmers report that we have a drought!
Preparations for the raid on the prison may need some military grade equipment, some proper training grounds and provisions. Let's start with an armory, shall we?
My men need to train for the prison raid, Governor. If you really want to go through with this, we need some place to train.
Build an archery contest ground.
Governor, I think something to eat and drink would be great, at least for the leader of the raid party, ME!
Deliver provisions.
It is time for some equipment, Governor. Those wooden swords and axes we normally use will be useless against the prison guard.
Deliver military equipment.
My Lord, the sun! An eclipse is forming! We have to make haste or we are all doomed!
Great! We are almost ready to get this fella out of prison! Next time we meet you can talk to the guy personally.
Maybe you can convince me by making it worth my while. I haven't tasted any sausages in a long while.

Alright alright. I will help you. That little curse of yours seems to be a really nasty one, but it can be lifted by a simple ritual.\n\nWhy do you even have built your town on top of an ancient cemetery in the first place?
The good news is, the curse can be reversed. But we need some resources which are not easy to come by.\n\nWe need a charged quartz crystal, a potion of timelessness and a lightning rod.
Governor, by coincidence I have 'found' one of these quartzes in one of my raids. Unfortunately my pal ‘Roughneck’ took it when we split our gang.\n\nHe has his own bandit camp in the area.
Acquire the charged quartz from the bandit camp.
Governor, the lightning rod can be built with normal iron bars and some tools.
Build the lightning rod.
My Lord, I can prepare the potion if you can get me the necessary ingredients.
Get the potion ingredients.
Now you have to drink the potion, while holding the lightning rod in your left hand and the charged quartz in your right. Then you have to stand in open ground until a lightning strike hits the rod.
Perform the ritual.
You are the last person I would have expected to free me from prison. Because of YOU I ended up there in the first place.
Well it seems you have some trouble with a curse. And now you want my help?
Lord! A terrible thunderstorm is brewing over our little town. Let's make sure our fire lookout towers are fully alert!
Governor. It is way too dangerous for me to come to your town. But I can make arrangements for you if you can pay the price…

Don’t you think that the soldiers in town waste too many valuable resources? We could easily sell them and make some money on the side. The only thing you have to do is to make sure the quartermaster is distracted somehow.
Unassign the quartermaster from the barracks.
Unassign the carriers from the castle.

Governor, my boys need some undisturbed time at the city walls. You know, they like to be on their own, when “storing” goods outside the walls. It is important that the guards near the wall are somewhere else.
Unassign all soldiers.
I have some small problem with the population in town. You see, we help them with our presence and they do not want to pay for our kind deeds, you know?
Collect protection money.
Governor, unfortunately you did not collect enough money to meet my “expenses” here in town. I need the rest of my money back. How about you “invest” some money yourself?
My faction likes to conduct a little gambling tournament at the tavern tonight, “semi legal”. How about you take care of some good entertainment at the tavern and send over some brew and juice.
My “business-partners” want some appropriate feeding while the gambling tournament lasts. Send over some sausages and bread, so nobody is going to starve, would you?
Deliver sausages and bread.

Governor, I come before you with another bidding. My goons...ehhm..I meant business partners of course, need more means of exerting pressure to do their jobs better. How about you sent over some weapons and armors, okay?
Deliver weapons and armor.
My “business-partners” want some entertainment, Governor. We need a tavern to relax a little.

Welcome Governor. Thank you for spending some time to meet me. I am the representative for the… ehmm… “shady” faction. We can support you in your endeavor to be reelected, but first you need to do some tasks for us.

Governor, you supported us by completing our tasks and now it is our turn to show some appreciation.\n\nYou scratched my back, and now I’ll scratch yours and change the outcome of the election in your favor.
Complete all tasks for the shady faction.
Choose the “shady” faction.
Work with the friends of flowers club.
Work with the guild of merchants.
Choose the military faction.
Select the noblemen faction.

My Lord, you should decide which faction you want to support. After your choice you should concentrate on fulfilling the factions demands. Once convinced to vote in your favor, you can choose a different faction.
Visit the religious faction.
Choose the servant faction.
Visit the small folk.
This town is very bland. One can easily notice that you have no eye for detail and beauty. Why did you not come up with a plan to change this, Governor?
Plant more flowerbeds.
Governor, are you lazy again? Do you not see that all flowers are close to withering? Maybe you should take more care about the wonderful nature around you.
It stinks in town, Governor! This time it is really just your fault. The sewers are clogged and flowing over.\n\nTake care of the situation!
Build more storm drains.
There we have it! Finally the city is presentable and the flowers are blossoming all over and now this! Take a look at the townhouses! They are ruinous at best.

Governor, this is a disgrace!
These roaming animals have eaten a good amount of my most beautiful flowers. How could you let it come to that?

I demand more hunter’s cabins immediately, to remove these creatures from my flowerbeds.
For the state horticultural show, you have to ensure that enough seating possibilities are available. Some benches carefully placed around town should be enough.\n\nSee to it that it is done!
Build benches in town.

Those poor animals, Governor.

The pigs are living in inhuman conditions here in town and cannot roam free like they are supposed to be.

The friends of flowers club demands the destruction of the pig farm and the butcher’s workshop!
Demolish the pig farm and the butcher’s workshop.
Governor, I am the chairwoman of the friends of flowers club. So you demand our support in the coming election. Why isn’t a competent woman like myself elected for Governor of a town like this?
Despite my initial doubts in your competence as a Governor you actually proved to be a true friend to the friends of flowers club.\nWe will vote for you in the election.
Complete all demands of the friends of flowers club.

My Lord, soon a new Governor will be elected in this town.\n\nI recommend we start convincing the factions in this town to vote for you. I don’t think we have enough time to convince all of them, so you should choose carefully who we should support.

The election outcome just came in, my Lord.

I fear I have to tell you, that we did not manage to get enough votes from the factions in town.

We have to clear the castle before next week, when the new Governor will take over our offices…
My Lord, we managed to convince enough factions in town to vote for us. Our mandate in this town is secured.\n\nLet’s toast to several more years in this office.
Lord Governor, there is not much time until the election begins. We have to make haste and convince enough factions to vote for you.
Remaining time:
Convince a minimum of 3 factions to win the election.
My Lord, the guild of merchants is outraged. Our marketplace was demolished and should have been rebuilt a long time ago.

What an outrage! The carrier Townies stored too many goods in the trade guild building. It has collapsed! How can we manage any trade when things like that happen all the time.\n\nPlease rebuild the trade guild.
Rebuild the trade guild.
Wonderful, my Liege. Now we can finally commence trading again. Would you kindly set up a trade order at the trade guild? This should push our town back to its rightful place in the region.
Have an active trade order at the trade guild.
Money! Everything is always about the money, Governor. It is our highest priority to ensure that enough profit is made by trading.\n\nLet’s make some money, Governor!
The free space at our marketplace is getting filled up pretty fast, Governor. You should contemplate to upgrade the marketplace so we have more space and can trade more efficiently.
Upgrade the marketplace.
Many Townies ask for small market stalls dispersed over the town, Governor. This way we could increase the inner-city trade. A pretty good idea, is it?
Place market stalls in town.
I have made a very profitable trade contract available, Governor. The prices for clothes and brew have increased vastly!\n\nI can smell coin! Lot’s of coin!
Sell clothes and brew at the marketplace.
Governor, I am the representative of the guild of merchants. To receive the vote of the guild for the coming election, you need to improve the trade situation in town considerably.

A great day for trade, my Lord.

You managed to push this town to be the greatest trading center in the region. For this, the merchants of the guild are forever grateful to you. 

As thanks we will vote for you in the upcoming election.
Complete all tasks for the guild of merchants.

Unacceptable! Absolutely unacceptable!

How should we supply our guard towers when we do not even have a barracks in town.
Build a barracks.
Finally a Governor that knows how to tackle things. Well, it would be advisable if you assigned some soldiers to the guard towers.
As a commanding officer I find it impossible to organize our forces and find some time for rest after combat. My war-ridden body lingers for some comfortable officers tents.
Build some officer’s tents.
Governor, our forces are still not large enough. Every third class bandit will be laughing so hard that he soils his pants when he's facing our pathetic army.
We need provisions for the army, Governor. The best provisions are sausages. The have a high durability and can be easily eaten in the field.
How should our brave soldiers train for the coming battles when there is no place to do so, Governor? As commander of the armed forces I demand that you construct an archery contest ground.
Welcome Governor. You seek the support of the military faction in the coming election.\n\nWell, there is much to do in order to convince us to vote for you.
Many thanks, Governor. You make us simple soldiers proud with your deeds. Never has the military in this city stood this tall until you became our Governor. You earned our vote in the election.
Complete all tasks for the military faction.
No major town can offer only limited drinks for their citizens, my Lord. Especially us nobles want something extravagant like grape juice.
The nobles celebrate the completion of your newest production chain, my Lord.\n\nFor the celebrations, we just need a large amount of grape juice. But please, not the cheap swill…
My Lord, you do not suggest that we go to the tavern like the common lowlifes. The tournament site outside the city walls is derelict for years.
A big hero for the nobles has died, my Lord. If you would build him a monument and a respectable resting place, you would make a lot of nobles in this town happy.
Build a mausoleum and a hero statue.
My Lord, this town is missing some valuable property for the nobles. One cannot display enough how high ones status is by showing some valuable jewelry, my Liege.\n
Wonderful, my Liege. The demand for jewelry is very high at the moment. Since everybody wants the jewels worn by the people at court.
How splendid to finally meet you, my Liege. I represent the faction of the nobles in your city. When you want to earn our vote for the coming election, you have to fulfill our extravagant demands.

You actually met all the demands of the nobles, my Liege. In your town a noble has all the privileges one has at the Kings court. You did great things in this town!\nYou got our vote for the coming election.
Complete all demands of the noblemen.
Our religious community is constantly shrinking. The population spends their time drinking or partying. This has to end.\n\nThat sinful tavern is to blame. You have to demolish it!
Very well! This blasphemous construct should have been demolished months ago. At last somebody had the courage to do so.
Demolish the tavern.
Our church cannot withstand the rush of all the new believers. Ever since the tavern was demolished, the church is way too overcrowded.
Praise the Lord, what a glorious new church. You have been godsent, steward.
Upgrade the church or build a new one.
Our religious community is still unsatisfied with the towns offer of religion. The population needs to be more satisfied with religion!
You did it, steward. My faith in you was not misplaced. You made the religious community happy again.
My fellow friars complain about the lacking production of hops in town. Us monks cannot produce brew without the necessary amount of hops.
Build an oast house.
Now that the production of hops is increasing again, you should consider increasing the output of brew.\n\nUpgrade the monastery. Alternatively you could construct a new monastery.
The new monastery radiates in the shine of our Lord. Well done, Governor.
Upgrade the monastery or build a new one.
For the inauguration festivities of the new monastery, we should produce a good amount of brew. Our guests will be thirsty.
The brewing process is complete, Governor. Do you want to have the honor and take the first sip?
The town cemetery is way too small and has insufficient place for graves. You need to order the construction of several new mausoleums and grave sites.
Enlarge the cemetery: Construct mausoleums and graves.
The enlargement of the graveyard should include the construction of new graveyard walls. You should order the construction of new walls to clearly mark the cemetery grounds.
Build new graveyard walls.
Welcome Governor. Us monks of the religious faction could support you in the upcoming election, when you fulfill our demands.
Praise the Lord, Governor. You completely fulfilled all our demands. You absolutely earned a place in heaven and the vote of the religious faction shall be yours.
Complete all tasks for the religious faction.
My Lord, the firemen have only limited possibilities to fight erupting fires in town. It would help tremendously, when we would have more fire lookout towers at our disposal.
Some members of the servant faction would love to have a juggler camp in town. This would ensure that even we have something to laugh about.
Honorable Governor, us transport Townies are really overworked with all those transporting tasks here in town. It would really help us, if you would order the construction of more warehouses.
My Lord, the carpenters complain about their clothes. The repair duties around town result in a high wear and tear of their clothing. They really need new clothes.
Deliver clothes.
My Lord, our carrier Townies need new shoes. There is no need for you to craft new shoes, we can do this on our own.\n\nWe just need leather and fabrics.
Deliver fabrics and leather.
My Lord, a little donation to our faction of servants would insure that we are completely convinced that you are the most benevolent Governor of all times.
Donate coin to the servants.

Lord Governor, the tax collector could really use a day off. He is not the youngest anymore and besides that his bones are aching.\n\nYou can manage to collect the taxes on your own for some time, don't you?
Unassign the tax collector and collect taxes.

My Lord, I am the representative of the servant faction in your town.\n\nWe serve as carriers, firemen, carpenters and tax collectors. Since we got a vote in the election, you could “earn” it by making our lives a little bit more comfortable.

You did great things for us servants, my Lord. From now on golden times start for us servants. We would never have imagined, that you would really improve our lives in town.\n\nYou got our vote in the election!
Complete all tasks of the servant faction.
My Lord! The plague is spreading in town. Please, you have to help us! My kids are in the affected district and we do not have an infirmary in town.
Lord Governor, the food supply in town is inadequate. The farmers report that we are missing essential buildings. You should order the construction of a new farm and a bakery.
Build a farm and a bakery.

My Lord, us small people do not have much to laugh about and our daily routine is exhausting. It would be really nice to have a place where we can forget our sorrows. A fairground would be the right place.
My Lord, most of the population is living in poverty. You could raise your renown by giving some of the taxes back to the people.
Give some of the taxes back to the people.
Now that we have the necessary infrastructure, we should present a higher diversity in food to the population. Most of the Townies living in poverty don’t have meat for supper. You could change this.
Deliver meat.
My Lord, we harvest the wheat, mill it and bake the bread. However, we rarely see our bread on our own plates to eat it.
Deliver bread.
My Lord, you almost have our complete approval. The last thing you need to do is to make everyone in town more happy. We will thank you by being more productive.
Be welcome, Governor. As the miller I am the voice of the small folk of farmers. If you can make our lives in the town easier, we will give you our vote in the election.

You truly are a man of the people, my Lord. You did help the small folk a lot by completing our tasks. Now our lives in your town have become a lot easier. Thank you my Lord.\n\nYou can count on us voting for you in the election.
Complete all tasks for the farmers.
My Lord, our economy cannot support the carpenter. We do not have the necessary resources. You should unassign the carpenter from his building for now.
Unassign the carpenter.
We do not produce enough food, my Lord. It would be recommended to build some more fisherman’s huts.
Before we choose one of the town factions, you should order the construction of a sawmill. It is essential for the advancement of the towns economy, my Lord.

My good steward, my daughter is going to marry Prince William Clemens III of Giebelstadt. I want you to handle all the preparations for this important occasion. You don't have much time to waste, so make haste. I am putting my full trust in you!
Make preparations for the grand wedding by completing all tasks!
Thank you for your great work! You did a fantastic job, the wedding can now commence! And you are invited, of course!
The bandits will start an attack soon, we should be prepared. Man the guard towers.
A bandit attack is imminent!
My Lord, the economy of the town is in shambles because of constant bandit attacks. I hope we can sustain the siege.
Excellent work, my Lord! You handled the siege pretty well and even managed to build up the economy. Even the knight seems very impressed.
Establish an infrastructure while defending the town.
Just a Governor and his adviser? That is not the help I was hoping for. I don‘t think you will be such a help defending against the bandits. Everyone else to arms!
The attacking wave of bandits was repelled. Now we can rest a little bit, until our scouts detect another attack.
We need more guard towers to defend the town. Construct them immediately!
Governor, how about you make yourself useful and give the order to build more guard towers?
Our barracks has collapsed, we should build new one. I think this is a job you can handle, Governor.
I suggest we send out a messenger to the King, my Lord. But we will need a disguise. Let’s start with some fabrics.
Now we require some leather for the disguise. So it is looking more like the bandit‘s clothes.
Deliver leather.
For the beard we will use some wool. I hope this will increase the chances of the messenger reaching the King.
Deliver wool.
We can‘t just sit around and wait for support from the King. The armors of the town guard are in bad condition, we have to produce new ones to ensure the defense of the town.
Oh no, my Lord. They destroyed our barracks. We should rebuild it, to provide our soldiers with supplies.
Rebuild the barracks.
The bandits are preparing for a heavy assault on our barracks. The barracks is essential, it shall not be destroyed!
Defend the barracks.
The King‘s army hasn‘t arrived yet. We cannot wait any longer. For that we require the sharpest blades we can craft or the town will fall.
Governor, the southeastern bandit camp is blocking the road to other towns. If we want more townies helping us, we need to destroy that camp in the southeast.
The bandit camp has been destroyed! More townies can now assist us.
Destroy the southeastern bandit camp.
We managed to locate the merchant, my Lord. He is imprisoned at the camp near the river in the northwest.
My Lord, the merchant is safe again. From now on he will visit us regularly again.
Destroy the northwestern bandit camp.
My Lord, the bandits equip themselves with tinder from the camp in the northeastern mountains. If we destroy it, they won‘t be able to set our buildings on fire anymore.
Destroy the northeastern bandit camp.
The main bandit camp is located in the southwest. Let us finally destroy it and we will force the bandits to surrender. Charge!
Destroy the southwestern bandit camp.

What a rude knight. My Lord, the economy in this town is basically devastated. When our soldiers have repelled the first waves of bandits, we should concentrate on ordering the population to produce some basic resources.
Produce planks.
Very well my Lord. We should start rebuilding the farm, because we are running low on food.
Now we can produce bread again. But we should keep an eye on the attacking bandits and draft the population to be soldiers, when it‘s necessary.
Produce bread.
My Governor, we could increase the soldiers efficiency when we provide them with brew.
We can increase the soldiers combat power even more, my Lord. All we need now are some sausages.
Working and fighting all day long is making us very tired. Can we have a little break, my Lord? It would be great if the whole town would get a day off.
Have no townie assigned to a job.
Avalanche risk: High
Avalanche risk: Moderate
Avalanche risk: Zero

Amount of armories currently in town. Here armors and weapons are crafted.

Percentage of defense buildings that are supplied with provisions by a barracks or other provisions buildings.
Percentage of the guard towers that are supplied with provisions by barracks
The amount of barracks present in town
Amount of butchers workshops currently in town. Sausages for the soldiers are crafted there.
Protected buildings
Buildings that are in the sphere of influence of a defense building. The town guard will defend the area.
Buildings that are in the sphere of influence of a guard tower. The town guard will defend the town here.
Amount of guard posts in the village.
Protection by town guard
Guard tower coverage
Percentage of town buildings that are protected by defense buildings.
Percentage of town buildings that are protected by guard towers
Amount of guard towers in the village.
Amount of military castles in the village.
Amount of monastery brewery currently in town. Here brew is crafted.
Supplied defense buildings
Supplied guard towers
Defense buildings that are in the sphere of influence of a provisions building like the barracks.
Guard towers that are in the sphere of influence of a barracks. These towers are supplied with provisions.
Unprotected buildings
Buildings that are not in the sphere of influence of a defense building. These buildings are not defended by the town guard.
Buildings that are not in the sphere of influence of a guard tower. These buildings are not defended by the town guard.
Unsupplied defense buildings
Unsupplied guard towers
Defense buildings that are not in the sphere of influence of a provisions building like the barracks. They are NOT supplied with provisions.
Guard towers that are not in the sphere of influence of a barracks. These towers are NOT supplied with provisions.
Bonus combat power
Additional combat bonuses are granted to the soldiers by supplying them with provisions. They improve hit chance, block chance and the initiative value, which determine who attacks first.
Roaming bandits
Amount of bandits currently present on the map
Soldiers
Available soldiers
Combat ready soldiers in town
Soldiers in combat
Soldiers who are currently taking part in combat or are on their way to a battle
Incapacitated soldiers
Soldiers in town who currently cannot take part in any combat actions
Total amount of soldiers in town
Soldier capacity
Total capacity for soldiers in defense buildings all over the town
Total room for soldiers in guard towers all over the town
Quartermasters
Amount of quartermasters in provisions buildings like the barracks. They transport provisions to defense buildings in the area.
Amount of quartermasters in barracks. They transport provisions to guard towers.
Provisions improve hit chance, block chance and the initiative value, which determine who attacks first.

Armor gives a large bonus on block chance and a small bonus on initiative in combat.
Brew gives soldiers a bonus on hit chance, block chance and initiative in combat.
Sausages give soldiers a bonus on hit chance, block chance and initiative in combat.
Weapons give a large bonus on hit chance and a small bonus on initiative in combat.

Statistics
Stock
The desire for new clothes can only be satisfied with a marketplace and with enough clothes in stock. The marketplace will take care of the distribution of the goods.
The villagers want to live in houses that are well-kept. Only the townhouses count into this desire.

Townies love to look at decorations in their free time. The more splendid the decorations are, the happier the Townies will be. The effect of decorations decreases with an increasing population, so more objects are necessary to have the same effect on the town.

Desires are divided into several categories. Each fulfilled desire adds to the general desire satisfaction in town. If 6 out of 8 desires are fulfilled, 100% desire satisfaction is achieved. This means that not all categories have to be satisfied.

The desire for entertainment in town can be satisfied by several buildings. Each of the buildings can only satisfy a certain amount of Townies. The satisfaction value is determined by the building condition and the capacity.
Amount of stored fish. To produce fish, a fishing lodge at a river or lake is needed.
Supplying the town with enough food for everybody will satisfy them. Food can be fish, meat or bread.
General happiness
The happiness value is the sum of all needs and desires. Both factors account for half of the happiness score.
The higher the satisfaction with decorations, the greater the income of an inn.
Income per Intervall
Inns
Number of Inns in the village
The Inn offers a regular income depending on the condition of the building and the current decoration satisfaction.
Estimation of Inn revenue
Estimation of revenue per minute for all Inns
Income increase
Estimated revenue per minute for all inns. Depending on the upgrade level of the inns, their condition and decoration satisfaction.
There are no influences active at the moment!
The desire for jewelry can only be satisfied with a marketplace and with enough jewelry in stock. The marketplace will take care of the distribution of the goods to the Townettes.

Having a marketplace in town, increases the happiness of the town, depending on the number of villagers in town and the condition of the building. Public buildings have a limited capacity for villagers. If the building is full, the satisfaction decreases.
Amount of stored meat. To produce meat, either a hunting lodge is needed or a pig farm with a butcher’s workshop.
The basic needs of your Townies are food and water. These values have the biggest impact on happiness and productivity.
If the happiness in town is low, the villagers become less productive. Base productivity levels can drop by up to 50%.
Having churches in town satisfies this desire. Each of the buildings can only satisfy a certain amount of Townies. The satisfaction value is determined by the building condition and its capacity.
If the happiness in town is low, chances are that the villagers will go on a strike. They will stop working for a limited amount of time to show that something has to change in the village.

The overall community satisfaction is divided into several factors. The building condition and capacity makes up one half of the desire and the amount of available drinks contributes to the other half of the desire. At the tavern for instance, brew and juice are served to the villagers.

The tavern satisfaction is divided into several factors. The building condition and capacity makes up one half of the desire and the amount of available drinks contributes to the other half of the desire. At the tavern, brew and juice are served to the villagers.

A higher tax rate increases the number of coins received per townhouse, but it has a direct impact on the happiness. Satisfying more desires allows increasing taxation without having to fear the consequences.
Active tax collectors
Tax collectors go to the townhouses and speed up the collection of taxes.
Estimation of tax revenue
Estimation of taxes per minute for the townhouses\n
Treasuries
Having a treasury in town will speed up the collection of taxes.
Dispose
Supplying the town with enough water satisfies the villagers. Each well can only supply a limited amount of townies.
Wells in town

Do you want to put out all fires for {PRICE} Prestige?

Research „Public buildings level 2“ to unlock upgrades for all buildings from that category!
Upgrade the treasury to get access to the „Collect All Taxes“ feature!
Upgrade the infirmary to get access to the „Cure All Townies“ feature!
Upgrade the fire lookout tower to get access to the „Extinguish All Fires“ feature!
Upgrade the carpenter to get access to the „Repair All“ feature!

Sometimes there are events that have an effect on the productivity of buildings. This can be an increased productivity of farms after rainfall, but can also be as a result of a decision you made, such as reduced productivity after a failed task.
Trader is not available!
Wish for clothing
Starvation
