In the warehouses tab, resources can be disposed of, in order to free up space in the warehouse quickly.
Townhouse capacity

Congratulations!\nYou've reached the maximum city level and unlocked the latest research opportunities. We hope you will continue enjoying Townsmen. Here is some more Prestige for you, as a token of our gratitude!
Confirm trade?
Set up trade order
Trade amount
We need a functioning forester's hut in town, my Liege. Wood is essential for construction sites and processing wood into planks.
You should assign a free worker to the forester's hut.
This is the castle and our home, my Liege. It is also the main warehouse of the town.
Well, this concludes our little tour. I am looking forward to working with you, my Liege.
You have to claim your quest reward in order to continue.
Press {KEYBOARD_INGAME_MENU_QUESTS} to open the quest log directly. Here you can claim quest rewards.
To claim your reward, visit the quests tab in the game menu.
Select the game menu, then the quests tab to reach your reward.
A free Townie will now walk to the construction site and deliver the resources.
Up to two workers can construct buildings. They transport the necessary resources from a warehouse to the construction site.
Construction sites can be placed even when the necessary resources are not in the warehouse stock.
Calm down, son. There are some unneeded workers at the castle. I’ve seen them lingering around.
Maybe our new Governor would like to do us the honor of instructing one of them to quit his job at the castle.
Unassign a worker from the castle.
In the build menu, you get an overview of all buildings, roads and decorations available for construction.
When your task is to construct a building, the category and the building are marked in the build menu.
Use the build menu to construct a townhouse. Press here or use {KEYBOARD_BUILD_MENU} to open the build menu.
In the build menu, you get an overview of all buildings, roads and decorations available for construction.
Open up the build menu and select the townhouse.
Here you can see our fishing lodge. At the moment it is the only source for food since the mill burned down. Maybe your Lordship could change that soon.
Great…I hate fish...
To continue, claim your reward in the quest screen.

Good to see that we aren't greeted with pitchforks and torches, My Lord. After the escapade at the King's court, we can be glad that we were only transferred here and not be thrown into the dungeon, my Liege.
This is our town’s well. It is a little old and it holds just enough water for the town, but if more villagers move into town, we will have to build a new one soon.
Misses Fitz-Givens! Woodrow, the lumberjack, finally had enough. He said he cannot work in a derelict building like that anymore. He left town and now his forester's hut is vacant. What do we do now?
Welcome to our humble little village, governor! I hope you had a pleasant voyage. I am the housekeeper of the castle, Misses Fitz-Givens. It is a pleasure to meet you, my Liege.
Congratulations!\nYou just had your first level up.  Each time you reach a new level, you can research new improvements for all of your towns.
Each level up new research possibilities are unlocked. In the research menu they can be researched.
Follow the instructions of the housekeeper.
What a wonderful day to take a tour around town, while your servant unpacks your luggage, Governor. Here, let me show you the most important parts of the town.
Look, there is someone with a request.\n\nMaybe there is something to do for you, My Lord.
My Lord. Do not overwork yourself on the first day on the job! Besides, dinner is served in the castle. You should call it a day and eat something.
Complete all tasks.
Objects like this tree can block your constructions.
My Lord, I noticed you have earned some Prestige recently. Sometimes you earn Prestige for certain tasks. It helps us a lot while building up our town and can be seen as a currency for favors.
Prestige can be used for building upgrades, building special decorations or to instantly complete a construction site.
Right click on a building opens the quick menu. Then select the desired option.
Longpress on the building to open the quick menu. Then select the desired option.
Some building options, like repairing or assigning workers, can be easily accessed via the quick menu.
While over a building, hold the ‘accept’ button and move the left stick in the desired direction and let go.
While over a building, hold the right mouse button, move to the desired direction and let go.

My Lord, it would be recommended to repair the forester's hut. The more a building decays, the more its productivity will decrease. It can even collapse or a fire can break out when it is not being repaired from time to time.
Very good, my Liege. It is wise to have an eye on the buildings around town. In most cases, you can detect a derelict building by its brownish facade.
Repair the derelict building.
Well, until recently this was where our windmill stood when it was hit by lightning and burned down. Maybe we should build a fire lookout tower to prevent something like that happening again.
Great, this backwater town is a deathtrap...
A sawmill should be built, my Liege. It processes wood into planks, which are used in constructions around town.
Very good, Governor. The sawmill is an important prerequisite for other advanced constructions.
My Liege, we need more workers in order to run all buildings properly. Villagers will only come to town, if we build more townhouses for them.
Splendid, my Liege. Having enough workers in town is very important for our economy.
I am no simple servant! I am the Lord's adviser and help him with his daily tasks.
Whatever…
To set a worker free, select the “sleep” symbol.
Assign a worker to the building.
If you would build a bakery, we could start processing the flour into bread, My Lord.
Very good, my Liege. Now our bread production chain is finished. Food won't be an issue for a while. And we have time to prepare the town for the winter.
When a building stock is full, the production in that building stops until there is room to store goods again, my Liege.
When a building stock is full, the production in that building stops until there is room to store goods again.
When many building stocks are overloaded, more carriers should be assigned at the castle or warehouses, to avoid whole production chains coming to a halt.
To speed up a construction process, you could order a second worker to help building it, my Liege.
Unassign the worker from the building.
Use the delete mode to clear the area of trees and blocking objects.
The bakery should be placed near the farm and the windmill, my Liege.
Delete blocking objects with the erase mode.
Delete the object
My Lord, we don’t have any more free workers. You should consider building a new townhouse.
With every new townhouse we get more workers for the village.
For the construction, you can also unassign a worker from another building and quickly assign him to the construction site.
Additionally, it is possible to use Prestige to quickly finish a building. This can be done in the context menu of the construction site.
Rise and shine, My Lord. You cannot stay in bed all day.
You have a guest. A nobleman has arrived at the castle. He said you two know each other from the King’s court and demands an audience.
Set up the food supply.
My Lord, we do not have enough food in our town. Our single fisherman will not be able to feed the whole town in winter. I recommend starting the production of bread.
Good job, My Lord. The town is prepared for the winter. The villagers will be happy to hear about this.\n\nCome with me, Misses Fitz-Givens has prepared a feast in your honor, my Liege.
Produce enough food for the upcoming winter.
Good morning, Governor! Do you remember me? We met once at the King's court...
Do the villagers here in town know that you got banned from the court? I think they would be greatly disappointed if they found out, wouldn't they be?
That's what I thought!
Well...Your escapade at the court will be our little secret. For now. Good day, Governor.
My Lord! If the villagers ever find out what you are accused of, they will certainly have us thrown into the dungeons…
I know, My lord… We didn't take the money. The charges were all false, but no one except us and the nobleman knows this.
This man could blackmail us. We should tread carefully...
An overview of all current tasks is available in the "quests" tab in the menu. There, rewards for completed tasks can also be claimed.
A detailed overview of the resources stored in town is available in the "warehouse" area of the menu.
There are some more villagers with requests waiting for you in the audience chamber, My Lord. I believe they want to talk to you about the food supply in town.
The farmer is very glad that you have built a windmill and sends you his regards. He left some goods for you.

My Lord, I am the local farmer. The farm at the foot of this hill is mine. Since the windmill burned down last season, my wheat doesn't get processed at all. I would be utterly grateful if my windmill could be rebuilt.
Very good, my Liege. Now we can process the wheat into something more edible. The flour could be processed into bread at a bakery.
The windmill produces flour out of wheat. It is always useful to have several farmers supplying one windmill.
My Lord, we need stone for the construction of some advanced buildings.\n\nYou should consider assigning a worker to the mine. This way we can produce the necessary resources ourselves.
Splendid, my Liege. The more desires you fulfill, the more willing your Townies are to pay higher taxes without having to fear a rebellion.
Our villagers have the desire for clothes to wear, my Liege.\n\nYou should order the construction of a tailor. The tailor can then produce clothes out of fabrics.
Very good, my Liege. Now we satisfy the villager's desire for clothing. Clothes are acquired at the marketplace by the villagers.
Attain a high satisfaction with clothes.
My Lord, the treasury is almost empty. You have to do something or our solvency is at risk!\n\nWithout coin we won't be able to carry out our tasks and the city won't be able to keep growing.
Our villagers have more needs than the basic need for food and water, my Lord.
They also have other desires, such as having new clothes to wear, a nicely decorated town or a marketplace to buy some goods.
The villagers have some requests. New clothes and a marketplace are on top of the list.
Fulfill the task of the maiden.
Fulfill the task of the merchant.
Complete the matter of the nobleman.

My Lord, you have been very diligent. The town is growing steadily and we even have enough clothes for the winter. I can see that we now have a talented and caring Governor. \n\nI have prepared a feast in your honor, my Liege. Follow me.
Fulfill the villager’s requests.
Make profit by trading.
Select the placeholder construction site and build a marketplace there.
Public buildings such as the marketplace, or even our well, can only supply a limited amount of villagers.
In the build menu or the building’s context menu you can see how many families fit into a public building.

To trade, visit the ingame menu and then the tab for stock. There is a sub category called trade. Trading is only possible when a merchant is in the village. The merchant cart is visible in front of the castle.
To trade, visit the ingame menu and then the tab for stock. There is a sub category called trade.
Alternatively, you can also trade by visiting the context menu of the market building itself, when a merchant is in the village.
My Lord, I am the local merchant. Just like the lovely maiden before me, I have a request.\n\nOur town needs a marketplace. It would allow you...and myself… to buy or sell resources.
It seems our villagers want some new clothes. A marketplace would allow you to buy clothes. You wouldn't need to produce them yourself, My Lord.
Accept the resources.
My Lord, I took the liberty of buying a small patch of land and laying the foundation for a new marketplace.\n\nWould you be so kind as to order a worker to complete the construction.
At the marketplace, we can distribute luxury goods from our warehouses. By doing so, we can satisfy the desires of the wealthy townies, my Lord.

It is no secret that the town's treasury is pretty dried up, but since I want to see this town flourish, I will upfront the costs for the construction of the marketplace.\n\nConsider this an investment in the future of our beloved town.
Here you can see how long a merchant is in the village to trade with you.
My Lord, to produce wool, you should send an additional worker to my farm to work as a shepherd. I am preoccupied with the wheat harvest, so I need someone to help me out with the sheep.
Splendid, my Liege. Now we can harvest wool in addition to wheat.
Assign a shepherd to the farm.
Now, with a weaving mill in town, all that stands in our way of producing clothes is a missing tailor shop, My Lord.
Very good, My Lord. Now we can begin the production of clothes. The villagers will be delighted! Our very own clothing industry.

Governor! I have been thinking of your puny little town and your miserable existence a lot lately. I came to the conclusion that if you don't want me to speak about the loss of your lord's title, you should make it worth my while.\n\nThe price for my silence are regular payments of some coin; the first one is due now!
You made me wait way too long! Time is over. Will you pay me now, or should I call the guards?
… finally he is gone.
My Lord, we have to think about how we will handle this foe in the future. He will keep coming back and blackmail us again and again.
Maybe we should try to redeem ourselves again and prove that we had nothing to do with the theft of the national treasury of the King.
Tribute payment
My Lord, if you decide to produce the clothes in town, we need a weaving mill to produce fabric out of wool.
Excellent, my Liege. I see that the construction of the weaving mill has been finished. Now the fabric production can begin.\n

Good day, My Lord!

I have a special inquiry from the townsfolk. Some wealthy villagers yearn for better clothes, to distinguish themselves from the common folk.

Would you be so kind as to make clothes available at the marketplace?
Here, throw the bottle at the building for good luck, my Liege...
Do you hear that noise? What could it be…
Are you alright, My Lord?! That was an avalanche! At least our tavern is still standi…

My Liege, the normal wood fires in the castle cannot keep the large building warm. With coal, we could not only heat our homes, but you could also process it into ore and iron bars. \n\nWould you be so kind as to construct a charcoal burner's hut?
Coal is mainly used in the production of iron and gold bars. Would you be so kind as to build a charcoal burner's hut, so that we can produce coal out of wood?
It would be wise to increase our production of wood since the additional production of charcoal will consume a lot of our wood supplies.
My Lord, we have to hold out this winter until spring is here.
Thank god! This nasty winter is finally over. Soon we can plant crops again, my Liege!
Hold on until spring.
The building has been consumed by the flames, my Liege.
Fire! My Lord! There is a fire! \n\nYou have to do something! Why don't we have a fire tower in town?
Thank you so much, my Liege. You are a true savior.
Lord, we ran out of food. It is especially difficult to feed your villagers in winter.
Rebuild the tavern.
Hold on until spring.
My Lord. You have brought the town through this incredibly hard winter. The Townies are preparing a little festivity for you in spring.
Make it through the winter.
Our stone mine was destroyed by the avalanche, but there is an iron ore deposit in the east of town. It looks like a good location for a new mine.

Very good, my Liege. In addition to iron ore, this mine can also mine stones. After the construction the worker will immediately start to mine ore. But you can also give him the order to mine stones.\n
Build a mine on the ore deposit in the east of town.
...damn... our new tavern...that didn't go as planned...!?!
In order to rebuild the tavern, we need tools. Unfortunately, our tool supply got completely used up for the construction of the old tavern.
My Liege, finally we can rebuild the tavern. This will increase the overall happiness of the villagers immensely.

Splendid, my Liege. Our town finally has a tavern again and the villagers can enjoy themselves here after work. \n\nOf course, the tavern would be a lot more efficient if it was supplied with drinks like brew or juice. But it is winter, so we cannot produce brew or juice ourselves. But we could buy the resources at the market.

Of course, the tavern would be a lot more efficient if it was supplied with drinks like brew or juice. But it is winter and we are unable to grow neither grapes nor hops. But we can buy those at the market.
Now that we can produce coal, we could use a toolsmither's workshop, my Liege. Then we can produce our own tools and would be more independent.
Wonderful! Now our production chain for tools is complete.
My Liege! A townhouse was destroyed by the avalanche. We should rebuild it soon before our villagers leave the town.
Very good, my Liege. Now we can devote ourselves to the reconstruction of the tavern.
Build a small or large townhouse.
My Lord, my family is freezing. We need better clothes. Would you be so kind and send some clothes to my house?
I see you have enough clothes for us in stock. Here, we have collected some tools and coins we saved for moments like this. I thank you.
What a nice day, my Liege. A little cold but quite nice. Finally, the construction of the new tavern is finished. Let us go to the inauguration ceremony.
My Lord, we should have somebody to follow and spy on that man! He is highly suspicious.
Why are you looking at me in such a strange way, My Lord?
...Oh please… not me again, my Lord! Could I at least have some kind of disguise this time?
What is that? An animal costume? I’m not wearing that… this is disgusting…
My Lord! Without an armory, we cannot produce any weapons or armor. You should order the construction of an armory as soon as possible.
My Lord, scouts are reporting that bandits are roaming the area. We should be cautious, they might attack the town…
Did you really think I would not detect your stupid spy in that ugly costume, Governor?
From now on, I will visit your town from time to time. Let’s see if you got some wares to spare…
Very good, my Liege. Now the carpenter will take care of all damaged buildings, as long as there are enough resources available.
The King has sent a special representative to your town to investigate the robbery in the capital's treasury. You are now the prime suspect.
The King’s representatives will arrive shortly.
To assign the geologist to the mine, select the magnifying glass.
My Lord, I could craft some weed camouflage for the disguise, but I need a herb garden near my farm to do so.
To harvest herbs, a herb garden is necessary. The herbs can be harvested by a farmer. It is recommended to build the herb garden next to a farm.
Build a herb garden.
In order to craft a useful disguise for the advisor, you have to find some leather and some weeds to camouflage him. Some clothes as the first layer would be nice, too.
Craft the disguise.
Governor! I need a better view over the town and the surrounding forests, in case the bandits should attack again. Make haste, this is an order!
Magnificent, Governor. Now I can overlook all of the town and its surroundings.
You should always keep your guard towers manned and supplied by barracks in order to protect the village efficiently.
My Lord! Several suspicious persons have been spotted near the town. It could be bandits!
The Knight demands a good view over the surrounding area. A guard tower should be built. This would ensure that we have at least some guardsmen protecting the town.
We are under attack, my Liege!
Bandits are robbing our buildings, my Lord! We are defenseless…
The town is being attacked by bandits. You have to fight off the attackers. Build more guard towers and assign more soldiers to improve your chances to win.
Fight off the attackers.
Good morning, Governor. I was sent by the King to take you into custody. You have been accused of stealing coins from his majesty, the King. What say you in your defense?
The Governor had nothing to do with this, I swear. We were framed. It must have been somebody else.
Do you really think I will believe this nonsense? A reputable nobleman and brother of the King's sister-in-law reported having seen you and your adviser commit the crime.
We will prove that we are not guilty! Won't we, my Liege?
Silence! I won't listen to any of this. For now, I will set up camp in your village. Do you have any barracks in town which I can use as a command center?
Splendid, Governor. Now my men have a base of operations in your town and you can train your town guard.
We can now focus on solving the issue at hand. The missing gold from the King’s treasury and the defense of this village.
The nobleman is back again, requesting money and wares. You have to solve the issue before things get out of hand!
Find out what the nobleman is doing.
This has been going on for long enough already, my Liege. If we don't take care of that nobleman, the situation will escalate quickly!
The Knight has called for reinforcements, but the town guard has to hold off the attackers until the King's troops arrive.
Governor, I have sent word to the King to get reinforcements. But this will take some time. Until then, we have to defend the village at all costs.
We did it, Governor! The bandit attacks are coming to a stop. They are retreating…
My Liege, the town guard has found the nobleman hiding near the castle. I think he wants to tell you something.
Governor, you have my thanks for defeating the attackers. We were not in any real danger, were we?
Tell us why you were seen meeting with the bandits. NOW!
Alright… I made a mistake a couple of months ago.
I was in a gambling den in the capital, where I first met the Bandit Lord. I did not know who he was until I lost a lot of money in a dice game with him.
Long story short… In the end, I was highly indebted and then he started to blackmail me into stealing the King's gold from the treasury.
And then you accused the Governor of having stolen the gold?
It was easy. The Lord Chamberlain is an old friend of mine and I got the Governor reassigned to this dump here.
Don’t you dare talking like that about our little village. So it was you who framed the noble Governor. Shame on you!
With each day going by, the bandits wanted more and more. In the end, they requested weapons and armors… and I delivered, with the help of your precious Governor.
We have to stop this madness! Finding the camp those bandits are operating from should be our highest priority.
Defend the village.
Hang in there
Handle the situation with the nobleman.
We can only stop these attacks when we build a town guard!
Governor, I have deal you can't refuse! Send me weapons and armor! Quickly!
You scratch my back and I scratch yours, right? I will put in a good word for you with the King’s soldiers. What do you think?
Excellent! Now hand me the goods. I need to deliver them soon!
The nobleman proposed a new deal. He would put in a good word for you with the Kings representative, if you send him a delivery of weapons and armor.
Good day, Governor. What a wonderful day, isn't it?! I would like to remind you that another payment is due, which is for me to keep quiet, of course.
And you should hurry! A group of soldiers is on their way. They are searching for the missing gold from the King’s treasury, Governor! For your sake, I hope they will not find you here.
Now hand it over. I will spend that money very wisely, Governor! Make haste, I don’t have time. I have an important meeting…
How dare you not to pay me, Governor! This will have consequences, I assure you… Now get out of my way, I have an important meeting to attend!
The nobleman is requesting money again. He's threatening us with the arrival of some investigators of the King who are looking for the stolen gold.
Pay the nobleman.
Now the carpenter will repair the damaged buildings, as long as he has sufficient resources, my Liege.
At least the most important buildings in town should be repaired as soon as possible, my Lord.
Very good, my Liege. The carpenter reports all important buildings have been repaired.
Repair the most important buildings in town.
This way we can focus on the upcoming tasks.
My Lord, the winter is over, but the buildings in town have suffered damages due to the harsh conditions.
A lot of the buildings have been damaged by the harsh winter, my Liege. A carpenter could repair the decayed buildings over time.
Alright, My Lord. I have my ‘disguise’ and will follow the nobleman to his meeting. This will take some time. Please be patient.
While the disguised advisor is sneaking after the nobleman, you have to wait until he returns and reports his findings.
The advisor is sneaking after and spying on the nobleman.
...finally, I am back in the town. I was spotted and could barely escape. It was the bandits, My Lord. The nobleman is doing business with the bandits!
The warehouses are full, my Liege. It is recommended to sell or even destroy some goods in order to make room in the warehouses.
Very good, Governor. Now we have some room again. It is important to have free storage capacities in order to keep production flow going.
Make room in the warehouses.
There is no more room in the warehouses!
Formidable, my Liege. The tannery will produce all the necessary leather when supplied with animal skins from a hunter.
In order to produce the armor, we need leather, which we get from of a tannery, My Lord.
Build a tannery and produce leather.
My Lord, bandits have attacked the town! We should take precautions against these scoundrels! We need a town guard.
Pay the tribute before you run out of time.
The capacity of a public building can be increased by upgrading it.
Building upgrades are very powerful. They allow more workers to be assigned to a building, for example.
My Lord, we could search the northern woods, to find the bandit camp.
Just send the necessary resources to the town guard and we are on the way in no time.
It will take some time until we are back, my Lord. Wish us luck!
Should we send a squad of scouts into the southern woods, my Lord? Maybe the bandit camp is somewhere to the south?
Maybe the bandit camp is somewhere to the western woods? Should the town guard assemble a search party?
We haven’t searched the eastern woods for the bandit camp, My Lord. Give the order and the town guard starts immediately with the preparations.
The town guard can start searching for the bandit camp in the forest. They need some supplies and equipment, however, to do so.
Just give us the order, and we are on our way, my Lord.
While the expedition is running, there is not much else to do than wait.
An expedition is currently ongoing…
Finance an expedition into the forests.
Hah! You really got me there… I should have destroyed your village and stolen all the coin from your treasury, too! Damn… Only because of this treacherous nobleman my ruse was revealed!
You scoundrel! You have exploited my gambling addiction to steal from the King. Finally this nightmare is over and the King's gold has been found.
And this noble Governor has brought you down. This is a great day for us, the village and the entire Kingdom.
Look! The King’s army has finally arrived!
Make room! Make room for your King! Get out of the way, the King wants to get through…
Good day, gentlemen. I can see, my men and I have arrived at the nick of time to see you being victorious against the bandits.
You are Grimlock Redbeard, aren’t you? The most notorious bandit of the Kingdom has been finally caught.
Yes, that's me, your Grace. This Governor here has caught me.
A true hero you are, Governor. I heard you were accused of stealing gold from my treasury and lost your title as Lord. Is this true?
He is not guilty, your Grace. It was me who stole the coin. I was blackmailed by Redbeard. I am truly sorry!
Very well. Throw these two into the dungeon. The Governor and I have to discuss the future of the Kingdom...
My Lord, our men have returned. Unfortunately they have not found the bandit camp.
Lord, there are several severe problems in the village. We should take care of them immediately!
Firstly, the happiness in town is very low. I suggest you start satisfying the desires of the villagers.
Secondly, My Lord, us soldiers of the town guard have almost no provisions and equipment. In order to defend the town, we need more provisions, Lord.
Our utmost priority should be finding that bandit camp. If we find it, we can destroy it, my Lord.
Find the bandit camp.
Supply the troops.
Make the villagers happy again.
Defend your town until you have located the bandit camp. Take care of the villagers happiness and supply the town guard with provisions.
My Lord, these attacks have been going on like this for several days now. I don’t think we can hold on for much longer.
We only have one hope, Governor. The bandit’s lair has to be found as soon as possible. Then we need to destroy it and end this nightmare once and for all.
You, Nobleman! Tell us where exactly you met with the bandits? Give us the location of the bandit camp NOW!
I don’t know. You have to believe me. They blindfolded me and lead through the woods. It has to be close by, I’m sure.
My Lord! Our scouts have located the bandit camp!
Fulfill all tasks and defeat the bandits.
My men are exhausted. The continuous fighting over the last days is taking its toll.
We are lacking the basic provisions, My Lord. Only with the right goods we can fight efficiently.
It is recommended to have enough provisions for the valiant guardsmen in stock, my Lord.
This means weapons and armor, as well as sausages and brew.
Brew makes our troops braver and sausages fill their bellies before the battle.

Soldiers of the town guard fight more effectively, when supplied with provisions. Weapons and armor give a large bonus on attack and defense, while brew and sausages give a large bonus on initiative and a small bonus on attack and defense.
Supply the town guard with provisions
My Lord, having a monastery brewery would give us the chance to produce brew. That would not only improve our soldiers performance in combat.
We could supply our tavern with brew as well. This way every villager visiting the tavern will be much more satisfied, since there are drinks available.
Visit the taxes section of the game menu to change the tax rate!
Open the game menu to go to the Happiness tab. There you will find the subcategory "Taxes".
Use the erase mode to remove small objects that are blocking your construction projects.
Press the hotkey {KEYBOARD_ERASE_MODE} to switch to the erase mode. Or simply click the wrecking ball in the toolbar.
Select the erase mode and swipe over objects you want to delete.
When you have to wait for something, use fast forward to speed up time in the game.
We don't have time, Lord. You should use some Prestige to finish the fire watch tower immediately.
The taxes in town are connected to the houses. In certain intervals the villagers houses produce tax income, that are automatically transferred to the city coffers.
Each house supplies the village with new families and, depending on the tax rate, generates coins periodically.
Visit the warehouse section of the game menu.

Governor, I'm sorry, but there's a snowstorm approaching the town. As long as there is a storm, traders will not be able to reach the village. But they will visit your village again as soon as the weather improves.
My Lord, I am really sorry but the roads are unsafe at the moment. Merchants cannot travel to your town while the weather is this bad.
The roads are traversable again. A merchant will come to your town soon.
Lord, if you need resources urgently, you should buy them at the marketplace once a merchant is in town.
Very good, my Lord. Now we have the necessary tools in stock.
Buy some tools at the market
In the needs tab of the happiness menu, you can see the effects of insufficient food resources of the town, my Liege.

Lord, we ran out of food!

Just like water, food is a basic need of our people and has a big impact on the happiness in town.

The people won't be very happy to hear about it.
Since our farms won't produce any wheat in winter, you should expand or change our food production. A hunter can go into the woods and hunt for game.
Excellent, my Liege. Having several food producing buildings is essential, especially in the winter when we won't produce wheat.
My Lord, we are running out of wood.\n\nSince we need wood for the construction of buildings and many production chains, including the sawmill, it would be wise to build another forester's hut.
Very good, my Liege. It is always advisable to have a steady supply of wood in town.
Lord, the treasury is empty. In order to get some coin, we can do several things…
We could also increase the taxes. Take a look at the books, my Lord.
We can increase the tax yield in the village by building more houses, My Lord. More people means more tax yields.
But remember, having more villagers also means a higher demand for food and other consumer goods.\n
My Lord, we need tools for the construction of advanced buildings like the tavern.
We could produce the tools ourselves or buy them. To produce them, we need to establish the necessary production chain. In the long-term, it is always better to produce the goods ourselves.
With a market in town, you should sell some goods and make some profit, my Liege!
Very good, my Lord. Now we have some coin in the treasury again.
My Lord, winter is here! I hope we have enough wheat in our warehouses to last until spring.
While the winter lasts, we could change our farm production output to wool. We just need a sheep pasture and order the farmer to change his production output to wool.
You can find all possible actions and button assignments in the action bar.
You can select actions on the action bar directly.
Carrier townies will transport goods from building stocks to the castle.
Working villagers get tired eventually. They stop their work and spend some free time visiting public buildings, their home or decorations.
As long as a villager is spending some free time, he will not be producing any resources. He will continue to work after he has recovered.
Select the building and unassign a worker from it.
Objects like trees or streets can be removed in the erase mode.
Reassign workers like the farmer back to the building in spring, to harvest wheat again.
The farmer can't harvest wheat in the winter. Assign him to somewhere else, while there is snow.
A firefighter can only extinguish fires in the area covered by his tower.
Hungry villagers can take food directly from the building or the warehouses.
The more flames there are on a burning building, the further the fire has progressed and the building collapses.
Always have an eye on your food supplies!
Free workers are shown here.
The happiness is very low. Try to satisfy more needs and desires or decrease taxes!
When Townies lose their home, they will leave the town after a while.
The amount of coins in the treasury is displayed here.
Collected prestige is shown here.
This is an ore deposit. Mines placed here can extract iron ore.
This mine can yield stone or iron ore.
This ore deposit is depleted!
The treasury is empty! Increase taxes, trade goods or build more houses!
There are no free workers in town!
Buildings without workers assigned to them are inactive. Assign a worker for the production to continue.
In the context menu of the construction site, it can be completed instantly.
Use Instant build to finish the construction site immediately.
The building needs repairs!
Buildings might burn down and collapse if they are not repaired from time to time.
Try to building the sawmill near a forester's hut. The transport routes are shorter this way.
The season clock shows the progress of the current season.
Assign a worker to harvest wool at the sheep pasture.
Signposts mark places where a building once stood. You can select a signpost to rebuild the building at that spot.
Here you can adjust the amount of money, the villagers pay you in taxes. Always keep in mind that high taxes decrease happiness and productivity.
All important functions are accessible via the toolbar.
Townies will visit their homes in their free time. Townettes will collect food, water and other resources for their homes.
Houses generate taxes over time which represents the basic income for the town.
Use the quick menu if you want to follow the worker of a building. Hold the select button and move the stick up while over the building.
When waiting for a construction to be finished, try to follow the worker to see what is going on.
Use the quick menu to track the worker. Alternatively, the function can be accessed via the context menu in the actions.
Use the quick menu to track a worker. Press and hold on the building and drag up when the quick menu opens.
Here you can see your current tasks and their rewards.
A reward can be claimed in the quest menu.
Select the notification to directly go to the completed task. There you can claim your reward.
In the quest tab of the game menu, the reward for the task can be collected. By selecting the notification the menu can be accessed, too.
In the trade menu, you can exchange goods with the merchant. He can only buy and sell a limited amount of goods per visit.
The warehouses list all resources that are stored in town. As you can see, we only have a small amount of fish.
Your villagers can get water for their homes at the well. A well provides for 25 families.
In winter, all your fields will wither in the cold.
Research permanently grants your town bonuses. Research is activated globally, this way you don’t have to research it separately in every town.
In the research menu “population”, you can find research for the geologist.
